module DecFact
    export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

    function dec_2_fact_string(num)::String
        x = ['0':'9'; 'A':'Z']
        encode = Dict(i-1 => x[i] for i = 1:length(x))
        
    
        fact_rep(num, 1)|>
            (ns -> map(n -> encode[n], ns)) |>
            join   
    end
    
    function fact_rep(n, radix)
        m = n ÷ radix
        if (m == 0) 
            return(n % radix)
        else
            return [fact_rep(m, radix + 1); n % radix] 
        end
    end
        
    function fact_string_2_dec(str):: BigInt
        x = ['0':'9'; 'A':'Z']
        decode = Dict(x[i] => i-1 for i = 1:length(x))
    
        ds = collect(str) |>
            (cs -> map(c -> decode[c], cs))
    
        zip(length(ds)-1:-1:0, ds) |>
            (t -> map(place_value, t)) |>
            sum  
    end
    
    function place_value((pos_val, mult_val))
        factorial(pos_val) * mult_val
    end

end

module DecFact
    export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

code = "0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"


function dec_2_fact_string(nb)::String
  # 先找最大的基
  max_base = 1
  while factorial(big(max_base + 1)) <= nb
    max_base += 1
  end

  # 从大到小，确定每个基对应的系数
  factors = ""
  for base ∈ [max_base:-1:0...]
    factors *= code[nb÷factorial(big(base))+1]
    nb %= factorial(big(base))
  end

  factors
end




function fact_string_2_dec(str)::BigInt
  factors = findfirst.(collect(str), code) .- 1 |> reverse
  [x * factorial(i - 1) for (i, x) ∈ enumerate(factors)] |> sum
end



end

module DecFact
    export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

    function dec_2_fact_string(nb)::String
        facts = Dict(zip(collect(0:35), vcat(collect('0':'9'), collect('A':'Z'))))
        i, fact = 1, ""
        while nb ÷ i != 0
            nb, f = divrem(nb, i)
            fact = facts[f] * fact
            i += 1
        end
        facts[nb % i] * fact
    end
    
    function fact_string_2_dec(str):: BigInt
        decis = Dict(zip(vcat(collect('0':'9'), collect('A':'Z')), collect(0:35)))
        sum(factorial(i-1) * decis[v] for (i, v) in enumerate(reverse(str)))
    end
end

module DecFact
    export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

    function dec_2_fact_string(nb)::String
        x = nb
        j = 1
        ret = []
        while x>0
          push!(ret, x%j)
          x = fld(x, j)
          j += 1
        end
        return join((x<10 ? string(x) : (Char('A'+x-10)) for x in reverse(ret)), "")
    end
    
    function fact_string_2_dec(str):: BigInt
        ret = big(0)
        j = 0
        b = 1
        for c in reverse(str)
          ret += parse(Int, c, base=36)*b
          j += 1
          b *= j
        end
        return ret
    end

end

module DecFact
export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

function dec_2_fact_string(nb)::String
  n = 1
  
  digchrs = []
  while nb > 0
    nb, r = divrem(nb, n)
    pushfirst!(digchrs, r < 10 ? '0' + r : 'A' + r - 10)
    n += 1
  end
  
  return join(digchrs)
end

function fact_string_2_dec(str)::BigInt
  curfac = 1
  n = 1
  tot = 0
  for chr in str[(end-1):-1:begin]
    dig = isletter(chr) ? 10 + chr - 'A' : parse(Int, chr)
    tot += curfac * dig
    n += 1
    curfac *= n
  end
  return tot
end

end

module DecFact
    export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

    function dec_2_fact_string(nb)::String
        # your code
        stack = []
        x = 0
        while true
            value = factorial(big(x))
            if nb > value
                push!(stack, value)
            else
                break
            end
            x += 1
        end
  
        result  = []
        for _ in 1:length(stack)
            fac = pop!(stack)
            add = Int(floor(nb/fac))
            if add < 10
                push!(result, add)
            else 
                push!(result, Char(65 + add - 10))
            end
            nb = nb % fac
        end
        return join(result)
    end
    
    function fact_string_2_dec(str):: BigInt
        result = 0
        str = reverse(str)
        for x in 1:length(str)
            value = tryparse(Int, str[x:x])
            if value != nothing
                add = value*factorial(x - 1)
            else
                add = (Int(str[x]) - 55)*factorial(x - 1)
            end
            result += add
        end
        return result
    end

end

module DecFact
    export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

    function dec_2_fact_string(nb)::String
        d = 0  # counter for divisions
        res = Int[] # array with rests of division
        # Devide nb until 0, save rests
        while nb > 0
            d += 1
            nb, r = divrem(nb, d)
            push!(res, r)
        end
        res = replace(string.(res), "10" => "A", "11" => "B", "12" => "C", "13" => "D", 
            "14" => "E", "15" => "F", "16" => "G", "17" => "H", "18" => "I", "19" => "J", 
            "20" => "K", "21" => "L", "22" => "M", "23" => "N", "24" => "O", "25" => "P", 
            "26" => "Q", "27" => "R", "28" => "S", "29" => "T", "30" => "U", "31" => "V", 
            "32" => "W", "33" => "X", "34" => "Y", "35" => "Z")
        # Inverse order of rests is the factorial number
        join(reverse(res))
    end
    
    function fact_string_2_dec(str):: BigInt
        nb = 0
        str = replace(split(reverse(str),""), "A" => "10", "B" => "11", "C" => "12", "D" => "13",
            "E" => "14", "F" => "15", "G" => "16", "H" => "17", "I" => "18", "J" => "19", 
            "K" => "20", "L" => "21", "M" => "22", "N" => "23", "O" => "24", "P" => "25",
            "Q" => "26", "R" => "27", "S" => "28", "T" => "29", "U" => "30", "V" => "31",
            "W" => "32", "X" => "33", "Y" => "34", "Z" => "35")
        for (i, c) in enumerate(str[2:end])
          nb += parse(Int, c)*factorial(i)
        end
        return nb
    end

end

module DecFact
  export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

  function dec_2_fact_string(nb)::String
    factors = []
    quo = nb
    i = 1
    while quo > 0
      rem = quo % i
      quo = div(quo, i)
      if rem > 9
        rem = Char(Int('A') - 10 + rem)
      end
      push!(factors, rem)
      i += 1
    end    
    join(reverse(factors))
  end
  
  function fact_string_2_dec(str):: BigInt
    sum(enumerate(reverse(str))) do (i, s)
      c = first(s)
      value = isdigit(c) ? parse(Int, c) : Int(c) - Int('A') + 10
      factorial(i - 1) * value
    end
  end

end

module DecFact
    export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

    function dec_2_fact_string(nb)::String
        
        function letter(x)
            if x <= 9
                return string(x)
            else
            
                y = Char(Int('A'))+x-10
                return y
            end
        end
        resu = ""
        n = 1
        f = BigInt(1)
        while true
            if f * (n+1)> nb
                break
            else 
                n += 1
                f *= n
            end
        end
        fnb = nb
        for i in n:-1:1
            if fnb <=0
                resu = string(resu, '0')
            else 
                d, fnb = divrem(fnb, f)
        
                ds = letter(d)
                resu = string(resu, ds)
                f = f ÷ i
            end
        end
        resu = string(resu, '0')
        return resu
    end
    function fact_string_2_dec(str):: BigInt
        n = 0
        f = BigInt(1)
        resu = 0
        for i in length(str)-1:-1:1
            n += 1
            f = f * n
            si = str[i]
            if isdigit(si)
                d = Int(si) - Int('0')
            else
                d = Int(si) - Int('A') + 10
            end
            resu = resu + d * f
        end
        return resu
    end
end

module DecFact
    export dec_2_fact_string, fact_string_2_dec

    Base36 = "0123456789ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"

    function dec_2_fact_string(nb)::String
        l=["0"]
        c, tmp = 2, 0
        while nb != 0
            tmp = rem(nb, c)
            pushfirst!(l, string(Base36[tmp + 1]))
            nb = div((nb - tmp), c)
            c += 1
        end
        join(l)
    end
    
    function fact_string_2_dec(str):: BigInt
        l, r = length(str), BigInt(0)
        for i in 1:l - 1
            ndx = findfirst(isequal(str[i]), Base36)
            r = (r + ndx - 1) * (l - i)
        end
        r
    end

end

module Egypt
    export decompose

    function decompose(n)
        n = rationalize(eval(Meta.parse(n))/1.0)
        n == 0 && return []
        arr = div(numerator(n),denominator(n)) == 0 ? [] : [string(div(numerator(n),denominator(n)))]
        n = n - div(numerator(n),denominator(n))
        while numerator(n) != 0
            numer, denom = BigInt(numerator(n)), BigInt(denominator(n))
            push!(arr,"1/$(Int(ceil(denom/numer)))")
            n = BigInt(mod(-denom,numer))//(denom*BigInt(ceil(denom/numer)))
        end
        arr
    end

end

module Egypt
    export decompose
    function decompose(n)
        r = split(n, "/")
        a = 0.0
        b = 1.0
        ans = []
        if size(r)[1] == 1
            a = parse(Float64, n)
        else
            a = parse(Float64, r[1])
            b = parse(Float64, r[2])
        end
        while mod(a, 1) > 0
            a *= 10
            b *= 10
        end
        while a >= b
            d = floor(a) ÷ floor(b)
            push!(ans, string(convert(Int64, d)))
            a = mod(a, b)
        end
        while a > 0
            d = ceil(b / a)
            push!(ans, "1/" * string(convert(Int64, d)))
            a = a * d - b
            b *= d
        end
        ans
    end
end

module Egypt
  export decompose

  # Hey, I wrote this! Cool!
  # using EgyptianFractions

  # Safely parse the number
  function parserational(s)
    v = split(s, "/"; limit=2)
    length(v) == 2 && return parse(Int, v[1]) // parse(Int, v[2])
    rationalize(parse(Float64, s))
  end
      
  function greedy(r::Rational)
    r == 0 && return []
    r >= 1 && return vcat(string(Int(floor(r))), greedy(r - floor(r))...)
    c = 1//ceil(1//r)
    vcat("$(numerator(c))/$(denominator(c))", greedy(r - c)...)
  end

  decompose(n) = greedy(parserational(n))
end

module Egypt
    export decompose

    function rationalize(x;sigdigits=16)
       return Int(round(x*10^(sigdigits-1),digits=0))//10^(sigdigits-1)
     end

    function decompose(n)
      if contains(n, ".")
        current = parse(Float64, n)
        current = rationalize(current)
      elseif contains(n, "/")
        num, denom = map(x -> parse(Int64, x), split(n, "/"))
        current = num // denom
      else
        current = parse(Int64, n) // 1
      end
    
      res = []
      while current > 0
        if current >= 1
          to_subtract = numerator(floor(current))
          push!(res, string(to_subtract))
        else
          greatest = ceil(1 / current)
          to_subtract = 1//greatest
          num, den = numerator(to_subtract), denominator(to_subtract)
          push!(res, join(map(string, [num, den]), "/"))
        end
        current -= to_subtract
      end
      
      return res
    end
end

module Egypt
    export decompose

    """
    Given a rational number n, decomposes this number as a sum of rationals with numerators
    equal to one and without repetitions: Egyptian Fraction.
    """
    function decompose(n)
    
        # check on the format and split n into a nominator and denominator
        if occursin("/", n)
    
            nom, denom = split(n, "/")
            nom, denom = parse(Int, nom), parse(Int, denom)
    
        elseif occursin(".", n)
    
            decimal_len = length(split(n, ".")[2])
            num = parse(Float64, n*"e+$decimal_len")
            nom, denom = Int(num) , 10^decimal_len
    
        else
  
          nom, denom = parse(Int, n), 1
  
      end
  
  
      # Fibonacci's algorithm
  
      # initialise
      egyption_fraction = Array{String}([])
      remainder = nom // denom
  
      # get multiples if input is larger or equal than 1
      if remainder >= 1
          div, remainder = divrem(remainder, 1)
          push!(egyption_fraction, "$div")
  
          # get nominator and denominator
          nom, denom = split(string(remainder), "//")
          nom, denom = parse(Int, nom), parse(Int, denom)
      end
  
      # while there is a fraction left, continue calculations of egyption fraction
      while remainder != 0
  
          # calculate greedy fraction
          ratio = ceil(Int, denom // nom)
          push!(egyption_fraction, "1/$ratio")
  
          # calculate remainder
          up = mod(-denom, nom) # Int64 overflow prevention in codewars
          down1 = denom // nom # Int64 overflow prevention in codewars
          down12 = Int128(ceil(down1)) # Int64 overflow prevention in codewars
          down2 = Int128(denom * down12) # Int64 overflow prevention in codewars
          remainder =  up // down2 # Int64 overflow prevention in codewars
  
          # get nominator and denominator
          nom, denom = split(string(remainder), "//")
          nom, denom = parse(Int, nom), parse(Int, denom)
  
      end
  
      return egyption_fraction

end
end

module Egypt
    export decompose

    function readnum(s::String)
        expr = Meta.parse(s)

        if expr isa Number
            return expr
        elseif (expr isa Expr) && (expr.head === :call)
            (op, x, y) = expr.args

            if (op === :/) || (op === ://)
                return x // y
            end
        end
    end

    function writenum(n)
        x = numerator(n)
        y = denominator(n)

        return (y == 1) ? "$x" : "$x/$y"
    end

    function decompose(n::Rational)
        n0 = floor(n)
        n -= n0
        result = (n0 > 0) ? [n0] : []

        if iszero(n)
           return result
        end

        while numerator(n) != 1
            f = inv(floor(inv(n)) + 1)
            push!(result, f)
            n -= f 
        end

        push!(result, n)

        return result
    end

    decompose(n::Integer) = (n > 0) ? [n] : []
    decompose(n::Real) = decompose(rationalize(n))
    decompose(s::String) = [writenum(n) for n in decompose(readnum(s))]
end

module Egypt
    export decompose

    function decompose(n)
        n = rationals(n)
        n == 0 && return []
        arr = div(numerator(n),denominator(n)) == 0 ? [] : [string(div(numerator(n),denominator(n)))]
        n = n - div(numerator(n),denominator(n))
        while numerator(n) != 0
            numer, denom = BigInt(numerator(n)), BigInt(denominator(n))
            push!(arr,"1/$(Int(ceil(denom/numer)))")
            n = BigInt(mod(-denom,numer))//(denom*BigInt(ceil(denom/numer)))
        end
        arr
    end

    function rationals(x;exp=15)
        if '.' in x
            return BigInt(round(parse(BigFloat,x)*10^(exp-1),digits=0))//10^(exp-1)
        elseif '/' in x
            return parse(BigInt,split(x,"/")[1])//parse(BigInt,split(x,"/")[2])
        end
        return parse(Int,x)
    end

end

module Egypt
    export decompose

    function to_rational(n)::Rational
        num = eval(Meta.parse(n))
        num = if isinteger(num)
            Int(num)//1
        else
            rationalize(num)
        end
        return num
    end

    function decompose(n)
        res = String[]
        num = to_rational(n)
        if Float64(num) > 1.0
            next = round(Int, Float64(num), RoundDown)
            push!(res, string(next))
            num -= next
        end
        while num > 0
            next = round(BigInt, Float64(1/num), RoundUp)
            num -= 1//next
            push!(res, next == 1 ? string(next) : "1/$next")
        end
        return res
    end
end

module Egypt
  export decompose

  function decompose(n)  
    r = rational_n(n)
    v = String[]
    m = 1

    while r > 0
      if r > 1
        push!(v, rational_string(floor(r)))
        r -= floor(r)
        m = 2
      elseif r == 1
        push!(v, "1")
        r = 0//1
      elseif r - 1//m ≥ 0
        r -= 1//m
        push!(v, rational_string(1//m))
        if numerator(r) > 0
          m = ceil(Int64, denominator(r)/numerator(r))
        else
          m = denominator(r)
        end
      else
        m += 1
      end
    end
    return v
  end

  function rational_n(n::String)
    if occursin("/",n)
      a = split(n, "/")
      return parse(Int64,a[1]) // parse(Int64, a[2])
    else
      return rationalize(parse(Float64, n))
    end
  end

  function rational_string(n::Rational)
    num = numerator(n)
    den = denominator(n)
    if num == 0
        return
    elseif den == 1
        return string(num)
    else
        return "$num/$den"
    end
  end
end

module Egypt
  export decompose

  # Hey, I wrote this! Cool!
  # using EgyptianFractions

  # Safely parse the number
  function parserational(s)
    v = split(s, "/"; limit=2)
    length(v) == 2 && return parse(Int, v[1]) // parse(Int, v[2])
    decimal = findfirst(".", s)
    decimal == nothing && return parse(Int, s) // 1
    nd = length(s) - first(decimal)
    parse(Int, replace(s, "." => "")) // 10^nd
  end
      
  function greedy(r::Rational)
    r == 0 && return []
    r >= 1 && return vcat(string(Int(floor(r))), greedy(r - floor(r))...)
    c = 1//ceil(1//r)
    vcat("$(numerator(c))/$(denominator(c))", greedy(r - c)...)
  end

  decompose(n) = greedy(parserational(n))
end

        if length(cubics) > 0
            string( join(map(x->string(x," "),cubics)), sum(cubics), " Lucky" )
        else
            "Unlucky"
        end

        cubics::Vector{Int} = []
        index = 1
        while index <= length(s)

                    push!(cubics,number)
                end
                index = m.offset + length(m.match)

    if length(n) == 1
      return n == "0" || n == "1"
    end
    res = 0

    end

        (n == 0 || n == 1) && return true

        while m != 0

            m = m ÷ 10
        end
        return s == n

      counter = 0
      pi = 1
      while pi * 4 > π + epsilon || pi * 4 < π - epsilon
        counter += 1
        if counter % 2 == 0 
          pi += (1.0 / ((counter * 2) + 1))

module PiApprox
    export iter_pi

    """
    A function to approximate π. Returns a tuple with the number of iterations and the approximation
    up to 10 decimals.
    
    Approximation method using the following infinite series (Leibniz 1646–1716):
    
    π/4 = ∑_{n ∈ ℕ} (1/(4n + 1) - 1/(4n + 3))  
    """
    function iter_pi(ε)
    
        # initialise
        n = 1   # denominator
        π′ = 1/n # π approximation
        sign = 1 # also counts iterations
    
        # loop while the difference between π approximation and π are strictly larger than ε
        while sqrt((π′*4 - π)^2) > ε # first squaring and then taking the root, only to get rid of the sign
            n += 2 # increase denominator by steps of 2
            # as axxproximation method uses alternatingly addiation and subtraction, we decided based on the
            # current iteration
            if isodd(sign)
                π′ -= 1/n
            else
                π′ += 1/n
            end
            sign += 1 # update counter
    
        end

        return sign, round(π′*4, digits=10) # rounding just to fit test cases
  
    end
end

    function iter_pi(epsilon)
        q = 1.0
        inexPi = 0.0
        counter = 0
        while abs(1.0 * π - 4.0 * inexPi) > epsilon
            counter += 1
            inexPi += (-1.0)^(counter - 1) / q
            q += 2.0
        end
        (counter, round(4.0 * inexPi,digits=10))
    end

end

        pi4 = 1.0

        while abs(4.0 * pi4 - pi) >= epsilon
            pi4 += sign * 1.0 / denom
            sign *= -1.0
            denom += 2.0
            iterations += 1
        end
        (iterations, round(4.0 * pi4 * 1e10) / 1e10)
    end

end

module PiApprox
export iter_pi

function iter_pi(epsilon)
  π_approx = 0
  n = 0
  while abs(π_approx - π) > epsilon
    n += 1
    π_approx += 4 / (2n - 1) * (iseven(n) ? -1 : 1)
  end
  return (n, round(π_approx; digits = 10))
end

end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc

    function dir_reduc(arr)
        ANNULATIONS = Dict(
            "NORTH"=>"SOUTH",
            "EAST"=>"WEST",
            "SOUTH"=>"NORTH",
            "WEST"=>"EAST"
        )
        stack = []
        for dir in arr
            if !isempty(stack) && stack[end] == ANNULATIONS[dir]
                pop!(stack)
            else
                push!(stack, dir)
            end
        end
        return stack
    end

end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc

    function dir_reduc(arr)
        a = join(arr, " ")
        aa = replace(replace(a, "NORTH SOUTH" => ""), "SOUTH NORTH" => "")
        aaa = replace(replace(aa, "EAST WEST" => ""), "WEST EAST" => "")
        ar = String.(split(aaa, " ", keepempty = false))
        length(ar) < length(arr) ? dir_reduc(ar) : ar
    end

end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc

    function dir_reduc(arr)
        rgx = r"(NORTH:SOUTH)|(SOUTH:NORTH)|(WEST:EAST)|(EAST:WEST)"
        str = join(arr, ':')
        while match(rgx, str) != nothing
            str = replace(replace(replace(str, rgx => ""), r":+" => ":"), r"(^:)|(:$)" => "")
        end
        split(str, ':')
    end

end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc
    
    OPPOSITE = Dict( 'N' => 'S', 'S' => 'N', 'W' => 'E', 'E' => 'W' )

    function dir_reduc(arr::Array{String})::Array{String}
        workbench = String[]
        sizehint!( workbench, length(arr) )
        for next in arr
            if !isempty(workbench) && next[1]==OPPOSITE[workbench[end][1]]
                pop!(workbench)
            else
                push!(workbench, next)
            end
        end
        workbench
    end

end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc

function dir_reduc(arr)

  stack = []

  for step ∈ arr
    if length(stack) == 0
      push!(stack, step)
    else
      if stack[end] == "NORTH" && step == "SOUTH"
        pop!(stack)
      elseif stack[end] == "SOUTH" && step == "NORTH"
        pop!(stack)
      elseif stack[end] == "EAST" && step == "WEST"
        pop!(stack)
      elseif stack[end] == "WEST" && step == "EAST"
        pop!(stack)
      else
        push!(stack, step)
      end
    end
  end

  stack
end

end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc

    function dir_reduc(arr)
      function fold_op(a,x)
        if length(a)==0
          return [x]
        end
        if Set([a[end], x]) in [Set(["NORTH","SOUTH"]), Set(["EAST", "WEST"])]
          return a[begin:end-1]
        else
          return [a; x]
        end
      end
      return foldl(fold_op, arr; init=[])
    end

end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc

    function opp(dir)
        if dir == "NORTH"
            return "SOUTH"
        elseif dir == "SOUTH"
            return "NORTH"
        elseif dir == "EAST"
            return "WEST"
        elseif dir == "WEST"
            return "EAST"
        end
    end

    function dir_reduc(arr)
        arr_copy = []
        while arr_copy != arr
            arr_copy = copy(arr)
            for i in 1:length(arr)-1
                if opp(arr[i]) == arr[i+1]
                    deleteat!(arr, i)
                    deleteat!(arr, i)
                    break
                end
            end
        end
        return arr
    end

end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc

function dir_reduc(arr)
    dirMap = Dict("NORTH" => "SOUTH", "SOUTH" => "NORTH", "EAST" => "WEST", "WEST" => "EAST")
    res = Vector{String}()
    for i ∈ arr
        if !isempty(res) && dirMap[i] == res[end]
            pop!(res)
        else
            push!(res,i)
        end
    end
    res
end

end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc

    """
    Function to remove needless directional instructions. Takes an array of strings and returns an array of strings.
    """
    function dir_reduc(arr::Array{String,1})::Array{String,1}
        # initialise
        dir = Dict("NORTH" => "SOUTH", "SOUTH" => "NORTH", "EAST" => "WEST", "WEST" => "EAST") # dictionary for opposing directions
        dir_simplified = deepcopy(arr) # deepycopy array to modify later without changing input
    
        # loop over array to check opposing directions
        # restart loop as soon as two consecutive opposing directions have been found
        idx = 1 # start at index 1
        while idx < length(dir_simplified) # loop as long as index has not reached second to last posiiton of array
            
            # if the directional pair of the current index and the next following index are opposing
            if dir[dir_simplified[idx]] == dir_simplified[idx+1]
                deleteat!(dir_simplified, idx:idx+1) # delete both directions
                idx = 1 # loop from the first index again
            else # increase index to check next pair
                idx += 1
            end
        end
    
        return dir_simplified
    end
end

module Dir
    export dir_reduc

    function dir_reduc(arr)
    abbr = Dict([["NORTH","N"],["SOUTH","S"],["EAST","E"],["WEST","W"]])
    inv = Dict([['N', "NORTH"], ['S', "SOUTH"], ['E', "EAST"], ['W', "WEST"]])
    dirs = join([abbr[x] for x in arr])
    ann = ["NS", "SN", "EW", "WE"]
    global change = true
    while change
        if length(dirs) == 0
            change = false
        elseif length(dirs) == 1
            change = false
        else
            for i in 1:(length(dirs)-1)
                if true in [dirs[i:i+1] == d for d in ann]
                    dirs = dirs[1:i-1] * dirs[i+2:end]
                    global change = true
                    break
                else
                    print("here")
                    global change = false
                end
            end
        end
    end
    return [inv[x] for x in dirs]
    end

end

module Irr
    export sum_fracts

    function sum_fracts(l)
        if (l == []) return nothing end
        s = sum(map(x -> x[1]//x[2], l))
        d = denominator(s)
        if (d == 1) numerator(s) else [numerator(s), d] end
    end

end

module Irr
    export sum_fracts

    function sum_nd(a::Vector{Int64},b::Vector{Int64})
      n::Int64 = a[1]b[2]+a[2]b[1]
      d::Int64 = a[2]b[2]
      g = gcd(n,d) 
      if  g != 1
        n /= g
        d /= g
      end
      [n, d]
    end

    function sum_fracts(l)
      if(length(l)==0)
        return nothing
      end
      x = reduce(sum_nd, l)
      x[2]==1 ? x[1] : x
    end

end

module Irr
    export sum_fracts
    sum_fracts(l) = (isempty(l) ? nothing : ((v=sum((x)->Rational(x...),l)).den == 1) ? v.num : [v.num, v.den])
end

module Irr
    export sum_fracts

    function sum_fracts(l)
        if l == [] return nothing end
        fraction_list = []
        for i in 1:length(l) push!(fraction_list,l[i][1]//l[i][2])end
        result = sum(fraction_list)
        if denominator(result)== 1  numerator(result) else [numerator(result),denominator(result)] end
    end

end

module Irr
    export sum_fracts

    function sum_fracts(l)
        if l == []
          return 
        end
        fraction_list = []
        for i in 1:length(l)
          push!(fraction_list,l[i][1]//l[i][2])
        end
        result = sum(fraction_list)
        if denominator(result)== 1
          return numerator(result) 
        end
        return[numerator(result),denominator(result)]
    end

end

module Irr
    export sum_fracts

    function sum_fracts(l)
    if length(l) != 0
        while length(l) > 1
          i = length(l)
          new_numer = l[i][1] * l[i-1][2]  +  l[i-1][1] * l[i][2]
          new_denom = l[i][2] * l[i-1][2]
          pop!(l)
          pop!(l)
          push!(l,[new_numer , new_denom])
        end
        l = [ l[1][1],l[1][2] ]
        a = l[1]
        b = l[2]
        while b != 0
          h = mod(a,b)
          a = b
          b = h      
        end
        l = div.(l,a)  
    
      if l[2] == 1
      return l[1]
      end
      return l
    end
    end

end

module Irr
    export sum_fracts

    function sum_fracts(l)
        l == [] && return nothing
        denom = reduce(lcm, [n[2] for n in l])
        numer = sum([m[1]*div(denom,m[2]) for m in l])
        frac = [div(numer,gcd(numer, denom)), div(denom,gcd(numer, denom))]
        frac[2] == 1 ? frac[1] : frac
    end

end

module Irr
export sum_fracts

function sum_fracts(l)
  if l == []
    return nothing
  end
  result = sum(map((x) -> x[1] // x[2], l))
  n, d = numerator(result), denominator(result)
  d == 1 ? n : [n, d]
end

end

module Irr
    export sum_fracts

    function sum_fracts(l)
        try
            frac = sum(n//d for (n, d) in l)
            n = numerator(frac)
            d = denominator(frac)
       
            if d == 1
                n
            else
                [n, d]
            end
        catch e
            nothing
        end
    end

end

module Irr
    export sum_fracts

    function sum_fracts(lst)
        if length(lst) == 0
            nothing
        else
            xss = map(arr -> reduce(arr[1], arr[2]), lst)
            cd = BigInt(1)
            for (_, xs) in enumerate(xss)
                cd = lcm(xs[2], cd)
            end
            yss = map(xs -> [xs[1] * cd ÷ xs[2], cd], xss)
            n = 0
            for (_, ys) in enumerate(yss)
                n = n + ys[1]
            end
            d = yss[1][2]
            g = gcd(d, n)
            if d == g
                n ÷ d
            else
                [n ÷ g, d ÷ g]
            end
        end
    end

    function gcd(a, b)
        b == 0 ? a : gcd(b, mod(a, b))
    end

    function lcm(a, b)
        (a * b) ÷ gcd(a, b)
    end

    function reduce(a, b)
        i = gcd(a, b)
        [a ÷ i, b ÷ i]
    end

end

end

  filterfunc = odds >= 2 ? iseven : isodd
  index = findfirst(filterfunc, numbers)
  return numbers[index]
end

function find_outlier(numbers)

  i = n >= 2 ? findfirst(isodd, numbers) :

  numbers[i]

function find_outlier(numbers)
  
  evenQ = 0
  oddQ = 0
  
  for q in numbers[1:3]
    q % 2 == 0 ? evenQ += 1 : oddQ += 1
  end
  
  if evenQ > oddQ
    for q in numbers
      if abs(q) % 2 == 1
        return q
      end
    end
  else
    for q in numbers
      if abs(q) % 2 == 0
        return q
      end
    end
  end
  
end

function find_odd_or_even(numbers, remainder)
	for number in numbers
		abs(number % 2) == remainder && return number
	end
end

function find_outlier(numbers)
	even = 0
	odd = 0
	for number in numbers
		number % 2 == 0 ? even += 1 : odd +=1
		even > 1 && return find_odd_or_even(numbers, 1) 
		odd > 1 && return find_odd_or_even(numbers, 0)
	end
end

module Tour
    export tour

    function tour(friends, fTowns, distances)
        fT = Dict(fTowns)
        f = [friend for friend in friends if haskey(fT, friend)]
        dist = distances[fT[f[1]]]+distances[fT[last(f)]]
        [dist += distances[fT[f[i]]]*sin(acos(distances[fT[f[i-1]]]/distances[fT[f[i]]])) for i in 2:length(f)]
        trunc(dist)
    end

module Tour
    export tour

    function tour(friends, fTowns, distances)
        map = Dict(fTowns)
        fdist = [ distances[map[f]] for f in friends if f in keys(map) ]
  
        total = fdist[1] + fdist[end]
        for i in 1:size(fdist)[1]-1
            total += (fdist[i+1]^2 - fdist[i]^2)^0.5
        end
        return floor(Int, total)
    end

end

module Tour
  export tour

  function tour(friends, fTowns, distances)
    distanceXlast = 0.0
    totaldistance = 0.0
    distanceXnew = 0.0
    for friend in friends
      nTown = findfirst(x -> x[1]==friend, fTowns)
      if nTown != nothing
        distanceXnew = distances[fTowns[nTown][2]]
        totaldistance += √(distanceXnew^2 - distanceXlast^2)
        distanceXlast = distanceXnew
      end
    end
    totaldistance += distanceXlast
    return floor(Int64, totaldistance)

    export tour

function tour(friends, towns, distances)
    towns = Dict(towns)

    last = distances[towns[friends[1]]]
    len = last 

    for f in friends[2:end]
        if haskey(towns, f)
            dist = distances[towns[f]]
            len += sqrt(dist*dist - last*last)        
            last = dist
        end 
    end

    Int(floor(len + last))

    friend2town = Dict(k=>v for (k,v) in fTowns)

    dists = []

        push!(dists, distances[loc])
      else
        push!(dists, sqrt(distances[loc]^2 - distances[locs[i-1]]^2))

    push!(dists, distances[locs[end]])

module Bck
export backwards_prime

function backwards_prime(start, stop)
  is_prime(x) = x > 1 && all(n -> x % n != 0, 2:sqrt(x))
  function is_backwards_prime(x)
    y = parse(Int, reverse(string(x)))
    is_prime(x) && is_prime(y) && x != y
  end
  filter(is_backwards_prime, start:stop)
end

end

module Bck
    export backwards_prime

    function is_prime(n)
      if n==1 return false end
      if n==2 || n==3 return true end
      i = 2
      while i<=ceil(sqrt(n))
        if is_prime(i) && n%i==0
          return false
        end
        i += 1    
      end
      return true
    end

    function backwards_prime(start, stop)
      ans = []
      for i in start:1:stop
        if !is_prime(i) continue end
        a = string(i)
        b = reverse(a)
        if a==b continue end
        r = parse(Int, b)
        if is_prime(r) push!(ans, i) end    
      end
      ans
    end

end

module Bck
export backwards_prime

palindrome(num::Int64)::Int64 = parse(Int64, join(digits(num)))

function isprime(num::Int64)
    divnum = floor(Int64, sqrt(num))
    while divnum >= 1
        mod(num, divnum) == 0 ? (break; return false) : divnum -= 1
    end
    divnum == 1 && return true
end

function backwards_prime(num1::Int64, num2::Int64)
    res_list = Int64[]
    while num1 <= num2
        rev = palindrome(num1)
        flag = !isequal(rev, num1) && isprime(num1) && isprime(rev)
        flag && append!(res_list, num1)
        num1 += 1
    end
    return res_list
end

end

module Bck
  export backwards_prime

  function isprime(number)
    upper_limit = trunc(Int, sqrt(number)) + 1
    for i in 2:upper_limit
        if number % i == 0
            return false
        end
    end
    return true
  end

  function backwards_prime(start, stop)
    result = []
    for num = start:stop 
      if isprime(num) 
        # now check the backwards prime
        reverse_num = parse(Int64, reverse(string(num)))
        if reverse_num != num && isprime(reverse_num) 
         append!(result, num)
        end
      end
    end
    return result
  end

end

        [n for n in start:stop if n != parse(Int,join(digits(n))) && is_prime(n) && is_prime(parse(Int,join(digits(n))))]
    end
    
    function is_prime(n)
        for i in 2:n^0.5 n % i == 0 && return false end
        true
    end

module Bck
    export backwards_prime

function isprime(n)
    if n <= 3
        return n > 1
    elseif n % 2 == 0 || n % 3 == 0
        return false
    end
    i= 5
    while i^2 <= n
        if n % i == 0 || n % (i+2) == 0
            return false
        end
        i += 6
    end
    return true
end

function backwards_prime(start, stop)
    primes = []
    rprimes = []
    for p = start:stop
        rp = parse(Int, reverse(string(p)))
        if (p != rp) && !(p in rprimes) && isprime(p) && isprime(rp) 
            append!(primes, p)
            append!(rprimes, rp)
        end
    end
    return filter(x -> x>=start && x <=stop, sort(vcat(primes, rprimes)))
end

end

module Bck
    export backwards_prime

    function backwards_prime(start, stop)
        # your code
      function isprimi(n)
            n > 1 || return false
            n != 2 || return true
            isodd(n) || return false
            for i in 3:isqrt(n)
                n % i != 0 || return false
            end
            true
        end
      if iseven(start)
        start += 1
      end
      if start < 11
        start = 11
      end
      list = Int64[]
      for i in [start:2:stop;]
        
        if isprimi(i)
          j = parse(Int64, reverse(string(i)))
          if isprimi(j) && j != i
            list = append!(list, [i])
            if j <= stop && j >= start
              list = append!(list, [j])
            end
          end
        end
      end
      return(sort!(unique!(list)))
    end

end

module Bck
    export backwards_prime

    function digits2integer(a)
      x = reduce(string, reverse(a))
      if length(a)==1
        return x
      end
      parse(Int, x)
    end

    function reverseDigits(n)
      digits2integer(reverse(digits(n)))
    end

    function isPalindromic(n)
      reverseDigits(n) == n
    end

    function isPrime(n)
      if n % 2 == 0
        return n == 2
      elseif n % 3 == 0
        return n == 3
      else
        i = 5
        while i * i <= n
          if n % i == 0 || n % (i + 2) == 0
            return false
          end
          i += 6
        end
      end
      true
    end

    function backwards_prime(start, stop)
      res = []
      for n in start:stop
        if isPrime(n) && !isPalindromic(n) && isPrime(reverseDigits(n))
          push!(res, n)
        end
      end
      res
    end

end

module Bck
  export backwards_prime
  
  function prime(n)
    if n < 4
      return true
    end
    for i in 2:floor(sqrt(n))
      if n % i == 0
        return false
      end
    end
    true
  end

  function rev(n)
    parse(Int, join(digits(n)))
  end

  function backwards_prime(start, stop)
    ret = []
    for i in start:stop
      j = rev(i)
      if i != j && prime(i) && prime(j)
        push!(ret, i)
      end
    end
    ret
  end
end

module Bck
export backwards_prime

primes = Set(2)
function isprime!(primes, i)
  i <= 1 && return false
  iseven(i) && return false
  i in primes && return true
  for j in 3:2:isqrt(i)
    i%j == 0 && return false
  end
  push!(primes, i)
  true
end
      

function backwards_prime(start, stop)
  revint(x) = parse(Int, reverse(string(x)))
  bprime(x) = begin
    y = revint(x)
    (x != y) & isprime!(primes, x) & isprime!(primes, y)
  end
  filter(bprime, start:stop)
end

end

function fib2(n::Int64)::Tuple{Int64,Int64}

    return aₙ, aₙ₊₁

    k = 1
    while true

module PF
    export product_fib

        i1 = i2 = 1
  
        while i1*i2>0 && i1*i2<prod
          tmp = i2
          i2 = i1+i2
          i1 = tmp
        end

module PF
    export product_fib

function fib(n)
    a, b = 0, 1
    res = [a, b]
   for i in 1:n-2
        b += a
        a = b - a
        push!(res, b)
        if b > n
          return res
        end
    end
    return res       
end

    function product_fib(prod)
        fibs = fib(prod)

        for i in 2:length(fibs)
            test_prod = big(fibs[i-1]) * big(fibs[i])
            if test_prod == prod
                return (fibs[i-1], fibs[i], true)
            elseif test_prod > prod
                return (fibs[i-1], fibs[i], false)   
            end
        end
    end

end

module PF
    export product_fib

    function product_fib(prod)
      m, n = 0, 1
      if prod == 0
        return m, n, true
      end
      f, g = big.([0 1; 1 1]), big.([0 1; 1 1])
      while true
        m, n = n, f[2,2]
        if m*n > prod
          return m, n, false
        elseif m*n == prod
          return m, n, true
        end
        f *= g
      end
    end

end

function is_divisible(n, x, y)
  if x == 0 || y == 0
    return false
  end
  
  if n % x == 0 && n % y == 0
    return true
  else
    return false
  end
 end

            []
        elseif a == b

    export sq_in_rect

    function sq_in_rect(a, b)
      if a==b
        return []  
      end
    
      if b>a
        return sq_in_rect(b,a)
      end

      sqs = []
      while true

        r = a % b

        a, b = b, r

module Sq
    export sq_in_rect

    function sq_in_rect_sub(a, b)
      if a == b
        return [a]
      end

      if a > b
        return vcat([b], sq_in_rect_sub(a - b, b))
      end
      vcat([a], sq_in_rect_sub(b - a, a))
    end

    function sq_in_rect(a, b)
      a == b ? [] : sq_in_rect_sub(a, b)
    end

        a != b || return
        a, b = max(a, b), min(a, b)

        return [(ones(Integer,a ÷ b) * b)..., sq_in_rect(b, a % b)...]
    end

    export sq_in_rect

    function sq_in_rect(a, b)
        if a==b  return([]) end
        lens=Int64[]
        sq_in_rect_recc!(lens,a,b)
        return lens
    end
    function sq_in_rect_recc!(lens,a,b)
        a,b=minmax(a,b)
        push!(lens,a)
        if a!=b
          sq_in_rect_recc!(lens,a,b-a)
        end
    end

    export remove_nb

    # return a Tuple{Int64,Int64}[]
    function remove_nb(n)
        s0 = div(n*(n+1), 2)
        i = 1
        j = n
        res = Tuple{Int64, Int64}[]
  
        while i < j
          v = i * j + i + j
          if v < s0
            i += 1
          elseif v > s0
            j -= 1
          else
            push!(res, (i, j))
            push!(res, (j, i))
            i += 1
            j -= 1
          end
        end
  
        sort(res, by = item -> item[1])
    end

module Car
    export nb_months

    function nb_months(startPriceOld, startPriceNew, savingperMonth, percentLossByMonth)
        priceDelta = startPriceNew-startPriceOld
        lossFactor = 1 - percentLossByMonth/100
        saving = 0
        month = 0
        while saving < priceDelta
            month += 1
            saving += savingperMonth
            priceDelta *= lossFactor
            if isodd(month)
                lossFactor -= 0.5/100
            end
        end
        [month, round(Int,saving-priceDelta)]
    end

end

module Car
    export nb_months

    function nb_months(startPriceOld, startPriceNew, savingperMonth, percentLossByMonth)
        mth = 0
        priceOld = startPriceOld
        priceNew = startPriceNew
        available = startPriceOld
        while (available < priceNew)
            # at the end of this month
            mth += 1
            if (mth % 2 == 0)
                percentLossByMonth += 0.5
            end
            priceOld = priceOld * (100.0 - percentLossByMonth)  / 100.0
            priceNew = priceNew * (100.0 - percentLossByMonth)  / 100.0
            available = mth * savingperMonth + priceOld
        end
        [mth, Int(round(available - priceNew))]
    end

end

module Car
    export nb_months

    function nb_months(startPriceOld, startPriceNew, savingperMonth, percentLossByMonth)
        mth = 0
        priceOld = startPriceOld
        priceNew = startPriceNew
        available = startPriceOld
        while (available < priceNew)
            # at the end of this month
            mth += 1
            if (mth % 2 == 0)
                percentLossByMonth += 0.5
            end
            priceOld = priceOld * (100.0 - percentLossByMonth)  / 100.0
            priceNew = priceNew * (100.0 - percentLossByMonth)  / 100.0
            available = mth * savingperMonth + priceOld
        end
        [mth, Int(round(available - priceNew))]
    end

end

module Car
  export nb_months

  function nb_months(p0i, p1i, s, rd)
    p0 = p0i
    p1 = p1i
    r = rd
    m = 0
    while p0 + m * s < p1
      if m % 2 == 1
        r = r + 0.5
      end
      p0 = p0 - p0 * 0.01 * r
      p1 = p1 - p1 * 0.01 * r
      m = m + 1
    end
    [m, round(p0 + m * s - p1)]
  end
end

module Car
    export nb_months

    function nb_months(startPriceOld, startPriceNew, savingperMonth, percentLossByMonth)
    cardiff = startPriceOld - startPriceNew
    check = cardiff
    i = 1

    while check < 0
        cardiff = cardiff * (100 - percentLossByMonth - 0.5 * floor(i / 2)) / 100
        check = cardiff + savingperMonth * i 
        i += 1
    end
    [round(Int32, i - 1), round(Int32, check)]
    end

end

module Car
    export nb_months

    function nb_months(startPriceOld, startPriceNew, savingperMonth, percentLossByMonth)
        saving = 0
        m = 1
        while (saving+startPriceOld) < startPriceNew
          if m%2 == 0
            percentLossByMonth += 0.5
          end
    
          saving += savingperMonth
          startPriceOld *= (1 - percentLossByMonth/100)
          startPriceNew *= (1 - percentLossByMonth/100)
          m += 1
        end
        return [m-1, Int64(round(saving+startPriceOld-startPriceNew))]
    end

end

module Car
    export nb_months

    function nb_months(startPriceOld, startPriceNew, savingperMonth, percentLossByMonth)
      nb = 0
      while startPriceNew > startPriceOld + nb * savingperMonth
        nb += 1
        iseven(nb) && (percentLossByMonth += 0.5)
        startPriceNew *= (1 - percentLossByMonth/100)
        startPriceOld *= (1 - percentLossByMonth/100)
      end
      return [nb, round(Integer, nb*savingperMonth + startPriceOld - startPriceNew)]
    end

end

module Car
    export nb_months

    function nb_months(startPriceOld, startPriceNew, savingperMonth, percentLossByMonth)
      savings = 0
      count = 0
      while startPriceOld + savings < startPriceNew
        startPriceOld *= (100 - percentLossByMonth) / 100 
        startPriceNew *= (100 - percentLossByMonth) / 100
        savings += savingperMonth
        count += 1
        if count % 2 == 1
          percentLossByMonth += 0.5
        end
      end
      return [round(count), round(startPriceOld + savings - startPriceNew)]
    end

end

module Car
    export nb_months

    function nb_months(startPriceOld, startPriceNew, savingperMonth, percentLossByMonth)
        if startPriceOld >= startPriceNew
          return [0, startPriceOld-startPriceNew]
        else
          assets = startPriceOld - startPriceNew
          savings = assets
          deposits = 0
          m = 0
          while savings <=0
            m +=1
            
            if m %2 ==0
              percentLossByMonth +=0.5
            end
            deposits += savingperMonth
            assets = assets*(1-(percentLossByMonth/100))
            savings = deposits +assets
            
          end
          return [m,round(Int64,savings)]
        end
    end

end

module Car
    export nb_months

    function nb_months(startPriceOld, startPriceNew, savingperMonth, percentLossByMonth)
        startPriceOld ≥ startPriceNew && return [0, startPriceOld - startPriceNew]
        savings, month = 0, 1
        while true
            startPriceOld *= 1 - percentLossByMonth / 100
            startPriceNew *= 1 - percentLossByMonth / 100
            savings += savingperMonth
            startPriceOld + savings ≥ startPriceNew && return [month, Int(round(startPriceOld + savings - startPriceNew))]
            isodd(month) && (percentLossByMonth += 0.5)
            month += 1
        end
    end

end

# as per the tip: x^2-4*y^2 = (x-2y)*(x+2y) = z*(z+4y) with z=x-2y; i.e. z is a factor of n
# --> check if n is divisible by z, then solve and check if y exists

module Dioph
    export sol_equa

    function sol_equa(n)
        z_max = Int(floor(sqrt(n)))
        [ get_xy(n,z) for z in 1:z_max if solution_exists(n,z)] 
    end
    
    function solution_exists(n,z)
       divides(n,z) && y_is_Integer(n,z)
    end
    divides(n,z) = n%z==0
    y_is_Integer(n,z) = (n÷z-z)%4==0

    function get_xy(n,z)
      y=(n÷z-z)÷4
      x=z+2y
      return (x,y)
    end
end

module Dioph
    export sol_equa

    function sol_equa(n)
        #I though it would be funny to solve it in one line. It was.
        res = [(Int((Int(i)+Int(n/i))/2), Int((Int(n/i)-Int(i))/4)) for i in 1:floor(sqrt(n)) if n%i == 0 && ((n/i)+i)/2 == round(((n/i)+i)/2) && iseven(Int((n/i)-round(((n/i)+i)/2)))]
    end

end

module Dioph
    export sol_equa

    function sol_equa(n)
        solutions = []
        for d in [(n÷i, i) for i in 1:isqrt(n) if n % i == 0]
            y = (d[1]-d[2]) ÷ 4
            x = d[2] + 2y
            x^2 - 4y^2 == n && push!(solutions, (x, y))
        end
        sort!(solutions, rev=true)
    end

end

module Dioph
    export sol_equa

    # return a Tuple{Int64,Int64}[]
function sol_equa(n)
    result = Tuple{Int64,Int64}[]
    for i ∈ 1:round(sqrt(n),RoundDown)+1
        if n % i ≠ 0
            continue
        end
        j = n / i
        y = (j-i) / 4
        x = i + (2 * y)
        if x % 1 ≠ 0 || y % 1 ≠ 0
            continue
        end
        if x ≥ 0 && y ≥ 0 && (j == x + (2 * y)) && (i == x - (2 * y))
            push!(result, trunc.(Int64, Tuple([x,y])))
        end
    end
    return sort(result, rev=true)
end

end

module Dioph
    export sol_equa

    function sol_equa(n)
      res = []
      for i in 1:( ceil( Int, √n ) )
        if n % i == 0 && ( n ÷ i - i ) % 4 == 0
          j = n ÷ i 
          y = ( j - i ) ÷ 4
          push!( res, ( j - 2y, y ) )
        end
      end; res
    end

end

module Dioph
    export sol_equa

    
    function sol_equa(n)
      result = []
      y = []
	    for i in 1:floor(sqrt(n))
		     if mod(n,i) == 0
			      push!(y,((n/i)-i)/4)
	       end
	    end
      for i in 1:length(y)
           if mod(y[i],1) == 0
              push!(result,(sqrt(n+4*y[i]^2),y[i]))
           end
      end
      return result
    end

end

module Dioph
    export sol_equa

    function sol_equa(n)
        vec = Tuple{Int,Int}[]
        cap = ceil(Int,sqrt(n))
        g(x,y) = x^2 - 4y^2 == n
        for c = 1 : cap
            x = fld(n+c^2,2*c)
            if x < cap
                break
            elseif iseven(x) != iseven(n)
                continue
            end
            t = ceil(Int,sqrt((x/2)^2-n/4))
            if(g(x,t))
                push!(vec,(x,t))
            end
        end
        return unique!(vec)
    end
end

module Dioph
    export sol_equa

    # return a Tuple{Int64,Int64}[]
    function sol_equa(n)
        solutions = Tuple{Int64,Int64}[]
        for a in range(1, stop=floor(Int, √(n)))
            b = n ÷ a
            if a * b == n
                x = (a + b) ÷ 2
                y = (b - a) ÷ 4
                if x*x - 4*y*y - n == 0
                    push!(solutions, (x,y))
                end
            end
        end
        return solutions
    end

end

module Dioph
  export sol_equa

  function sol_equa(n)
    res = []
    for i in 1:n ^ 0.5
      d = n / i
      x = (d + i) / 2
      y = (d - i) / 4
      if (d % 1 == 0 && x % 1 == 0 && y % 1 == 0)
        push!(res, (Int64(floor(x)), Int64(floor(y))))
      end
    end
    res
  end

end

module Dioph
    export sol_equa

    # return a Tuple{Int64,Int64}[]
    function sol_equa(n)
        sol = []
        for z in Int64(1):Int64(round(sqrt(n)))
            n % z != 0 && continue
            w = n /z
            (w-z) % 4 == 0 && push!(sol, (Int64((w+z)/2), Int64((w-z)/4)))
        end
    return sol
    end

end

module Digits
    export dig_pow

    function dig_pow(n, p)
        a = sum(parse(Int32, x) ^ (i + p - 1) for (i, x) in enumerate(string(n))) / n
        a % 1 == 0 ? a : -1
    end

end

module Digits
    export dig_pow

    # Check if the digits of n when raised to
    # the p, p+1, p+2,... equals some integer factor
    function dig_pow(n, p)
        # Get digits in reverse order:
        #   e.g. n = 46288
        #        [8 8 2 6 4] -> [4 6 2 8 8]
        #        so the exponents map to the indices
        # Then sum each digit that's raised to the p, p+1, p+2,...
        # and divide it by the original number, n
        k = sum([d^(i+p-1) for (i,d) in enumerate(reverse(digits(n)))]) / n

        # Return k if it's an integer factor, -1 otherwise
        return isinteger(k) ? Int(k) : -1
    end
end

module Digits
  export dig_pow

  dig_pow(n, p) = digits(n) |> reverse |> enumerate |> x -> [e^(p+i-1) for (i, e) in x] |> sum |> s -> divrem(s, n) |> k -> (k[2] == 0 ? k[1] : -1)

end

module Digits
    export dig_pow
    #=
        Check if the digits of n when raised to the
        (p, p+1, p+2, ...) equals some integer factor
        Get digits in reverse order:
            e.g. n = 46288
                 [8 8 2 6 4] -> [4 6 2 8 8]
                 so the exponents map to the indices
        Then sum each digit that's raised to the p, p+1, p+2,...
        and divide it by the original number, n.
        Return k if it's an integer factor, -1 otherwise.
    =#
    function dig_pow(n, p)
        k = sum([d^(p+i-1) for (i,d) in enumerate(reverse(digits(n)))]) / n
        return isinteger(k) ? Int(k) : -1
    end
end

module Digits
    export dig_pow
    dig_pow(n, p) = sum(reverse(digits(n)).^(p:p+length(digits(n))-1))/n|>x->x==ceil(x) ? Int(x) : -1
end

module Digits
    export dig_pow

    function dig_pow(n, p)
        sum(reverse(digits(n)).^(p:p+length(digits(n))-1))/n|>x->Int(-1+((x==round(x)))*(x+1))
    end

end

module Digits
    export dig_pow

    function dig_pow(n, p)
        dig = reverse(digits(n))
        total = sum(map(^, dig, p : p + length(dig) - 1))
        
        result = total / n
        return isinteger(result) ? result : -1
          
    end

end

module Digits
    export dig_pow

    function dig_pow(n, p)
        s = string(n)
        ps = (p+i for i=0:length(s)-1)
        z = sum(parse(Int,c)^q for (c,q)=zip(s, ps))
        return z%n==0 ? div(z,n) : -1
    end

end

module Digits
    export dig_pow

    function dig_pow(n, p)
      nums = reverse(digits(n))
      sum = 0
      for i ∈ 1:length(nums)
        sum+= nums[i] ^ p
        p += 1
      end
      return sum % n == 0 ? sum÷n : -1
    end

end

module Digits
    export dig_pow

    function dig_pow(n, p)
        v = reverse(digits(n))
        l = length(v)
        s = sum(x^i for (x, i) in zip(v, p:p+l-1))
        isinteger(s / n) ? Int(s / n) : -1
    end

end

function josephus_survivor(n, k)
  res = 1
  for i in 1:n
    res = (res + k - 1) % i + 1
  end
  return res
end

function josephus_survivor(n, k)
    if k == 1
        n
    elseif n == 1
        1
    else
        (josephus_survivor(n-1, k) + k - 1)%n + 1
    end
end

function josephus_survivor(n, k)
    if n == 1
        return 1
    else
        return (josephus_survivor(n-1, k) + k-1) % n + 1
    end    
end

function josephus_survivor(n, k)
  A=collect(1:n)
  ptr=0
  l=length(A)
  while l>2
    l=length(A)
    ptr=(ptr+k)%l
    ptr==0 ? ptr=l : nothing
    deleteat!(A,ptr)
    ptr=ptr-1
  end
  return A[1]
end

function josephus_survivor(n, k)
  a = collect(1:n)
  while length(a) > 1
    a = circshift(a,-k)
    deleteat!(a,length(a))
  end
  return a[1]
end

function josephus_survivor(n, k)
  if n == 1
    1
  else
    (josephus_survivor(n - 1, k) + k - 1) % n + 1
  end
end

function josephus_survivor(n, k)
    arr = [1:n;]
    function loop(arr,k)
        length(arr) == 1 && return arr[1]
        index = (k - 1) % length(arr) + 1
        loop(vcat(arr[index+1:end], arr[1:index-1]), k)
    end
    loop(arr, k)
end

function josephus_survivor(n, k)
    rem = collect(1:n)
    out = 0
    while n > 1
        out = (out + k) % n
        if out == 0 out = n end
        deleteat!(rem, out)
        n = n - 1
        out = out - 1
    end
    return rem[1]
end

function josephus_survivor(n, k)
	l = [1:n;]
	i = (k - 1) % length(l)
	while length(l) > 1
		deleteat!(l, i+1)
		i = (i - 1 + k)%length(l)
	end
	return only(l)
end

   end
  a = big(0)
  c = big(1)

  a = BigInt(0)

  while m < n

    i = a * b
    a = a + t
    m += 1
  end
  a
end

function fibsum(n::Integer)
  out = 0
  fibonacci_seq = [0, 1]
  while last(fibonacci_seq) < n
    if iseven(last(fibonacci_seq))
      out += last(fibonacci_seq)
    end
    append!(fibonacci_seq, sum(fibonacci_seq[length(fibonacci_seq)-1:length(fibonacci_seq)]))
  end
  return out
end

function fibsum(n::Integer)
    fib1, fib2, sum_of_all_evens = 0, 1, 0
    while fib2 < n
        iseven(fib2) && (sum_of_all_evens += fib2)
        fib1, fib2 = fib2, fib1 + fib2      
    end
    sum_of_all_evens
end

function fibsum(n::Integer)
  a=1
  b=1
  res=0
  while true
    c=a+b
    a=b
    b=c
    if b >= n
      return res
    end
    if b % 2 == 0
      res = res + b
    end
  end
end

function fibsum(n::Integer)
  n < 2 && return 0
  p, q, tot = 0, 2, 2
  while q < n
    r = 4*q + p
    r >= n && break
    p, q = q, r
    tot += q
  end
  return tot
end

function fibsum(n::Integer)
  s, a, b = 0, 0, 1
  while b < n
    if iseven(b) s += b end
    a, b = b, a + b
  end
  return s
end

    if a%2==0
      n+=a
    end
  end
  n
end

function tribonacci((a, b, c), n::Int)::Array{Float64}
  result = zeros(n)
  signature = [a, b, c]

  for i in 1:n
    if i < 4
      result[i] = signature[i]
    else
      result[i] = sum(result[i-3:i-1])
    end
  end
  
  return result
end
tribonacci((a, b, c), n::Int)::Array{Float64} = n < 1 ? Float64[] : vcat([a], tribonacci((b, c, a + b + c), n - 1))

function tribonacci((a, b, c), n::Int)::Array{Float64}
  n == 0 && return []
  n <=3 && return [a, b ,c][1:n]
  return [a; tribonacci((b,c,a+b+c), n-1)]
end

function tribonacci((a, b, c), n::Int)::Array{Float64}
  array = zeros(n)
    for i =1:n
        if i<4
            if i ==1
                array[i] =a
            else 
                if i==2
                    array[i]=b
                else
                    array[i]=c
                end
            end
        else
            array[i] = array[i-1] + array[i-2] + array[i-3]
        end
    end
    return array
end

function tribonacci((a, b, c), n::Int)::Array{Float64}
  trifibo = [a, b, c]
  if n < 3
    return trifibo[1:n]
  else
    for idx in 1:n-3

function tribRec((a, b, c), n::Int)::Float64
  if n == 1
    temp = a
  elseif n == 2
    temp = b
  elseif n == 3
    temp = c
  elseif n == 4 
    temp = a + b + c
  else
    temp = 2 * tribRec((a,b,c), n-1) - tribRec((a,b,c), n-4)
    #temp = sum(tribRec((a,b,c),n-1)) + sum(tribRec((a,b,c),n-2)) + sum(tribRec((a,b,c),n-3)) 
  end
  temp
end

  array = [a, b, c]

  end
  return array[1:n]
end

    count = 0

module Pass
  export play_pass

  function play_pass(s, n)
    # O(n)
    p = []
    sizehint!(p, n)
    for i in 1:length(s)
      a = s[i]
      if isletter(a)
        a = Char((Int(uppercase(a) - 'A') + n) % 26 + Int('A'))
        iseven(i) && (a = lowercase(a))
      elseif isdigit(a)
        a = Char(9 - Int(a) + 2 * Int('0'))
      end
      insert!(p, 1, a)
    end
    join(p)
  end
end

module Pass
    export play_pass

    function play_pass(s, n)
        shift(c, n) = c in 'A':'Z' ? (c+n in 'A':'Z' ? c+n : c+n-26) : c
        differ(c) = c in '0':'9' ? 9-(c-'0')+'0' : c
    
        result = reshape(differ.(shift.(Vector{Char}(s*repeat(' ', length(s)%2)), n)), 2, :)
        result[2, :] = lowercase.(result[2, :])
        join(reshape(result, :, 1)[length(s):-1:1])
    end

end

module Pass
    export play_pass

    function play_pass(s, n)
        shifty = Dict(zip(vcat(['a':'z'...], ['0':'9'...]), vcat(['a':'z'...][n+1:end], ['a':'z'...][1:n], ['9':-1:'0'...])))
        reverse(join(isodd(i) ? uppercase(get(shifty, v, v)) : lowercase(get(shifty, v, v)) for (i,v) in enumerate(lowercase(s))))
    end

end

module Pass
    export play_pass

  function play_pass(s, n)
    tmp = ""
    for i = 1:length(s)
        c = s[i]
        if c>='A' && c<='z'
            c = uppercase(c)+n
            if c > 'Z'
                c = c - 26
            end
            tmp = tmp * (i % 2 != 0 ? uppercase(c) : lowercase(c))
        elseif c>='0' && c<='9'
            tmp = tmp * string('9'-c)
        else
            tmp = tmp * c
        end
    end
    return reverse(tmp)
  end

end

module Pass
    export play_pass

    function play_pass(s, n)
        circshifts = Pair.('A':'Z', circshift('A':'Z', -n))
        digitshifts = Pair.('0':'9', ('9' .- ('0':'9')) .+ '0')
        newchars = replace(collect(s), [circshifts; digitshifts]...)
        return [
          iseven(i) ? lowercase(chr) : uppercase(chr)
          for (i, chr) ∈ enumerate(newchars)
        ] |> reverse |> join
    end

end

module Pass
    export play_pass

    function rotate_char(c, n)
      min = Int('A')
      max = Int('Z')

      if Int(c) >= min && Int(c) <= max
        shiftedChar = c + n
        overflow = Int(shiftedChar) - max

        if overflow > 0
          Char(min + overflow - 1)
        else
          shiftedChar
        end
      else
        c
      end
    end

    function rotate_digit(c)
      min = Int('0')
      max = Int('9')

      if Int(c) >= min && Int(c) <= max
        digit = parse(Int, c)
        Char(9 - digit + '0')
      else
        c
      end
    end

    function downcase_odd(charArray)
      result = []
      for(i,c) in enumerate(charArray)
        if isodd(i-1)
          push!(result, lowercase(c))
        else
          push!(result, c)
        end
      end
      result
    end

    function play_pass(s, n)
      map(c -> rotate_char(c, n) |> rotate_digit, collect(s)) |> downcase_odd |> reverse |> join
    end

end

module Pass
    export play_pass

    function transform(c, n, upper)
        if isletter(c)
            if upper
                uppercase(Char((Int(c)+n-97)%26 + 97))
            else
                lowercase(Char((Int(c)+n-97)%26 + 97))
            end
        elseif isdigit(c)
            "$(9-parse(Int, c))"
        else
            c
        end
    end
    function play_pass(s, n)
        join(reverse([transform(c, n, i%2==1) for (i, c) in enumerate(lowercase(s))]))
    end
end

module Pass
    export play_pass

    function play_pass(s, n)
        a = vcat(collect('a':'z'), collect('a':'z'))
        y = lowercase(s)
        z = []
        i = 1
        for x in y
          if isdigit(x)
            append!(z, 9 - parse(Int, x))
          elseif x in a
            tempChar = a[findfirst(isequal(x),a)+n]
            tempChar = if(i%2 == 0) tempChar else uppercase(tempChar) end
            append!(z, tempChar)
          else
            append!(z, x)
          end
          i += 1
        end
        return(join(reverse(z)))
    end

end

module Pass
export play_pass

function play_pass(s, n)
  reverse(join(map(enumerate(s)) do (i, c)
      if isletter(c)
        c = isodd(i) ? uppercase(c) : lowercase(c)
        offset = isuppercase(c) ? 65 : 97
        Char((Int(c) - offset + n) % 26 + offset)
      elseif isdigit(c)
        9 - parse(Int, c)
      else
        c
      end
    end
  ))
end

end

module Pass
    export play_pass
    function play_pass(message, shift)
      (reverse ∘ caseflip)(map(getshifter(shift), message))
    end
    
    function caseflip(message::String)
      String([iseven(i) ? lowercase(message[i]) : uppercase(message[i]) for i in 1:length(message)])
    end
    
    function getshifter(shift)
      function encodechar(char)
        Int(char) >= 65 && Int(char) <= 90 && return shiftletter(char, shift)
        Int(char) >= 48 && Int(char) <= 57 && return nineecomplement(char)
        char
      end
      encodechar
    end
    
    function nineecomplement(digit)
      Char(105 - Int(digit))
    end
    
    function shiftletter(char, shift)
      Char(65 + (Int(char) - 65 + shift) % 26)
    end
end

            sum += m*(m+1)*0.5 + m*(2*j-1)
        end
        return sum
    end

end

module Recre
    export list_squared

    function sum_squared_factors(n)
        s = 0; i = 1; res = []
        while (i * i <= n)
            if (n % i == 0)
                s += i * i
                nf = div(n, i)
                if (nf != i)
                    s += nf * nf
                end
            end
            i += 1
        end
        u = Int(floor(sqrt(s)))
        if (u * u == s)
            (n, s)
        else nothing end
    end
    # return a Tuple{Int64,Int64}[.....]
    function list_squared(m, n)
        res = Tuple{Int64, Int64}[]
        i = m
        while (i <= n)
            r = sum_squared_factors(i)
            if (r !== nothing)
                push!(res, r)
            end
            i += 1
        end
        res
    end
end

module Recre
    export list_squared

    function list_squared(m, n)
        arr = []
        for i in m:n
            x = sum(divisors(i).^2)
            isinteger(sqrt(x)) && push!(arr,(i, x))
        end
        arr 
    end
    
    function divisors(num)
        divs = []
        for i in 1:sqrt(num)
            num % i == 0 && append!(divs, [Int(i), Int(num÷i)])
        end
        divs[end] == divs[end-1] ? divs[1:end-1] : divs
    end
end

module Recre
export list_squared

function list_squared(m, n)
	function factors(num)
		fac = filter(i -> num % i == 0, 1:(iseven(num) ? 1 : 2):ceil(sqrt(num)))
		for j in 1:length(fac) indexin(num / fac[j], fac)[1] == nothing && push!(fac, num / fac[j]) end
		fac
    end
	outp = map(i -> (i, sum(factors(i).^2)), m:n)
	filter(i -> isinteger(sqrt(i[2])), outp)
end

end

module Recre
    export list_squared

    function list_squared(m, n)
        res = []
        for i in m:n
          divisors = (i>1) ? [[k for k in 1:ceil(Int, i/2) if isinteger(i/k)]; [i]] : [1]
          sm = sum(map(j -> j^2, divisors))
          if isinteger(sqrt(sm))
            push!(res, (i, sm))
          end
        end
        return res
    end
end

module Recre
    export list_squared

    # return a Tuple{Int64,Int64}[.....]
    function list_squared(m, n)
    # your code
    result = Vector{Tuple{Int64,Int64}}()
    for num ∈ m:n+1
        divisors = Set()
        for i ∈ 1:isqrt(num+1)
            if num % i == 0
                push!(divisors,i^2)
                push!(divisors,(num÷i)^2)
            end
        end
        if isempty(divisors)
            continue
        end
        total = sum(+,divisors)
        sr = sqrt(total)
        if sr % 1 == 0
            push!(result, Tuple([num,total]))
        end
    end
    result
    # return a Tuple{Int64,Int64}[.....] 
end
end

module Recre
    export list_squared

    # return a Tuple{Int64,Int64}[.....]
    function list_squared(m, n)
      squared_div=Tuple{Int,Int}[]
      for k=m:n
        k_div=Int[1,k]
        gogo=true
        i=2
        while gogo
          k%i ==0 ? push!(k_div,i,k÷i) : nothing
          i += 1
          i>k/i ? gogo=false : nothing
        end
        k_divS=Set(k_div)
        sqrt(sum(k_divS.^2))%1 == 0 ? push!(squared_div,(k,sum(k_divS.^2))) : nothing
      end
      return squared_div 
    end
end

module Recre
    export list_squared

    function divisors(n)
      divs = [1]
      for i in 2:n ÷ 2
        if (n % i) == 0 push!(divs,i) end
      end
      n == 1 ? divs : push!(divs,n)
    end

    global intervals = [];
    isCovered = (n) -> length(filter(i -> i[1] <= n <= i[2], intervals)) >= 1
      
    global cache = [];

    function list_squared(m, n)
        res = []
        for i in m:n
            if !isCovered(i)
              divs = sum(divisors(i).^2)
              if isinteger(sqrt(divs)) push!(cache,(i,divs)) end
            end
        end
        push!(intervals,[m,n])
        return filter(f -> m <= f[1] <= n, cache)
    end
end

module Recre
export list_squared

issquare(x) = isinteger(√x)
sq(x) = x ^ 2
ssum(x) = sum(
  sq(i) + sq(x ÷ i)
  for i in 1:floor(Int, √x)
  if x % i == 0
) - (issquare(x) ? floor(Int, √x) : 0)
check(x) = let s = ssum(x)
  issquare(s) ? (x, s) : missing
end
list_squared(m, n) = [x for x in check.(m:n) if !ismissing(x)]

end

module Recre
    export list_squared

  function checknum(n)
    sum(Set(Iterators.flatten([(i, n/i) for i in 1:√n if n % i == 0])).^2)
  end

  function list_squared(n, m)
    [(i, checknum(i)) for i in n:m if isinteger(√(checknum(i)))]
  end
end

        n *= n * 0.5
        n % 1 == 0.5 ? [n * 2, 2] : [n]
    end
    
end

        return (num % 2 == 0) ? [num/2] : [num, 2]
    end

export game

game(n) = let s = big(n) * big(n)
  n % 2 == 0 ? [s ÷ 2] : [s, 2]
end

module Chess
    export game

    function game(n)
        # Brute force
        #   fr = sum( (i-1) for i in big(2):big(n+1) )//2 + sum( (n*(n+1)-i*(i-1))//(i+n) for i in big(2):big(n) )//2
        # Use math to reduce the first sum
        #   fr = n*(n+1)//4 + sum( (n*(n+1)-i*(i-1))//(i+n) for i in big(2):big(n) )//2 
        # Use more math to reduce the second sum
        #   fr = n*(n+1)//4 + ((n+1)*(n-2)+2)//4
        # Combine both. Hmm, ok that is so simple, there should be a simpler argument without doing all 
        # the work to arrive at this result. And that is that each diagonal sum up to L//2 where L is the 
        # length of the diagonal.
        fr = n^2//2
  
        if denominator(fr)==1
            [numerator(fr)]
        else
            [numerator(fr), denominator(fr)]
        end        
    end
end

    end

    end

  export game

  function game(n)
    total = n * (n+1) // 2
    total = total - n // 2
    num = numerator(total)
    dom = denominator(total)
    dom == 1 ? [num] : [num, dom]
  end
end

module Ath
    export stat_assoc
    using Printf
    using Statistics

    function stat_assoc(strg)
        function time2snd(s)
            a=map(x -> parse(Int, x), split(s, "|"))
            3600 * a[1] + 60 * a[2] + a[3]
        end
        function snd2time(n)
            h = div(n, 3600)
            re = n % 3600
            mn = div(re, 60)
            s = re % 60
            @sprintf("%02d|%02d|%02d",  h, mn, s)
        end
        if (strg == "") return "" end
        r = sort(map(x -> time2snd(x), split(strg, ", ")))
        @sprintf("Range: %s Average: %s Median: %s",  snd2time(r[end] - r[1]), snd2time(floor(mean(r))), snd2time(floor(median(r))))
    end

end

module Ath
    export stat_assoc

function tosecs(ss)
    sssp = parse.(Int, split(ss, "|"))
    return (3600 * sssp[1]) + (60 * sssp[2]) + sssp[3]
end

function formt(i)
    return i < 10 ? "0" * string(i) : string(i)
end

function totime(secs)
    s = secs < 60 ? secs : divrem(secs, 60)[2]
    m = divrem(secs, 60)[1] < 60 ? divrem(secs, 60)[1] : divrem(divrem(secs, 60)[1], 60)[2]
    h = divrem(divrem(secs, 60)[1], 60)[1]
    return formt(h) * "|" * formt(m) * "|" * formt(s)
end

function medn(secs)
    l = length(secs)
    ss = sort(secs)
    iseven(l) ? floor(Int, (ss[Int(l / 2)] + ss[Int(l / 2)+1]) / 2) : ss[ceil(Int, l / 2)]
end

function stat_assoc(s)
    ssplit = map(x -> strip(x), split(s, ","))
    secs = map(x -> tosecs(x), ssplit)
    smean = floor(Int, (sum(secs) / length(secs)))
    srange = maximum(secs) - minimum(secs)
    smedian = floor(Int, medn(secs))
    return string("Range: ", totime(srange), " ", "Average: ", totime(smean), " ", "Median: ", totime(smedian))
end

end

module Ath
    export stat_assoc
    using Statistics  
  
    function convert(v)
      h = Int64(floor(v/3600))
      m = Int64(floor((v-h*3600)/60))
      s = Int64(floor((v - h*3600 - m*60)))
      res = lpad.(string.([h,m,s]), 2, '0')
      return join(res, "|")
    end
    function stat_assoc(strg)
        if strg == ""
          return ""
        end
        data = split(strg, ", ")
        data_sec = []
        for d in data
          val = parse.(Int64, split(d, "|"))
          push!(data_sec, val[3] + 60*val[2] + 3600*val[1])
        end
  
        r = convert(maximum(data_sec) - minimum(data_sec))
        m = convert(mean(data_sec))
        me = convert(median(data_sec))
  
        return "Range: $r Average: $m Median: $me"
    end

end

module Ath
    export stat_assoc
    using Printf
    using Statistics

    function stat_assoc(strg)
        strg == "" && return ""
        s = [3600 60 1] * parse.(Int, hcat(split.(split(strg, ", "), '|')...))
        hms(x) = @sprintf("%02.0f|%02.0f|%02.0f", x ÷ 3600, x % 3600 ÷ 60, x % 3600 % 60)
        @sprintf("Range: %s Average: %s Median: %s", hms.(floor.([max(s...)-min(s...), mean(s), median(s)]))...)
    end

end

module Ath
    export stat_assoc

    using Printf

    function fmt(s) 
        @sprintf("%02d|%02d|%02d", s÷3600, s%3600÷60, floor(Int, s%60))
    end
    function stat_assoc(strg)
        if strg == ""
            ""
        end
  
        times = [ parse.(Int, split(athlet, "|")) for athlet in split(strg, ", ")]
        seconds = [3600*h+60*m+s for (h, m, s) in times]
      
        range   = fmt(maximum(seconds)-minimum(seconds))
        average = fmt(sum(seconds)/length(seconds))
        median  = fmt(if length(seconds)%2==0; sum(sort(seconds)[end÷2:end÷2+1])/2 else sort(seconds)[end÷2+1] end)

        "Range: $range Average: $average Median: $median" 
    end

end

module Ath
    export stat_assoc
    using Statistics
    using Dates

    function stat_assoc(strg)
        if strg == ""
          return ""
        end
        df = DateFormat("HH|MM|SS")
        split_strg = split(strg, ", ")
        times = Dates.value.(Time.(split_strg, df) .- Time(0,0,0))
        range_time = Time(0) + Nanosecond(round(Int64, (maximum(times) - minimum(times))))
        mean_time = Time(0) + Nanosecond(round(Int64, mean(times)))
        median_time = Time(0) + Nanosecond(round(Int64, median(times)))
        range_string = Dates.format(range_time, df)
        mean_string = Dates.format(mean_time, df)
        median_string = Dates.format(median_time, df)
        return "Range: $range_string Average: $mean_string Median: $median_string"
    end

end

module Ath
    export stat_assoc

    function stat_assoc(strg)
        if string == "" 
          return("")
        end
        println(strg)
        times = split(strg, ",")
        stat_assocs = []
        for time in times
          vals = split(time, "|")
          if length(vals) != 3
            return "" 
          end
          newstat_assoc = parse(Int,vals[1])*3600 + (parse(Int,vals[2])*60) + parse(Int,vals[3])
          push!(stat_assocs, newstat_assoc)
        end
  
        sort!(stat_assocs)
        range = stat_assocs[end]-stat_assocs[1]
        if length(stat_assocs)%2 == 1
          med = stat_assocs[length(stat_assocs)÷2+1]
        else
          med = trunc(Int,sum(stat_assocs[length(stat_assocs)÷2:length(stat_assocs)÷2+1])/2)
        end
        avg = trunc(Int, sum(stat_assocs)/length(stat_assocs))
        rangeh = lpad(range÷3600, 2, "0")
        rangem = lpad(range÷60%60,2, "0")
        ranges = lpad(range%60, 2, "0")

        medm = lpad(med÷60%60, 2, "0")
        meds = lpad(med%60, 2, "0")
        avgh = lpad(avg÷3600, 2, "0")
        avgm = lpad(avg÷60%60, 2, "0")
        avgs = lpad(avg%60, 2, "0")
        return("Range: $rangeh|$rangem|$ranges Average: $avgh|$avgm|$avgs Median: $medh|$medm|$meds")
        
    end

end

module Ath
    export stat_assoc

    using Statistics
    using Printf

    function stat_assoc(strg)
        if isempty(strg)
            return ""
        end
  
        parseint(x) = isempty(x) ? 0 : parse(Int, x)
  
        fmt(time) = begin
            (h, m) = divrem(floor(time), 3600)
            (m, s) = divrem(m, 60)
             @sprintf("%02d|%02d|%02d", h, m, s)
        end
  
        times = map(split(strg, ", ")) do t
            (h, m, s) = parseint.(split(t, "|"))
            s + 60m + 3600h
        end
  
        "Range: "   * fmt(maximum(times)-minimum(times)) * " " *
        "Average: " * fmt(mean(times)) * " " *
        "Median: "  * fmt(median(times))
        
    end

end

module Ath
    using Printf
    export stat_assoc

    function str2sec(str)
        hours, minutes, seconds = map(x -> parse(Int, x), split(str, '|'))
        return 3600*hours + 60*minutes + seconds
    end

    function sec2str(seconds)
        hours = div(seconds, 3600)
        seconds = seconds - 3600*hours
        minutes = div(seconds, 60)
        seconds = seconds - 60*minutes
        return @sprintf("%02d|%02d|%02d", hours, minutes, seconds)
    end

    function stat_assoc(strg)
        team = str2sec.(split(strg, ", ")) |> sort
        range = sec2str(team[end] - team[1])
        average = sec2str(fld(sum(team), length(team)))
        median = iseven(length(team)) ? sec2str(fld(sum(team[length(team)÷2:length(team)÷2+1]), 2)) : sec2str(team[length(team)÷2+1])
        return @sprintf("Range: %s Average: %s Median: %s", range, average, median)
    end

end

module Ath
export stat_assoc

function toSeconds(arr)
  h, m, s = (x -> parse(Int, x)).(split(arr, "|"))
  t = h * 3600 + m * 60 + s  
end

function toHMS(t)
  s = t % 60
  t = div(t, 60)
  m = t % 60
  h = div(t, 60)
  join((x -> lpad(x, 2, "0")).([h, m, s]), "|")
end

function stat_assoc(strg)
  times = sort(toSeconds.(split(strg, ", ")))
  range = times[end] - times[1]
  avg = Int(floor(sum(times) / length(times)))
  mid = Int(ceil(length(times) / 2))
  median = length(times) & 1 == 1 ? times[mid] : Int(floor((times[mid] + times[mid + 1]) / 2))
  "Range: " * toHMS(range) * " Average: " * toHMS(avg) * " Median: " * toHMS(median)
end

end

        c = BigInt(1)

    end

        # your code

          if binomial(convert(Int128, n), convert(Int128, x)) == m

            break
          end
        end

module Color
    export checkchoose

    function checkchoose(m, n)
        for x in 0:n÷2+1
            if partfactorial(big(n-x), big(n)) / factorial(big(x)) == m
                return x
            end
        end
        return -1
    end

    function partfactorial(x::BigInt, y::BigInt)
      f::BigInt = 1
      for i = x+1:y
          f *= i
      end
      return f
    end

end

  while true

    end

  end

function order(words)
  findnum(w) = match(r"\d", w).match
  join(sort(split(words, " "), lt = (a, b) -> findnum(a) < findnum(b)), " ")
end

function extract_number(word)
  match(r"\d", word).match |> s -> parse(Int, s)
end

function order(words)
  sort(split(words), by=extract_number) |>
  vector -> join(vector, " ")
end

function order(words)
    join(sort!(split(words), by=numberWord), " ")
end

function numberWord(word)
    for ch in word
        if isdigit(ch)
            return ch - '0'
        end
    end
    0
end

function order(words)
  splitted = split(words)
  join([splitted[q] for q in invperm([parse(Int,match(r"\d",word).match) for word in splitted])], ' ')
end

function order(words)
  sorted = fill("", length(split(words)))
  for word in split(words)
    for i in word
      try 
        n = parse(Int, i)
        println(typeof(n))
        sorted[n] = word
      catch
        continue
      end
    end
  end
  return join(sorted, " ")
end

function order(sentence)
  function extract_number(string)
    match(r"\d", string).match |> s -> parse(Int, s)
  end


  words = split(sentence)
  numbers = words .|> extract_number
  dict = Dict{Int,String}()

  for i ∈ 1:length(words)
    dict[numbers[i]] = words[i]
  end

  map(k -> dict[k], sort(numbers)) |>
  vector -> join(vector, " ")
end

module Weight
    export order_weight

    function digits(num)
      digs = []
      while num > 0
        push!(digs, mod(num, 10))
        num = div(num, 10)
      end
      digs 
    end

    function order_weight(strng)
      real_weights = map(s -> parse(Int64, s), split(strng))
      sort!(real_weights, by=w->(sum(digits(w)), string(w)))
      join(string.(real_weights), " ")
    end

end

module Weight
    export order_weight

    function weight(x)
      sum(digits(x, base = 10))
    end

    function order_weight(strng)
      numbers = [parse(Int, x) for x in split(strng)]
      numbers = sort(numbers, by=string)
      numbers = sort(numbers, by=weight, alg=InsertionSort) #Insertions sort is stable
      return join(numbers, " ")
    end

end

module Weight
    export order_weight

    function lt(a, b)
        w1 = reduce(+, i for i in digits(a))
        w2 = reduce(+, i for i in digits(b))
        if w1 < w2
            return true
        elseif w2 < w1
            return false
        end
        return string(a) < string(b)
    end

    function order_weight(strng)
        list = parse.(Int, split(strng))
        join(sort!(list, lt=lt), ' ')
    end

end

# brainfuck/Julia polyglot
function summation(num)      
    result = 0            # ,[[
    while num > 0         # +>+<<-]
        i = num
        while i > 0       # >[<<
            result += 1   # >>-]<[
            i -= 1        # >>+<<]<
        end
        num -= 1          # ]>>>.
    end                   
    return result         
end
