module Tortoise
    export race

    function race(v1, v2, g)
        v1 < v2 || return [-1,-1,-1]
        s = div(g*3600, (v2-v1))
        m, s = div(s,60), s%60
        h, m = div(m,60), m%60
        return [h, m, s]
    end

end

module Tortoise
    export race

    function race(v1, v2, g)
        d = v2 - v1
        if (d <= 0)
            return [-1,-1,-1]
        end
        h = div(g, d)
        r = g % d
        mn = div(r * 60, d)
        s = div((r * 60 % d) * 60, d)
        Int[h, mn, s]
    end

end

module Tortoise
    export race
    hms(s)=[s÷3600,s÷60%60,s%60]
    race(v1,v2,g)=v1>=v2 ? [] : hms(3600g÷(v2-v1))
end

module Tortoise
    export race

    function race(v1, v2, g)
        if v1 >= v2
          return Int64[-1,-1,-1]
        end
  
        distance = (v1 * g) / (v2 - v1)

        hours = distance / v1
        h = Int(floor(Int64, hours))
        minutes = (hours - h) * 60
        m = Int(floor(Int64, minutes))
        seconds = (minutes - m) * 60
        s = Int(floor(seconds))
  
        return [h, m, s]
    end

end

module Tortoise
export race

"Convert seconds to [hours, minutes, seconds]"
stohms(seconds::Real) = Int[seconds ÷ 3600, seconds ÷ 60 % 60, floor(seconds) % 60]

"Convert hours to [hours, minutes, seconds]"
htohms(hours::Real) = stohms(hours * 3600)

function race(v1, v2, g)
    v1 < v2 ? htohms(g / (v2 - v1)) : Int[]
end

end # module

module Tortoise
    export race

    function race(v1, v2, g)
      if v2 - v1 <= 0
        return []
      else  
            h, g = divrem(g, v2 - v1)
            m, g = divrem(g * 60, v2 - v1 )
            s, g = divrem(g * 60, v2 - v1)
      return [h, m, s]
      end
    end
    
end

module Tortoise
    export race

    function race(v1, v2, g)
        if v1 >= v2
          return []
        end
        t = g/(v2 - v1)
        h = floor(t)
        m = (t - h) * 60
        s = ((m - floor(m)) * 60 + 0.00001)
        if floor(s) == 60.0
          s = 0
          m += 1
        end
        return [h, floor(m), floor(s)]
    end

end

module Tortoise
    export race

    function time_to_hms(t)
        t = floor(t * 3600)
        hms = [0, 0, 0]
        for (i, val) in enumerate([3600, 60, 1])
            hms[i], t = divrem(t, val)
        end
        hms
    end

    function race(v1, v2, g)
        if v1 >= v2 return [] end
        time_to_hms(g / (v2 - v1))
    end

end

module Tortoise
    export race

    function race(v1, v2, g)
    if v1 ≥ v2
        return Int64[-1,-1,-1]
    end
    time = (g/(v2-v1))
    hours = floor(time)
    minutes = trunc((time % 1) * 60)
    seconds = trunc((((time % 1) * 60) % 1) * 60)
    if ((((time % 1) * 60) % 1) * 60) % 1 > .999
        if seconds + 1 == 60
          minutes +=1
          seconds = 0
        else
          seconds += 1
        end
    end
    return [Int(hours),Int(minutes),Int(seconds)]
end

end

module Tortoise
    export race

    function race(v1, v2, g)
      x = g/(v2-v1) #Time for gab to close i h
      if x < 0
        return [-1,-1,-1]
      end
      x *= 3600
  
      h = fld(x, 3600)
      x -= h * 3600
      m = fld(x, 60)
      x -= m * 60
      s = fld(x, 1)
      return [h, m, s]

    function choose_best_sum(t, k, ls)
        function choose_best_sumAux(t, k , ls, from) 
            if k == 0 
                if t >= 0 return 0
                else return t
                end
            else
                if t < k return -1 end
            end
            best = -1
            tmpBest = -1

module Travel 
    export choose_best_sum

    struct Combinations
    n::Int
    t::Int
end
Base.length(c::Combinations) = binomial(c.n, c.t)
struct CoolLexCombinations
    n::Int
    t::Int
end
function Base.iterate(c::Combinations, s = [min(c.t - 1, i) for i in 1:c.t])
    if c.t == 0 # special case to generate 1 result for t==0
        isempty(s) && return (s, [1])
        return
    end
    for i in c.t:-1:1
        s[i] += 1
        if s[i] > (c.n - (c.t - i))
            continue
        end
        for j in i+1:c.t
            s[j] = s[j-1] + 1
        end
        break
    end
    s[1] > c.n - c.t + 1 && return
    (s, s)
end
function Base.iterate(C::CoolLexCombinations)
    if C.n < 0
        throw(DomainError(C.n))
    end
    if C.t ≤ 0
        throw(DomainError(C.t))
    end

    #What integer size should I use?
    if C.n < 8sizeof(Int)
        T = Int
    else
        T = BigInt
    end

    state = CoolLexIterState{T}(0, 0, T(1) << C.n, (T(1) << C.t) - 1)
    iterate(C, state)
end
function combinations(a, t::Integer)
    if t < 0
        # generate 0 combinations for negative argument
        t = length(a) + 1
    end
    reorder(c) = [a[ci] for ci in c]
    (reorder(c) for c in Combinations(length(a), t))
end
function choose_best_sum(t, k, ls)
    combos = combinations(ls, k)
    sums = [sum(i) for i ∈ combos]
    sums2 = [i for i ∈ sums if i ≤ t]
    if sums2==[]
        largest = -1
    else
        largest = maximum(sums2)
    end
    return largest
end

end

    export choose_best_sum
    
    # wrapper for a recursive solver
    choose_best_sum(t, k, ls) = solve( t, k, ls )

    function solve(t, k, ls)
      k ≤ length( ls ) || return -1
      k == 1           && return find_best( t, ls )
                          return find_best( t, [ ( j = solve( t - x, k - 1, ls[ ( i + 1 ):end ] ) ) ≠ -1 ? x + j : -1 for ( i, x ) in enumerate( ls ) ] )
    end
    
    find_best( t, ls ) = isempty( ls[ ls .≤ t ] ) ? -1 : maximum( ls[ ls .≤ t  ] )
end

using IterTools

  function choose_best_sum(t, k, ls)
    test = []
    for n in collect(subsets(ls, k)) append!(test, sum(n)) end
    k > length(ls) || isempty(filter(x -> x <= t, test)) ? -1 : 
      maximum(filter(x -> x <= t, test))
  end

module Travel 
export choose_best_sum

function choose_best_sum(t, k, ls)
  puppy = [n for n in 1:k]
  best = -1
  
  #filter out bad cases
  if k > length(ls)
    return best
  end
  
  while true
    
    #check if current combination is better than previous best
    temp = sum(ls[n] for n in puppy)
    if temp <= t && temp > best
      best = temp
    end
    
    #check if current combination is the last
    puppy != (length(ls) - k + 1):length(ls) || break
    
    #cycle through all possible combinations
    for n = 1:k
      if puppy[k - n + 1] == length(ls) - n + 1
        continue
      else
        puppy[k - n + 1] += 1
        for z = 2:n
          puppy[k - n + z] = puppy[k - n + 1] + z - 1
        end
        break
      end
    end
  end
  best
end
end

module Travel 
    export choose_best_sum

    function choose_best_sum(t, k, ls)
        if k == 0
          return 0
        end
        if length(ls) < k
          return -1
        else 
          if length(ls) == k
            s = sum(ls)
            if s <= t
             return s
            else
             return -1
            end
          end
        end
        
        if t < ls[1]
          sum_with = -1
        else
          remaining = choose_best_sum(t-ls[1], k-1, ls[2:end])
          if remaining == -1
            sum_with = -1
          else
            sum_with = remaining + ls[1]
          end
        end
        sum_without = choose_best_sum(t,k,ls[2:end])
        max(sum_with, sum_without)
    end

end

    function prod2sum(a, b, c, d)
        e = sort([abs(a*d-b*c), abs(a*c+b*d)])
        f = sort([abs(a*c-b*d), abs(a*d+b*c)])
        if e == f
            [e]
        else
            sort([e, f], by = x -> x[1])
        end
    end

module Recre
    export prod2sum

    function prod2sum(a, b, c, d)
        e, f = sort(abs.([a*c + b*d, a*d - b*c])), sort(abs.([a*c - b*d, a*d + b*c]))
        e == f ? [e] : sort([e, f])
    end

module Recre
    export prod2sum

    function prod2sum(a, b, c, d)
        n = (a*a + b*b)*(c*c + d*d)
        resu = []
        ef = [abs(a*c+b*d), abs((a*c-b*d)), abs(a*d+b*c), abs(a*d-b*c)]
        for e in 1:4
            for f in e:4
                efe = ef[e]
                eff = ef[f]
                if efe^2 + eff^2 == n
                    if efe <= eff 
                        fir, sec = efe, eff 
                    else 
                        fir, sec = eff, efe 
                    end 
                    if !([fir, sec] in resu)
                        push!(resu,[fir, sec])
                    end
                end
            end
        end
        res = sort(resu)
        return res
    end

end

module Recre
  export prod2sum
  function prod2sum(a, b, c, d)
    possibles = sort(map(abs, [a*c + b*d, a*c - b*d, b*c + a*d, b*c - a*d]))
    ret = []
    for i in 1:length(possibles)
      for j in i+1:length(possibles)
        x, y = possibles[i], possibles[j]
        if x^2 + y^2 == (a^2 + b^2) * (c^2 + d^2)
          push!(ret, [x,y])
        end
      end
    end
    unique(ret)
  end
end

module Recre
    export prod2sum

    # https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brahmagupta%E2%80%93Fibonacci_identity
    function prod2sum(a, b, c, d)
        x1 = abs(a * c - b * d)
        y1 = abs(a * d + b * c)
        
        x2 = abs(a * c + b * d)
        y2 = abs(a * d - b * c)
        
        n1 = [extrema([x1, y1])...]
        n2 = [extrema([x2, y2])...]
        
        if n1[1] == n2[1]
            [n1]
        elseif n1[1] > n2[1]
            [n2, n1]
        else
            [n1, n2]
        end
    end
    
end

function generate_range(min::Int, max::Int, step::Int)::Array{Int}

    end

export int_rac

function int_rac(n, guess)
    tries = 0
    error = 1
    x = guess
  
    while true
        new_x = (x + n ÷ x) ÷ 2
        tries += 1
        if abs(x - new_x) < error
            break
        else
            x = new_x
        end
    end
  
    tries
end

module Hero
    export update_bab, int_rac

    function update_bab(x,n)
      push!(x,floor((x[end] + n / x[end])/2))
      return x
    end
    
    
    function int_rac(n, guess)
    
        # Collect estimations in an array and evaluate the length of the array after 
        
        x = [guess ,((guess + n / guess)/2)] # Initialized array
        
        while (abs(x[end]-x[end-1])) >= 1
          update_bab(x,n)
        end
        
        return length(x) - 1 # Second-to-last element is a sufficient estimation (for given error)
    end

end

        count = 0

        while next != prev

            count += 1

        n = big(n)
        x = big(guess)
        hero(x) = floor(BigInt, (x + n / x) / 2)
        newx = hero(x)
        count = 1
        while abs(newx - x) ≥ 1
            x = newx
            newx = hero(x)

        θ = acos((r-h) / r)

        l = 4*vt/(pi*d^2) #calculate length of container
        theta = acos((d-2h)/d) #calculate theta in radians
        Asector = (d/2)^2*theta #calculate sector area for 2 theta
        Atriangle = 1/2*(d/2)^2 *sin(2*theta) #calculate triangle
        vt = l * (Asector - Atriangle)
        return floor(Int, vt)

module Trunk
    export tank_vol

    function tank_vol(h, d, vt)
        r = d/2
        if h > r
          hC = d-h
        else
          hC = h
        end
        phiR = acos((r-hC)/r)
        phiD = phiR*180/pi
        x = sin(phiR)*r
        triA = x*(r-hC)
        circA = r^2*pi*phiD/180
        areaM = circA-triA
        totA = pi*r^2
        depth = vt/totA
        if h>r
          vol = (totA - areaM)*depth
        else
          vol = areaM*depth
        end
        return Int(floor(vol))
      end
    
end

function row_sum_odd_numbers(n)
if n==1
return 1
else
  allnumb=sum(Array(1:n))*2-1
  oddseries=Array(1:2:allnumb)
  return sum(oddseries[end-n+1:end])
end
end

function row_sum_odd_numbers(n)
  sum(genrow(n))
end

function genrow(n)
  rowlen = n
  rowstart = 1
  
  for i in 0:n-1
    rowstart += i*2
  end

  [n for n in range(rowstart, step=2, length=rowlen)]
end

function row_sum_odd_numbers(n)

  numbers_before = sum(1:n-1)
  actual_number = (numbers_before) * 2 + 1
  sum(collect(actual_number:2:(actual_number+((n-1)*2))))
  
end

function row_sum_odd_numbers(n)
  if n == 1
    return 1
  end
  
  odds = 1:2:sum(1:n*2)
  rowStart = sum(1:n - 1) + 1
  
  return sum(odds[rowStart:rowStart + n - 1])
end

function row_sum_odd_numbers(n)
    r = 1
    # find first element of row n
    for i = 1:n
        r = r + (i-1)*2
    end
    # compute sum of row n
    sum = 0
    for i = 1:n
        sum = sum + r + 2 * (i-1)
    end
    return sum
end

module Stepy
    export stepp

    function isprimi(n)
        n > 1 || return false
        n != 2 || return true
        isodd(n) || return false
        for i in 3:isqrt(n)
            n % i != 0 || return false
        end
        true
    end
    function stepp(step, start, stop)
        for n in start:stop
            if isprimi(n) && isprimi(n + step)
                return [n, n + step]
            end
        end
        return Int[]
    end

end

module Stepy
    export stepp

    primes = Set([2, 3, 5, 7])
    
    function isprime(n)
        n in primes && return true
        return !any(n % i == 0 for i in 2:floor(Int, sqrt(n)))
    end

    function stepp(g, m, n)
        for i in m:n-g
            if isprime(i) && isprime(i+g)
                return [i, i+g]
            end
        end
        return Int[]
    end

end

module Stepy
    export stepp

    function isprime(n)
      n >= 2 && all(n % d != 0 for d in 2:sqrt(n))
    end

    function stepp(step, start, stop)
      for n in start:stop - step
        if isprime(n) && isprime(n + step) return [n, n + step] end
      end
      []
    end

end

module Stepy
    export stepp

    function prime_sieve(max_prime::Int64)
        primes = Vector{Int64}()
        push!(primes, 2)
        for value in range(3, step=2, stop=max_prime)
            isprime(value, primes) && push!(primes, value)
        end
        return primes
    end

    function isprime(value, primes)
        isprime = true
        for prime in primes
            if value ≠ prime && value%prime == 0
                isprime = false
                break
            end
        end
        return isprime
    end

    function stepp(step, start, stop)
        primes = prime_sieve(ceil(Int64, √stop))
        if iseven(step)
            startvalue = start
            if iseven(start)
                startvalue += 1
            end
            if startvalue ≥ stop
                return Int[]
            end
            for value in range(startvalue, step=2, stop=stop)
                if isprime(value,primes) && isprime(value+step, primes)
                    return [value, value+step]
                end
            end
        elseif start == 2 # special case
            if start ≥ stop
                return Int[]
            end
            for value in range(start, stop=stop)
                if isprime(value,primes) && isprime(value+step, primes)
                    return [value, value+step]
                end
            end
        end
        return Int[]
    end

end

module Stepy
    export stepp

    function stepp(step, start, stop)
        is_prime(n) = all(x-> n%x != 0, 2:sqrt(n))
        for n in start:stop 
            is_prime(n) && is_prime(n+step) && return [n, n+step]
        end
        Int[]
    end

end

module Stepy
    export stepp

    function primes(n)
      primes = fill(true, n)
      primes[1] = false
      for p = 2:n
        primes[p] || continue
        for i = 2:div(n,p)
          primes[p*i] = false
        end
      end
      primes
    end  

    function stepp(step, start, stop)
      prime_gen = primes(stop)[start:stop]
      values = start:stop
      prime_gen = map(*, prime_gen, values)
      prime_gen = filter(p -> !iszero(p), prime_gen)
  
      for i in prime_gen
        for j in prime_gen
          if j - i == step
            return [i,j]
          end
        end
      end
      return []
    end

end

module Stepy
export stepp

"""Find all primes that are less than or equal to the limit."""
function primesbelow(limit::I)::Vector{I} where I <: Integer
    primes = trues(limit)
    primes[1] = false
    p = 2
    while !isnothing(p) && p <= sqrt(limit)
        primes[2p:p:limit] .= false
        p = findnext(primes, p + 1)
    end
    convert.(I, findall(primes))
end

function stepp(g, m, n)
    ps = primesbelow(n)
    l = length(ps)
    for i in findfirst(>=(m), ps):l - 1
        for j in i+1:l
            d = ps[j] - ps[i]
            if d == g
                return [ps[i], ps[j]]
            elseif d > g
                break
            end
        end
    end
    Int[]
end

end

module Stepy

export stepp

# Prime sieve because CodeWars timed out when I tried to load the Primes package
function primeset(max)
    mark = fill(true, max)
    mark[1] = false;
    for n in 2:max
        mark[n] || continue
        for toggle in (n * n):n:max
            mark[toggle] = false
        end
    end
    return Set(findall(mark));
end

function stepp(step, start, stop)
    prime_set = primeset(stop);
    for p in start:stop
        if p in prime_set && (p + step) in prime_set; return [p, p + step]; end
    end
    return []
end

end # module

            end
        end
    end
        return Int[]
    end
function isp(x::Int)
  i = 2
  while i <= sqrt(x)

  end
  return true
end

    if n < 4

    for i in start:stop

      end
    end
    Int[]
  end
end

export rank

alpharank(char::Char)::Int = Int(uppercase(char) - 0x40)

som(name::AbstractString)::Int = sum(alpharank.([name...])) + length(name)

function somthenname(a::Tuple{AbstractString,Int}, b::Tuple{AbstractString,Int})::Bool
    if a[2] == b[2]
        a[1] < b[1]
    else
        a[2] > b[2]
    end
end

    isempty(names) && return "No participants"
    ns = split(names, ',')

end

    export rank

    function rank(names, weights, n)
        isempty(names) && return "No participants"
        nameArr = split(names, ",")
        (n > length(nameArr)) && return "Not enough participants"
        function letterToValue(letter)
          Int(lowercase(first(letter))) - Int('a') + 1;
        end
        function nameCompare(a, b)
          a.value == b.value && return a.name < b.name
          b.value < a.value
        end
        nameValues = map(collect(enumerate(nameArr))) do (index, name)
          (name = name, value = weights[index] * (length(name) + sum(letterToValue, split(name, ""))))
        end
        first(sort(nameValues, lt = nameCompare)[n])
    end

module Prize
    export rank

    function rank(names, weights, n)
        function score(name)
            return sum(lowercase(letter)-'a'+1 for letter in name) + length(name)
        end
        if length(names)==0
            return "No participants"
        end
        value = Any[]
        keys = Any[]
        for (idx,name) in enumerate(split(names,","))
            push!(value , score(name) * weights[idx])
            push!(keys , name)                        
        end
        if !(n>length(value))
            return sort(collect(zip(value,keys)),by = tuple -> (-first(tuple),last(tuple)))[n][2]
        else
            return "Not enough participants"        
        end
    end

end

    function is_prime(n)
      "test if it's a prime"
      if n<=1
        return false
      end
  
      s = Iterators.filter(i->n%i==0, 2:floor(sqrt(n)))
      return if isempty(s) true else false end
    end

    function find_next_p(n)
      "find the next prime including itself"
      if is_prime(n)
        return n
      else
        return find_next_p(n+1)
      end
    end

    function gap(g, m, n)
      first_p = find_next_p(m)
      second_p = find_next_p(first_p+1)
      
      if second_p<=n
        if second_p-first_p==g      
          return [first_p, second_p]
        else
          return gap(g, second_p, n)
        end
      end
      return nothing
    end

function decode(str)
  if str == ""
    return []
  end
  regex = r"(.*?)\\(\d+)(.*)"
  if occursin(regex, str)
    m = match(regex, str)
    start = m[1] != "" ? split(m[1], "") : []
    group = m[3][1:min(end, parse(Int, m[2]))]
    return vcat(start, group, decode(m[3][parse(Int, m[2])+1:end]))
  else
    return split(str, "")
  end
end

function decode(str)
  result = []
  bs=false
  parsingg=false
  g=0
  for c in str
    if parsingg
      if isdigit(c)
        g=g*10+parse(Int,c)
        continue
      else
        parsingg=false
        push!(result,"")
      end
    end
    if g>0
      result[end]*=c
      g-=1
      continue
    end
    if bs
      bs=false
      if isdigit(c)
        parsingg=true
        g=parse(Int,c)
      else
        push!(result,"\\")
        push!(result,string(c))
      end
      continue
    end
    if c=='\\'
      bs=true
      continue
    end
    push!(result,string(c))
  end
  return result
end

function decode(str)
    result = []
    while length(str) > 0
        range = findfirst(r"\\\d+", str)
        if range == nothing
            append!(result, collect(str))
            break
        else
            indx = min(parse(Int, str[range[2:end]]), length(str[range[end]+1:end]))
            append!(result, vcat(collect(str[1:range[1]-1]), str[range[end]+1:range[end]+indx]))
            str = str[range[end]+indx+1:end]
        end
    end
    string.(result)
end

function decode(str)
    result::Array{String, 1} = []
    i = 1
    while i≤length(str)
        if str[i] == '\\'
            j = 1
            while i+j≤length(str) && isdigit(str[i+j])
                j += 1
            end
            l = parse(Int, str[i+1:i+j-1])       
            push!(result, string(str[i+j:min(i+j+l-1, end)]))
            i += j+l
        else
            push!(result, string(str[i]))
            i += 1
        end    
    end
  
    return result
end

function decode(str)
  result = []
  i = 1
  while i <= length(str)
    c = str[i]
    if c == '\\'
      i += 1
      m = match(r"\d+", str, i).match
      i += length(m)
      n = parse(Int, m)
      push!(result, str[i:min(length(str), i + n - 1)])
      i += n
    else
      push!(result, string(c))
      i += 1
    end
  end
  result
end

function decode(str::String)::Array{String}
    tokenformat = r"\\\d+|."
    result = String[]
    idx = 1
    while idx ≤ length(str)
        token = match( tokenformat, str, idx )
        idx += length(token.match)
        if length(token.match) == 1
            push!( result, token.match )
        else
            n = parse(Int,token.match[2:end])
            push!( result, str[idx:min(idx+n-1,end)] )
            idx += n
        end
    end
    result
end

function decode(str)
  ret = Array{String,1}()
  n=length(str)
  i=1
  while true
    (i>n) && break
    f=findnext(r"\\[0-9]+",str,i)
    (f==nothing) && break
    ret=vcat(ret,map(string,collect(str[i:f.start-1])))
    ii=min(n,f.stop+parse(Int,str[f.start+1:f.stop]))
    push!(ret,str[f.stop+1:ii])
    i=ii+1
  end
  vcat(ret,map(string,collect(str[i:n])))
end

function decode(str)
  ret = Array{String,1}()
  n=length(str)
  i=1
  while true
    (i>n) && break
    f=findnext(r"\\[0-9]+",str,i)
    (f==nothing) && break
    while i<f.start
      push!(ret,string(str[i]))
      i+=1
    end
    g=parse(Int,str[f.start+1:f.stop])
    ii=min(n,f.stop+g)
    push!(ret,str[f.stop+1:ii])
    i=ii+1
  end
  while i<=n
    push!(ret,string(str[i]))
    i+=1
  end
  ret  
end

module Parab
    export len_curve
    
    len_curve(n) = len_curve(Curve(x->x^2, 0.0, 1.0), n)

    function len_curve(curve,n)
      points = [Point(x,curve.f(x)) for x in get_anchors(curve,n)]
      segments = [distance(p1,p2) for (p1,p2) in zip(points[1:end-1], points[2:end])]
      return sum(segments)
    end
    
    struct Limits
      x_min::Float64
      x_max::Float64
    end
    get_anchors(l::Limits,n_pieces)=collect( 0.0:n_pieces )./n_pieces.*(l.x_max-l.x_min) .+ l.x_min 

    struct Curve
      f
      limits::Limits
    end
    Curve(f,x_min,x_max) = Curve(f,Limits(x_min,x_max))
    get_anchors(c::Curve,n_pieces)=get_anchors(c.limits,n_pieces)

    struct Point
      x::Float64
      y::Float64
    end
    distance(p1::Point, p2::Point) = sqrt( (p1.x-p2.x)^2 + (p1.y-p2.y)^2 )
 
end

module Parab
    export len_curve

    function len_curve(n)
        hypot(x, y) = sqrt(x*x + y*y)
        res = sum(hypot(2 * i + 1, n) for i in 0:n-1) / n ^ 2
        floor(res * 1e9) / 1e9
    end

end

module Parab
    export len_curve

    function len_curve(n)
     
      xs = collect(0.0:(1/n):1.0)
      fs = xs.^2
      sum(sqrt.(((fs[2:end]-fs[1:end-1]).^2).+((1/n)^2)))

    end

end

module Parab
    export len_curve
  
    f(x::Float64)::Float64=x*x
    euclidean(a::Vector{Float64}, b::Vector{Float64})::Float64 = a .- b |> (x -> x .* x) |> sum |> sqrt
    
    function len_curve(n)
        i :: Float64 = 0.0
        sm = 0.0
        incr = 1.0 / n
        while i < 1.0
          iincr = i + incr
          if iincr > 1.0
            iincr = 1.0
          end 
          p1 = f(i)
          p2 = f(iincr)
          dist = euclidean([i, p1], [iincr, p2])
          sm += dist
          i += incr
        end
        return  round(sm, digits=9)
    end

end

module Parab
    export len_curve

    function len_curve(n)
        sum([sqrt(sum(coord .^ 2)) for coord in diff([[i / n, (i / n)^2] for i in 0:n])])
    end

end

module Parab
    export len_curve

    function len_curve(n)
        y(x) = x^2
        xi = 0.0
        yi = y(xi)
        dist = 0.0
        for xip1 in range(1/n, length = n, stop=1.0)
            yip1 = y(xip1)
            dist += √((xip1-xi)^2+(yip1-yi)^2)
            xi, yi = xip1, yip1
        end
        return dist
    end

end

module Parab
    
export len_curve

function len_curve(n)
    xValues = Float64[0]
    for i in 1:(n-1)
        push!(xValues, (xValues[i] + 1/n))
    end
    push!(xValues, 1)
    yValues = Float64[x * x for x in xValues]
    distances = Float64[sqrt(((1/n)^2) + ((yValues[i+1] - yValues[i])^2)) for i in 1:n]
    return sum(distances)
end

  join(e, "

module Euler
    export ex_euler

    function fprime(x,y)
    2 - exp(-4 * x) - 2 * y
end
  
function exact(x)
    1 + 0.5 * exp(-4 * x) - 0.5 * exp(-2 * x)
end

function ex_euler(nb) 
    x0 = 0.0
    y = 1.0
    res = 0.0
    
    for m in 0:nb
        res += abs((y - exact(x0 + m * 1.0/nb))/exact(x0 + m * 1.0/nb))
        y = y + fprime(x0 + x0 + m * 1.0/nb, y) * 1.0/nb
    end
    
    trunc(res/(nb+1),digits=6)
end

end

module Euler
    export ex_euler

    function ex_euler(nb) 
        function ode(x, y)
            2.0 - exp(-4.0 * x) - 2.0 * y
        end
        function exact(x)
            1.0 + 0.5 * exp(-4.0 * x) - 0.5 * exp(-2.0 * x)
        end

        yi = 1.0; xi = 0.0; h = 1.0 / nb
        err = 0.0; i = 0
        while (i < nb)
            yi += ode(xi, yi) * h
            xi += h
            zi = exact(xi)
            err += abs(yi - zi) / zi
            i += 1
        end
        res = err / (nb + 1.0)
        floor(res * 1e6) / 1e6
    end

end

module Euler
    export ex_euler

    f(x, y) = 2 - exp(-4x) - 2y

    z(x) = 1 + 1//2*exp(-4x) - 1//2*exp(-2x)

    x_vector(n, len) = range(0, step = 1/n, length = len)

    function y_vector(n)
        next_y(x, y, h) = y + f(x, y) * h
        accfun(y, x) = next_y(x, y, 1/n)
        Y = accumulate(accfun, x_vector(n, n); init = 1)
        pushfirst!(Y, 1)
    end
        
    z_vector(n) = map(z, x_vector(n, n+1))

    function err_vector(n)
        Y = y_vector(n)
        Z = z_vector(n)
        @. abs(Y - Z) / Z
    end

    function ex_euler(n)
        trunc(x) = floor(x * 1e6) / 1e6
        trunc(sum(err_vector(n)) / (n + 1))
    end
end

        range(0, step = 1/n, length = len)

    function y_vector(n)
        next_y(x, y, h) = y + f(x, y) * h
        accfun(y, x) = next_y(x, y, 1/n)
        Y = accumulate(accfun, x_vector(n, n); init = 1)
        pushfirst!(Y, 1)
        return Y
    end
        
    function z_vector(n)

    end

    end

module Euler
    export ex_euler

    de(x, y) = 2 - exp(-4x) - 2y

    sol(x) = 1 + .5exp(-4x) - .5exp(-2x)

    increase((x, y), n) = de(x,y)/n

    function ex_euler(nb) 
      xs = [i/nb for i=0:nb]
      ys = [1]
      for i=1:nb
        y1 = ys[end] + increase((xs[i], ys[end]), nb)
        ys = [ys; y1]
      end

      zs = [sol(x) for x=xs]

      errors = [abs(ys[i]-zs[i])/zs[i] for i=1:nb+1]
  
      round(sum(errors)/(nb+1), RoundToZero; digits=6)
    end

end

module Euler
    export ex_euler
    import Base.MathConstants.e

    function fy(x)
        1 + 0.5e^(-4x) - 0.5e^(-2x)
    end

    function df(x, y)
        2 - e^(-4x) - 2y
    end

    function ex_euler(n) 
        y, h = 1, 1/n
        errors = Vector{Float64}(undef, n+1)
        errors[1] = 0.0
        for k ∈ 1:n
            y += df((k-1) / n, y) * h
            z = fy(k / n)
            errors[k+1] = abs(y - z) / z
        end
        trunc(sum(errors) / (n+1), digits=6)
    end

end

module Euler
    export ex_euler

    function fprime(x,y)
    2 - exp(-4 * x) - 2 * y
end
  
function ex_euler(nb) 
      x0 = 0.
      y0 = 1.
      y = [y0]
      ex = [1 + 0.5 * exp(-4 * x) - 0.5 * exp(-2 * x) for x in 0:1/nb:1]
      for m in 0:nb-1
        push!(y,y[end] + fprime(x0 + m * 1.0/nb,y[end]) * 1.0/nb)
      end
      
      trunc(sum(abs.(y .- ex)./ex)/(nb+1),digits=6)
end

end

module Euler
    export ex_euler

    f(x, y) = 2 - ℯ ^ -4x - 2y
    z(x) = 1 + (ℯ ^ -4x - ℯ ^ -2x) / 2

    function ex_euler(nb)
        y_k, z_k = [1.0], [1.0]
        for i in 1:nb
            push!(y_k, y_k[i] + f((i - 1) / nb, y_k[i]) / nb)
            push!(z_k, z(i / nb))
        end
        trunc(sum(abs.(y_k - z_k) ./ z_k) / (nb + 1), digits = 6)
    end

end

module Euler
    export ex_euler

    function slope(x, y)
      2 - exp(-4x) - 2y
    end

    function y_fun(x)
      1 + 0.5exp(-4x) - 0.5exp(-2x)
    end

    function ex_euler(nb) 
      prev_x, prev_y = 0, 1
      cumm_err = 0
      h = 1/nb
      for x = (1:nb)/nb
        y = prev_y + slope(prev_x, prev_y)*h
        z = y_fun(x)
        cumm_err += abs(y-z)/z
        prev_x, prev_y = x,y
      end
      trunc(cumm_err/(nb+1), digits=6)
    end

end

module Euler
    export ex_euler

	function ex_euler(n) 
		f(x,y) = 2 - ℯ^-4x - 2y
		F(x,y) = 1 + 0.5ℯ^-4x - 0.5ℯ^-2x
		x,y = (0,1)
		h = 1/n
		err = 0
		for i in 1:n
			y += f(x,y)*h
			x += h
      z = F(x,y)
			err += abs(y - z)/z
		end
		floor(err/(n+1), digits=6)
	end

end

function max_redigit(n::Integer)::Union{Integer,Nothing}
    if n > 99 && n <= 999
        parse(typeof(n), join(sort(digits(n), rev=true)))
    end
end
max_redigit(num::Integer)::Union{Integer,Nothing} = 99 < num < 1000 ? (return num |> digits |> sort |> reverse |> join |> x -> parse(Int, x)) : return nothing

function max_redigit(num::Integer)::Union{Integer,Nothing}
    numarr = collect("$num")
    if num <= 0 || size(numarr)!=(3,)
        nothing
    else
        parse(Int, join(sort(numarr; rev=true)))
    end
end

function max_redigit(num::Integer)::Union{Integer,Nothing}
  if !(100 ≤ num ≤ 999)
    nothing
  else
    parse(Int, join(reverse(sort(collect(string(num))))))
  end
end

function max_redigit(num::Integer)::Union{Integer,Nothing}
    if num > 99 && num < 1000
        parse(typeof(num), join(sort(digits(num), rev=true)))
    end
end

module Popu
    export nb_year

    """
    Function that returns the number of years a population needs to surpass a specific
    size.
    
    Arguments:
    p_0: population at year 0
    percent: yearly growth of the population
    augmentation: inhabitants coming (or leaving not happening in the test cases as >0) each year
    p_T: population to surpass
    """
    function nb_year(p_0, percent, augmentation, p_T)

        # transform percentage input
        percent /= 100
    
        # initialise year count
        iteration = 0
        # iterate while current population has not reached asked population size
        while p_0 < p_T
      
            """
            I believe, the kata assumes implicitly that there can only exist beings in size of
            non-negative integers. Therefore, using "floor()" to evaluate the population at the end
            of a year.
            """
            # calculate (and update) population size for the current year
            p_0 = floor(p_0 * (1+percent) + augmentation)
            # increase year count
            iteration += 1
    
        end
    
        return iteration

end

end

      n_temp = n_new
      n_previous = n_new
      n_new = thirt_step(n_temp)
      steps += 1
    end
    return n_new
  end

  function thirt_step(n::Int64)
    sequence = [1,10,9,12,3,4]
    n_string = string(n)
    sum_thirt = 0
    i_seq = 1
    for digit in reverse(n_string)
      if i_seq > 6
        i_seq = 1
      end
      sum_thirt += parse(Int64,digit) * sequence[i_seq]
      i_seq += 1
    end
    return sum_thirt
  end
end

module Finance
    export fortune

    function fortune(f0, p, c0, n, i)::Bool
        addpercent(current,percent) = current+(current*percent)÷100
        f = f0
        c = c0
        for year in 2:n
            f = addpercent(f,p)-c
            c = addpercent(c,i)
        end
        f ≥ 0
    end

end

module Finance
    export fortune

    function fortune(f0, p, c0, n, i)
        prev_x, prev_c = f0, c0
        nou_x = nou_c = 0.0
        for k in 1:n - 1
            nou_x = floor(prev_x + p / 100.0 * prev_x - prev_c)
            nou_c = floor(prev_c + i / 100.0 * prev_c)
            prev_x, prev_c = nou_x, nou_c
        end
        nou_x >= 0
    end

end

        for yr in 1:n-1

module Finance
    export fortune

        fn = floor(f0 * (1+p/100) - c0, digits=0)
        cn = floor(c0 * (1+i/100), digits=0)
  
        if fn < 0 && n > 1
            false
        elseif n==1
            true
        else
            fortune(fn, p, cn, n-1, i)
        end
  
    end

end

module Finance
  export fortune

  function fortune(f0, p, c0, n, i)
    for _ in 1:n-1
      f0 += floor(f0 * (p / 100)) - c0
      c0 += floor(c0 * (i / 100))
    end
    f0 >= 0
  end
end

module Finance
    export fortune

    function fortune(f0, p, c0, n, i)
        f = f0
        c = c0
        pp = p == 0 ? 0 : p/100
        ii = i == 0 ? 0 : i/100
        m = n-1
        while (m > 0)
          f += floor(pp * f - c)
          c += floor(ii * c)
          m -= 1
          if (f < 0) 
            return 0
          end
        end
        return f >= 0
     end

end

  end

function close_compare(a, b, margin)
    abs(a-b) <= margin ?  0 :
    a < b              ? -1 :
                          1
end

function close_compare(a, b)
  close_compare(a,b,0)
end
close_compare(a, b, margin=0) = abs(a-b) ≤ margin ? 0 : a < b ? -1 : 1

function close_compare(a, b, margin=0)
    if abs(a-b) <= margin
      return 0
    elseif a < b
      return -1
    else
      return 1
    end
end

function close_compare(a, b, margin=0)
    if margin >= abs(a-b)
      return 0
    elseif a < b
      return -1
    else
      return 1
    end
end

function close_compare(a::Number, b::Number, margin = 0.0 )
  a2,b2,margin2 = Float64(a), Float64(b), Float64(margin)
  margin2 >= abs(a2-b2) ? 0 : a2 < b2 ? -1 : 1
end

function close_compare(a, b, margin = 0)
    if isapprox(a, b, atol = margin)
        0
    elseif a < b
        -1
    else
        1
    end
end

module Simpson
  export simpson
  function simpson(n)
    pi/n*(1+2*cos(pi/n)^3+3*cos(2*pi/n))/(sin(3*pi/n))
  end
end

module Simpson
    export simpson
    
    function func(x)
      return (3*sin(x)^3)/2
    end

    function simpson(n)
        # your code
      f1 = func(0)
      f2 = func(pi)
      h = pi/n
      f3 = 4*sum(func( (2*i - 1)*h ) for i in 1:n÷2)
      f4 = 2*sum(func(2*i*h) for i in 1:n÷2-1)
  
      return pi*(f1 + f2 + f3 +f4)/(3*n)
  
    end

end

module Simpson
    export simpson

    function simpson(n)
        f(x) = 1.5 * sin(x) ^ 3
        a = 0; b = pi; h = (b - a) / n; s = f(a) + f(b)
        for i in 1:2:n - 1
            s += 4 * f(a + i * h)
        end
        for i in 2:2:n - 2
            s += 2 * f(a + i * h)
        end
        s * h / 3.0
    end

end

module Simpson
    export simpson

    simpson(n) = simpson(x->3/2*sin(x)^3, 0, π, n) 
           
    function simpson(f, a, b, n)
      h = (b-a)/n
      (b - a) / 3n * (f(a) + f(b) + 4sum(f(a + (2i -1)h) for i in 1:n÷2) + 2sum(f(a + 2i*h) for i in 1:n÷2-1))
    end

end

module Simpson
    export simpson

    function simpson(n)
        w = vcat(1, 2*ones(n-1)+collect(1:n-1) .% 2 .* 2, 1)
        m = pi/3/n
        f(x) = 3/2*sin(x)^3
        x = pi*(0:1/n:1)
        m*sum(f.(x).*w)
    end

end

module Simpson
    export simpson

    function simpson_fab(f, n, a, b)
      h = (b-a)/n
      m = n/2
      p = 4sum(f(a+(2i-1)h) for i in 1:1:m)
      q = 2sum(f(a+2i*h) for i in 1:1:(m-1))
      (1/3)h*(f(a)+f(b)+p+q)
    end

    function simpson(n)
      f = x -> (3/2)sin(x)^3
      simpson_fab(f, n, 0, pi)
    end

end

module Simpson
    export simpson

    function simpson(n)
        f(x) = 3/2*sin(x)^3
        a,b = 0,π
        h = (b-a)/n
        h/3*(f(a) + f(b) + 4*sum(f(a + (2i-1)h) for i=1:n÷2) + 2*sum(f(a + 2*i*h) for i=1:n÷2-1))
    end

end

module Simpson
    export simpson

    function simpson(n)
        pi/n * (2 * sum(sin((2i-1) * pi / n)^3 for i in 1:n÷2) + sum(sin(2j * pi / n)^3 for j in 1:n÷2-1)) 
    end

end

module Simpson
    export simpson

    function simpson(n)
        a = 0
        b = π
        f(x) = 3/2*sin(x)^3
        h = (b-a) / n
        simp = f(a) + f(b)
        for i = 1:n÷2
            simp += 4f(a+(2i-1)h) + 2f(a+2i*h)
        end
        simp -= 2f(a+h*n)
        simp *= (b-a)/(3n)
    end

end

module Simpson
    export simpson

    function simpson(n)
        function f(x)
            return (3/2)*sin(x)^3
        end
        sum1 = sum([f((2*i-1)*pi/n) for i in 1:n/2])
        sum2 = sum([f((2*i)*pi/n) for i in 1:(n/2-1)])

        return (pi/(3*n))*(4*sum1+2*sum2)
        
    end

end

module Braking
    export dist, speed
    function dist(v, mu)                    # suppose reaction time is 1
        g = 9.81                            # acceleration due to gravity in m/s
        coef = 1000.0 / 3600.0              # km/h -> m/s
        dreact = v * coef                   # distance of reaction with t = 1
        vms = coef * v                      # speed in m/s
        dbrak = 0.5 * vms ^ 2.0 / mu / g    # braking distance
        return dreact + dbrak               # total distance
    end

    function speed(d, mu)                   # suppose reaction time is 1
        g = 9.81                            # acceleration due to gravity in m/s
        coef = 3600.0 / 1000.0              # m/s -> km/h
        return 0.5 * mu * g * (- 2.0 + sqrt(4.0 + 8.0 * d / mu /g)) * coef 
    end
end

module Braking
    export dist, speed
    function dist(v, mu)                    # suppose reaction time is 1
        g = 9.81                            # acceleration due to gravity in m/s
        coef = 1000.0 / 3600.0              # km/h -> m/s
        dreact = v * coef                   # distance of reaction with t = 1
        vms = coef * v                      # speed in m/s
        dbrak = 0.5 * vms ^ 2.0 / mu / g    # braking distance
        return dreact + dbrak               # total distance
    end

    function speed(d, mu)                   # suppose reaction time is 1
        g = 9.81                            # acceleration due to gravity in m/s
        coef = 3600.0 / 1000.0              # m/s -> km/h
        return 0.5 * mu * g * (- 2.0 + sqrt(4.0 + 8.0 * d / mu /g)) * coef 
    end
end

module Braking
    export dist, speed
    dist(v, mu) = v/3.6 + v^2/mu/254.2752
    speed(d, mu) = (-1/3.6 + sqrt(1/12.96 + d/mu/63.5688))*mu*127.1376
end

module Braking
    export dist, speed
    function dist(v, mu)
        v / 3.6 + (v / 3.6)^2 / 19.62mu
    end

    function speed(d, mu)
        3.6 * (sqrt(9.81mu * (9.81mu + 2d)) - 9.81mu)
    end
end

module Braking
    export dist, speed

    function dist(v, mu)
      u = v * 5.0 / 18.0
      u + (u ^ 2.0) / (2.0 * mu * 9.81)
    end

    function speed(d, mu)
      b = -2.0 * mu * 9.81
      3.6 * (b + (b ^ 2.0 - 4.0 * b * d) ^ 0.5 ) / 2.0
    end
end

module Braking
    export dist, speed
    function dist(v, mu)
        v *= 1000/3600
        v + (v^2)/(2*mu*9.81)
    end

    function speed(d, mu)
        k = 2*mu*9.81
        (3600/1000) * (sqrt(k) * sqrt(k + 4*d) - k) / 2
    end
end

module Braking
    export dist, speed
    function dist(v, mu)
        v_real = v/3.6
        return v_real^2/(2*mu*9.81) + v_real
    end

    function speed(d, mu)                   # suppose reaction time is 1
        a = 1/(2*mu*9.81)
        b = 1
        c = -d
        delta = b^2 - 4*a*c
        x1 = (-b - sqrt(delta))/(2*a)
        x2 = (-b + sqrt(delta))/(2*a)
        if x1 > 0
          return x1*3.6
        else
          return x2*3.6
        end
    end
end

module Braking
  export dist, speed
  function dist(v, mu)                    # suppose reaction time is 1
    t = 1.0
    g = 9.81
    vms = v / 3.6
    vms*vms / (2*mu*g) + vms*t
  end

  function speed(d, mu)                   # suppose reaction time is 1
    t = 1.0
    g = 9.81
    a = 1/(2*mu*g)
    b = t
    c = -d
    (-b + √(b*b-4*a*c))/(2*a) * 3.6
  end
end

module Braking
    export dist, speed
    const mps_per_kph = 1000 / 3600
    const kph_per_mps = 1 / mps_per_kph
    function dist(v, mu)                    # suppose reaction time is 1
        v_mps = v * mps_per_kph
        v_mps^2 / (2 * mu * 9.81) + v_mps * 1
    end

    function speed(d, mu)                   # suppose reaction time is 1
        mu * 9.81 * (-1 + sqrt(1 + 2 * d / (mu * 9.81))) * kph_per_mps
    end
end

module Braking
  export dist, speed

  function dist(v, mu)                    # suppose reaction time is 1
    vms = v * 10 / 36
    vms += (vms ^ 2) / (2 * mu * 9.81)
  end

  function speed(d, mu)                   # suppose reaction time is 1
    v = (-2 * mu * 9.81 + sqrt((mu * 9.81 * 2) ^ 2 + 8 * mu * 9.81 * d)) / 2
    v *= 3600 / 1000
  end
end

    true
    else

    end

function is_triangle(a,b,c)
  edges=[a,b,c]
  
  # the largest edge and its index in the edge list 
  m = maximum(edges)
  idx_m = findall(x->x==m, edges)[1]

  # In a triangle, the sum of the length of 
  # its smaller edges is larger than the largest edge
  sum(edges[setdiff(1:3, idx_m)]) > m
end
is_triangle(a,b,c) = a > 0 && b > 0 && c > 0 && a + b > c && a + c > b && b + c > a
is_triangle(a,b,c) = 2max(a, b, c) < a + b + c

module Dif
    export mxdiflg

    function mxdiflg(a1, a2)
        if isempty(a1) || isempty(a2)
            return -1
        end
        min1, max1 = extrema(length.(a1))
        min2, max2 = extrema(length.(a2))
        return max(max1 - min2, max2 - min1)
    end
end

        if a1 == [] || a2 == [] return -1 end
        l1, l2 = map(length, a1), map(length, a2)

    function mxdiflg(a1, a2)
      if length(a1) == 0 || length(a2) == 0 
        return -1
      end
      a1s = sort(a1, lt=(x, y) -> length(x) > length(y))
      a2s = sort(a2, lt=(x, y) -> length(x) > length(y))

module Dif

    function mxdiflg(a1, a2)
        if a1 |> isempty || a2 |> isempty
          return -1
        end

        (a1_min, a1_max) = extrema(s -> s |> length, a1)
        (a2_min, a2_max) = extrema(s -> s |> length, a2)
        max(a2_max - a1_min, a1_max - a2_min)
    end

module Dif
    export mxdiflg

    function mxdiflg(a1, a2)
        if length(a1)  < 1 | length(a2) < 1 
            return -1
        else
          max =-1
          for i = 1:length(a1)
            for j= 1:length(a2)
              dist = abs(length(a1[i])-length(a2[j]));
              if dist > max 
                max = dist;
              end
            end
          end
          return max
        end
    end

end

        end
        l1, l2 = length.(a1), length.(a2)
        d1, d2 = abs(maximum(l1)-minimum(l2)), abs(maximum(l2)-minimum(l1))
        max(d2, d1)
    end

module Disease
    export epidemic

    function epidemic(tm, n, s0, i0, b, a)
      imax, dt, t, s, r, i = 0, tm/n, 0, s0, 0, i0
      while t < tm
        sk, ik, rk, = s, i, r
        s = sk - dt*b*sk*ik
        i = i + dt*(b*sk*ik-a*ik)
        r = rk + dt*ik*a
        if i > imax
            imax = i
        end
        t += dt
      end
    return imax
    end
end

module Disease
    export epidemic

    function epidemic(tm, n, s0, i0, b, a)
        dt = tm / n; s1 = s0; i1 = i0; r1 = 0; ndx = 0; max = 0
        while ndx < n
            s2 = s1 - dt * b * s1 * i1
            i2 = i1 + dt * (b * s1 * i1 - a * i1)
            r2 = r1 + dt * i1 * a
            if i2 > max
                max = i2
            end
            ndx += 1
            s1, i1, r1 = s2, i2, r2
        end
        Int(floor(max))
    end
end

module Disease
    export epidemic

    function epidemic(tm, n, s0, i0, b, a)
        S, I, maxi = s0, i0, i0
        for i in 1:n
            S, I = S*(1 - tm/n * b * I), I*(1 + tm/n * (b * S - a))
            if trunc(I) > maxi maxi = trunc(I) end
        end
        maxi
    end
end

module Disease
    export epidemic

    function epidemic(tm, n, s0, i0, b, a)
        dt = tm/n
        S = Float64[s0]
        I = Float64[i0]
        R = Float64[0]
        for k in 1:n
          s2 = S[end]- dt * b * S[end] * I[end]
          i2 = I[end] + dt * (b * S[end] * I[end] - a * I[end])
          r2 = R[end] + dt * I[end] *a
          push!(S, s2)
          push!(I, i2)
          push!(R, r2)
        end
        return trunc(Int64, maximum(I))
    end
end

module Disease
    export epidemic

    function epidemic(tm, n, s0, i0, b, a)
        sk = s0
        ik = i0
        rk = 0
        maxi = ik
        dt = tm/n
        for t in 1:n
            sk1 = sk - dt * b * sk * ik
            ik1 = ik + dt * (b * sk * ik - a * ik)
            rk1 = rk + dt * ik * a
            sk = sk1
            ik = ik1
            rk = rk1
            maxi = max(maxi, ik)
        end
        return floor(Int, maxi)
    end
end

module Disease
  export epidemic

  function epidemic(tm, n, s0, i0, b, a)
    dt = tm / n
    S = Vector{Float64}(undef, n)
    I = Vector{Float64}(undef, n)
    R = Vector{Float64}(undef, n)
    S[1] = s0
    I[1] = i0
    R[1] = 0
    
    for k in 2:n
      S[k] = S[k-1] - dt * b * S[k-1] * I[k-1]
      I[k] = I[k-1] + dt * I[k-1] * (b * S[k-1] - a)
      R[k] = R[k-1] + dt * I[k-1] * a
    end
    return floor(Int, maximum(I))
  end
end

module Disease
    export epidemic

    function epidemic(tm, n, s, i, b, a)
        dt = tm/n
        imax = i
        for _ in 1:n
            s, i = s - dt * b * s * i, i + dt * (b * s * i - a * i)
            imax = max(imax,i)
        end       
        trunc(Int,imax)
    end
end

module Disease
  export epidemic

  function epidemic(tm, n, s0, i0, b, a)
    dt = tm / n
    s = [convert(Float64, s0)]
    i = [convert(Float64, i0)]
    r = [0.0]
    t = [0.0]
    k = 1
    while k < n
      push!(t, (k+1) * dt)
      push!(s, s[k] - dt * b * s[k] * i[k])
      push!(i, i[k] + dt * (b * s[k] * i[k] - a * i[k]))
      push!(r, r[k] + dt * i[k] * a)
      k += 1
    end
    round(maximum(i))
  end
end

module Disease
    export epidemic

    function epidemic(tm, n, s0, i0, b, a)
        s = s0
        i = i0
        r = 0
        t = 0
        dt = tm/n
        imax = 0
        while t<tm
          sd = dt*(-b*s*i)
          id = dt*(b*s*i-a*i)
          rd = dt*(a*i)
          s += sd
          i += id
          r += rd
          t += dt
          imax = max(imax, floor(Int, i))
        end
        return imax;
    end
end

module Disease
    export epidemic

    function epidemic(tm::Number, n::Number, s0::Number, i0::Number, b::Number, a::Number)::Int
        dt::Float64 = tm/n
        dta::Float64 = dt * a
        dtb::Float64 = -dt * b
        s::Float64 = s0
        i::Float64 = i0
        r::Float64 = 0
        for t::Float64 = 0:dt:tm
            ds = dtb * s * i
            dr = dta * i
            di = -ds -dr
            if di < 0
                break
            end
            s += ds
            r += dr
            i += di
        end
        return Int(floor(i))
    end
end

    for i in 2:n

 end

function sum_fibs(n::Integer)::Integer
  fib(n) = reduce((acc, x) -> vcat(acc, acc[x-1]+acc[x-2]), 3:n, init=[1,1])
  filter(iseven, fib(n)) |> sum

function sum_fibs(n::Integer)::Integer
    s = 0
    (f, g) = (1, 0)
    for i in 2:n
        (f, g) = (f+g, f)
        if f%2==0
           s += f
        end
    end
    s

function sum_fibs(n::Integer)::Integer
  fibs = [0, 1]
  for i in 3:n+1 push!(fibs, fibs[i-1] + fibs[i-2]) end
  sum(f for f in fibs if iseven(f))
end

fibs = [0, 1, 1, 2, 3, 5]

function sum_fibs(n::Integer)::Integer
  while length(fibs) < n+1
    push!(fibs, fibs[end] + fibs[end-1])
  end
  sum([i for i in fibs[1:n+1] if iseven(i)])
end

module Mumbling
    export accum
    function accum(s)
        capture_array = []
        for (index, ch) in enumerate(s)
          word = ch^index
          up_word = titlecase(word)
          push!(capture_array, up_word)
         end
    return join(capture_array, "-")
    end

module Mumbling
    export accum

    function accum(s)
    s = lowercase(s)
    arr = []
    for i = 1:length(s)
        push!(arr, repeat(s[i], i))
        arr[i] = uppercasefirst(arr[i])
    end
    return join(arr, '-')
end

end

  rch = "yuiophjklnm"
  
  odds = word[1:2:end]
  evens = word[2:2:end]

function comfortableword(word::String)::Bool
    hands = ("qwertasdfgzxcvb", "yuiophjklnm")
    firsthand = Int(occursin(word[1], hands[1]))
    all(occursin(c, hands[1 + (i + firsthand) % 2]) for (i, c) in Iterators.enumerate(word))
end

left = "qwertasdfgzxcvb"
right = "yuiophjklnm"

function comfortableword(word::String)::Bool
  switch = word[1] in left ? 0 : 1
  for c in word[2:end]
    if switch == 0 && c in left
      return false
    elseif switch == 1 && c in right
      return false
    end
    switch ⊻= 1
  end
  true
end

function comfortableword(word::String)::Bool
  Left= "q, w, e, r, t, a, s, d, f, g, z, x, c, v, b"
  Right= "y, u, i, o, p, h, j, k, l, n, m"
  prev=' '
  for c in word
    cur=c in Left ? 'l' : 'r'
    if cur==prev
      return false
    end
    prev=cur
  end
  return true
end

  return occursin(c,"yuiophjklnm")
end

function comfortableword(word::String)::Bool
  w=lowercase(word)
  a=in(w[1])
  for c in chop(w,head=1,tail=0)
    b=in(c)
    if a==b
      return false
    else
      a=b
    end
  end
  return true
end

function comfortableword(word::String)::Bool
    right = ['y', 'u', 'i', 'o', 'p', 'h', 'j', 'k', 'l', 'n', 'm']
    for i = 2:length(word)
      if in(right).(word[i-1])[1] + in(right).(word[i])[1] != 1
        return false
      end
    end
    return true
end

module Ball
    export max_ball
    function max_ball(v0)
        g = 9.81
        t = 0
        dt = 1
        t_max = 0
        h_max = 0.0
        h = 0.0
        while h_max ≤ h
            h = v0/3.6*t/10 - 0.5*g*t*t/100
            if h_max < h
                h_max = h
                t_max = t
            end
            t += dt
        end
        return t_max
    end
end

module Ball
    export max_ball
    function max_ball(v0) # in km/h
        g = 9.81 # m/s^2
        v0 = v0 / 3.6 # m/s
        height(t) = v0*t - 0.5*g*t^2
        t_max = 2*v0 / g
        times = 0.1:0.1:t_max # s
        return argmax(height.(times))
    end
end

      hmax = 0 
      t = 1
      while true
        h = v0*t/36 - 0.5*9.81*t*t/100

        hmax = h
        t += 1
      end 
      t - 1
    end

module Ball
    export max_ball
    function max_ball(v0)
        # your code
        v0 /= 3.6
        g = 9.81
        t = 10v0 / g
        t1 = floor(t)
        t2 = ceil(t)
        h1 = 0.1v0*t1 - 0.005g * t1^2
        h2 = 0.1v0*t2 - 0.005g * t2^2
        h1 > h2 ? t1 : t2
    end
end

module Ball
    export max_ball
    function max_ball(v0)
        # want to find t where v = 0, then return closest 10th of a second.
        # Use derivative function of h = v*t - 0.5*g*t*t wrt time
        # dh/dt = v - g * t (power rule)
        # solve for time where dh/dt = 0.0

        # Negative velocity shortcut to zero
        if (v0 < 0.0)
          return 0
        end

        v_ms = (v0 * 1000) / 3600
        time_zero = v_ms / 9.81
        # divide by tenth of a second to get the index
        time_index = time_zero / 0.1
        # round, cast to Int
        return Int(round(time_index))
    end
end

function nb_dig(n, d)
    all_digits = reduce(vcat,[digits(i^2) for i in (0:n)]) 
    count(_ds -> d ∈ _ds, all_digits)
end

function nb_dig(k, d)
  m = 0
  for i in 0:k
    n = i^2
    if n == 0 && d == 0
      m = m+1
    else
      while n>0
        p = n % 10
        if p == d
          m = m+1
        end
        n = n÷10
      end
    end
  end
  m
end

function get_middle(s)
  n = length(s)
  r = fld(n,2)
  n%2==0 ? s[r:r+1] : s[r+1:r+1]
end

function get_middle(s)
  if length(s) % 2 == 1
    s[length(s) ÷ 2 + 1:length(s) ÷ 2 + 1]
  else
    s[length(s) ÷ 2:length(s) ÷ 2 + 1]
  end
end

function get_middle(s)
  if length(s) > 1
    return s[div(length(s) + 1, 2) : length(s) - div(length(s) + 1, 2) + 1]
  else
    return s
  end
end

"""
    get_middle(s::String)::String
return middle character(s) of a string
"""
function get_middle(s)
  m = median(1:length(s)) # median() 返回 Float
  s[Int(floor(m)):Int(ceil(m))]
end

function get_middle(s)
  # code goes here!
  n = length(s)
if n % 2 == 0
  s[(n÷2):(n÷2+1)]
else
  s[(n÷2+1):(n÷2+1)]
end

end

function get_middle(s)
  len = length(s)
  slice = cld(len, 2)
  if len % 2 != 0
    return string(s[slice]) 
  else
    return s[slice:slice+1]
  end
end

function find_even_index(arr)
 sumsides([], arr)
end

function sumsides(left, right)    
  if left == []
      left_sum = 0
  else
      left_sum = sum(left)
  end
  
  if right == []
      return -1
  elseif left_sum == sum(right[2:end])
      return length(left)
  else
      return sumsides([left;right[1]], right[2:end])-1
  end
end

function find_even_index(arr)
  s = sum(arr)
  comsum = 0
  for i in 1:length(arr)
    2comsum + arr[i] == s && return i
    comsum += arr[i]
  end
  return -1
end

function find_even_index(arr)
  
  function move_and_test(left, right, i)
    if right==left
      return i
    end
    
    if i==length(arr)
      return -1
    end

    i += 1
    left += arr[i-1]
    right -= arr[i]
    return move_and_test(left, right, i)
  end
  
  move_and_test(0, sum(arr)-arr[1], 1)
end

"""
Returns a non-negative integer as the index of the input array for which holds that
the left side of the integer equals the right side of the integer (excluding
the integer), if such a sum exists; else it runs -1 for non-existence.

"""
function find_even_index(arr)

    # initialise with integer for non-existence
    integer = -1

    # loop over every index in array
    for i in reverse(range(1, stop=length(arr)))
        # for each index, check the sums, left and right to it
        if sum(arr[1:i-1]) == sum(arr[i+1:end])
            # if true update the latest index for which it is true
            integer = i
        end
    end

    return integer

end

function find_even_index(arr)
  sumofarr = sum(arr)
  partialsum = 0
  for i = firstindex(arr):lastindex(arr)
    sumofarr -= arr[i]
    if partialsum == sumofarr
      return i
    end
    partialsum += arr[i]
  end
  -1
end

                     d < 7 ? 40d-20 : 40d-50
end

    d >= 7 ? 40d-50 : d >=3 ? 40d-20 : 40d
  end

    d >= 7 && return d*40 - 50
    d >= 3 && return d*40 - 20

  end

    x = 40

  end

    end
  end
end

        return d*40 - 20
    elseif d >= 7
        return d*40 - 50
    elseif d <= 3
        return d*40
    end
  end
end

module Solution
  export rental_car_cost

  function rental_car_cost(d)
    d >= 7 ? cost = - 50 : d >= 3 ? cost = -20 : cost = 0
    for i = 1:d
      cost += 40
    end
    return cost
  end
end

module Solution
  export rental_car_cost
  
  function rental_car_cost(d)
    total  = d*40
    if(d >= 7)
    total -= 50
    elseif(d >= 3)
    total -= 20
    end
  return total
  end
end

module Rainfall
    export mean, variance

    # here "mean" is called "avg" to avoid a clash of names 
    function mean(town, strng)
        s = split(strng,'\n')
        for line in s
          if occursin(town,line)
            tmp = map(q -> parse(Float64,q.match),collect(eachmatch(r"[\d]+\.\d",line)))
            return sum(tmp)/length(tmp)
          end
        end
        return -1
    end

    # divide by n = length(array) and not by n - 1
    function variance(town, strng)
        s = split(strng,'\n')
        for line in s
          if occursin(town,line)
            tmp = map(q -> parse(Float64,q.match),collect(eachmatch(r"[\d]+\.\d",line)))
            return sum((tmp .- mean(town,strng)).^2)/length(tmp)
          end
        end
        return -1
    end

end

module Rainfall

export avg, variance

using Statistics

# here "mean" is called "avg" to avoid a clash of names 
function avg(town::AbstractString, strng::AbstractString)
    towndata = getdata(town, strng)
    # Check for missing town data.
    ismissing(towndata) && return -1
  
    mean(towndata)
end

# divide by n = length(array) and not by n - 1
function variance(town::AbstractString, strng::AbstractString)
    towndata = getdata(town, strng)
    # Check for missing town data.
    ismissing(towndata) && return -1
  
    #`Statistics`'s `varm()` divides by n - 1, so we'll have to use our own.
    # https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/stdlib/Statistics/#Statistics.varm
    sum((towndata .- mean(towndata)).^2) / (length(towndata))
end

function getdata(town::AbstractString, strng::AbstractString)
    # Turn the data into an array of towns.
    towndata = split(strng, '
')
    # In that array, find the town given.
    townindex = findfirst(startswith(town), towndata)
    
    # If that town has no data, return `missing`.
    isnothing(townindex) && return missing
  
    towndata = towndata[townindex]
  
    # Remove the town name from the data, followed by a colon.
    towndata = split(towndata, ':')[end]
    # Split the town data into months.
    towndata = split(towndata, ',')
    # Remove the month names from the town data
    # and convert the numbers from strings to floats.
    towndata = map(x -> parse(Float64, split(x)[end]), towndata)
  
    # `towndata` is now a `Vector` of `Float64`s.
    towndata
end

end

module Rainfall
    export avg, variance

    using Statistics
    
    function readData(town, strng)
      data = split(strng, '
')
      for d in data
        if startswith(d, town*":")
          return parse.(Float64, [e.match for e in eachmatch(r"\d+\.\d+", d)])
        end 
      end
      return nothing
    end
      
    # here "mean" is called "avg" to avoid a clash of names 
    function avg(town, strng)
        m = readData(town, strng)
        if isnothing(m)
          return -1
        else
          return mean(m)
        end
    end

    # divide by n = length(array) and not by n - 1
    function variance(town, strng)
        m = readData(town, strng)
        if isnothing(m)
          return -1
        else
          return var(m)*11/12
        end
    end

end

module Rainfall
    export avg, variance
    using Statistics

    function avg(town, strng)
        occursin(town*":", strng) && strng != "" ? mean(values(town, strng)) : -1
    end

    function variance(town, strng)
        occursin(town*":", strng) && strng != "" ? var(values(town, strng), corrected=false) : -1
    end

    function values(town, strng)
        [parse(Float64, m.match) for m in eachmatch(r"\d+\.\d+", match(Regex(town*":.+(
|)"), strng).match)]
    end

end

    end

"),strng).match)]

module Rainfall
    export avg, variance

    # here "mean" is called "avg" to avoid a clash of names 
    function avg(town, strng)
        dat=(format_record(find_record(town,strng)))
        return sum(dat)/length(dat)
    end

    # divide by n = length(array) and not by n - 1
    function variance(town, strng)
      mn=avg(town,strng)
      dat=format_record(find_record(town,strng))
      if dat==-1 
        return -1
      end
      return sum((dat.-mn).^2)/length(dat)
    end
    function find_record(town,strng)
      splitted=split(strng,['
',':'])
      n=1
      while n<=length(splitted)
        if splitted[n]==town
          return splitted[n+1]
        end
        n=n+2
      end
      return nothing
    end

    format_record(rec) = map(x->parse(Float64,x),split(rec,[' ',','])[2:2:end])
    format_record(rec::Nothing)= -1

end

module Rainfall
    export avg, variance


    function getData(s)
      lines = split(s, "
")
      d = Dict{String, Array}()
      for r in lines
        j = findfirst(":", r)[1]
        town = r[1:j-1]
        rest = split(r[j+1:end], ",")
        nums = [parse(Float64, x[2]) for x in [split(y, " ") for y in rest]]
        d[town] = nums
      end
      return d
    end

    # here "mean" is called "avg" to avoid a clash of names 
    function avg(town, strng)
        d = getData(strng)
        if !(haskey(d, town)) return -1 end
        return sum(d[town])/length(d[town])
    end

    # divide by n = length(array) and not by n - 1
    function variance(town, strng)
        d = getData(strng)
        if !(haskey(d, town)) return -1 end
        a = d[town]
        mu = sum(a)/length(a)
        return sum((x-mu)^2 for x in a)/length(a)
    end

end

module Rainfall
    export avg, variance
    using Statistics

    # here "mean" is called "avg" to avoid a clash of names 
    function avg(town, strng)
        data = extract(town, strng)
        if data == -1
            return -1
        else
            return mean(data)
        end
    end

    # divide by n = length(array) and not by n - 1
    function variance(town, strng)
        data = extract(town, strng)
        if data == -1
            return -1
        else
            mn = mean(data)
            return sum((data .- mn).^2)/length(data)
        end
    end


    function extract(town, strng)
        data = split(strng, "
")
        for d0 in data
            if occursin(town*":", d0)
                return [parse(Float64, split(dp, " ")[2]) for dp in split(d0, ",")]
            end
        end
        return -1
    end
end

module Rainfall
    export avg, variance

    function extract(town, strng)
      v = []
      for l in split(strng, "
")
        if l[1:length(town)] == town
          for w in split(l[length(town)+2:end], (',', ' '))
            if w[1] |> isdigit
              push!(v, parse(Float64, w))
            end
          end
        end
      end
      return v
    end
        

    # here "mean" is called "avg" to avoid a clash of names 
    function avg(town, strng)
        v = extract(town, strng)
        v == [] ? -1 : sum(v)/length(v)
    end

    # divide by n = length(array) and not by n - 1
    function variance(town, strng)
        a = avg(town, strng)
        v = extract(town, strng)
        v == [] ? -1 : sum((v.-a).^2)/length(v)
    end

end

    function avg(town, strng)
      # your code
      if strng == "" return -1 end
      city = [split(t,":")[2] for t in split(strng, "
") if split(t,":")[1] == town]
      
      
  
      if city != []
        city = filter(x -> x != nothing, city)[1]
      else
        return -1.0
      end 
  
      prom = sum([parse(Float64, split(m, " ")[2]) for m in split(city, ",")])/12
      
      if prom == 0
        return -1
      else
        return prom
      end
    end


    # divide by n = length(array) and not by n - 1
    function variance(town, strng)
        # your code
      if strng == "" return -1 end
      city = [split(t,":")[2] for t in split(strng, "
") if split(t,":")[1] == town]
  
      if city != []
        city = filter(x -> x != nothing, city)[1]
      else
        return -1.0
      end
  
  
      vals = [parse(Float64, split(m, " ")[2]) for m in split(city, ",")]
      prom = avg(town, strng)
      
      
      if vals == []
        return -1.0
      else
        return sum([(v-prom)^2 for v in vals])/12
      end
    end
end

        for i in lngth:-1:2
            digit = dgts[i]

    function longest_consec(strarr::Array{String}, k::Int)::String
        if length(strarr)==0 return "" end
        if k>length(strarr)  return "" end
        if k<=0              return "" end

        all_consec = [ join(strarr[i:i+k-1]) for i in 1:length(strarr)-k+1 ]

module Kata
    export longest_consec
    function longest_consec(strarr::Array{String}, k::Int)::String
    
      if (length(strarr)==0) || k>length(strarr) || k<=0
        return ""
      end
      
      sumT = cumsum(length.(strarr))
      convolution = sumT[k:end] - [0; sumT[1:end - k]]
      m, i = findmax(convolution)
      
      return reduce(*, strarr[i:k + i - 1])
   end

module Travel
    export travel

    function travel(r, zipcode)
        info = zipcode == "" ? [] : [strip.(m.captures) for m in eachmatch(Regex("(\\d+)([\\w\\.\\s]*)"*zipcode*"(?:,+|\\Z)"), r)]
        zipcode * ":" * (isempty(info) ? "/" : join(reverse([join(cap, ",") for cap in zip(info...)]), "/"))
    end

end

module Travel
    export travel

    function travel(r, zipcode)
        if zipcode == ""
            return ":/"
        end
        loc = split(r, ",")
        iti1 = [ strip(join(split(replace(l, zipcode=>""))[2:end], " ")) for l in loc if occursin(Regex(zipcode*"\\Z") , l) ] 
        iti2 = [ strip(split(replace(l, zipcode=>""))[1]) for l in loc if occursin(Regex(zipcode*"\\Z"), l) ] 
        zipcode*":"*join(iti1, ",")*"/"*join(iti2, ",")
    end
end

module Travel
    export travel

    function travel(r, target_code)
    address_out = []
    number_out = []
      for s in split(r,",")
        address_components = split(s)
        zipcode = join(address_components[length(address_components)-1:length(address_components)]," ")
        if zipcode == target_code
          push!(number_out,address_components[1])
          push!(address_out,join(address_components[2:length(address_components)-2]," "))
        end
      end
      string(target_code,":",join(address_out,","),"/",join(number_out,","))
    end
end

module Travel
    export travel

    function travel(r, zipcode)
        streets = []
        numbers = []
        if !isempty(zipcode) && match(r"^\w{2} \d{5}$", zipcode) != nothing
          addresses = filter(addr -> occursin(zipcode, addr), split(r, ","))
          for address in addresses
            m = match(r"^\s?(\d+) (.+) \w{2} \d{5}$", address)
            if m != nothing
              push!(streets, m.captures[2])
              push!(numbers, m.captures[1])
            end
          end
        end
        zipcode * ":" * join(streets, ",") * "/" * join(numbers, ",")
    end
end

module Travel
    export travel

    function travel(r, zipcode)
        addr_list = split(r, ',')
        filter!(x->match(Regex(zipcode*"\$"), x)!=nothing, addr_list)
        (length(addr_list) == 0 || length(zipcode) == 0) && return "$zipcode:/"
        addr_str = ""
        num_str = ""
        for addr in addr_list
            m = match(Regex("^ *(\\d+) *(.+)( "*zipcode*")"), addr)
            addr_str *= ","*m.captures[2]
            num_str *= ","*m.captures[1]
        end
        "$zipcode:$(addr_str[2:end])/$(num_str[2:end])"
    end
end

module Travel
  export travel
  function travel(r, zipcode)
    ismatch(r"^\s*$", zipcode) && return ":/"
    street, house = [], []
    for addr in split(r, ",")
      !endswith(addr, zipcode) && continue
      arr = split(addr)
      push!(street, join(arr[2:end-2], " "))
      push!(house, arr[1])
    end
    string("$(zipcode):", join(street, ","), "/", join(house, ","))
  end
end

module Travel
    export travel
    
    function parse(addr::AbstractString)
        m = match(r"^\s*(\d+)\s+(.*)\s+([A-Z]{2}\s+\d{5})\s*$", addr)
        if m === nothing
            return missing
        end
        m.captures
    end
    
    function build_dict(addrs::AbstractArray)
        d = Dict()
        for addr in addrs
            housenum, middle, zipcode = addr[1], addr[2], addr[3]
            if !haskey(d, zipcode)
                push!(d, zipcode => "$zipcode:$middle/$housenum")
            else
                curval = d[zipcode]
                head, tail = split(curval, "/")
                push!(d, zipcode => "$head,$middle/$tail,$housenum")
            end
        end
        d
    end

    function travel(r, zipcode)
        addrs = map(parse, split(r, ","))
        dict = build_dict(addrs)
        get(dict, zipcode, "$zipcode:/")
    end
end

module Travel
    export travel

    function travel(r, zipcode)
        arr = split(r,",")
        street = []
        house = []
        for el in arr
          if el[end-7:end]==zipcode
            add = split(strip(el)," ")
            push!(house,add[1])
            push!(street,join(add[2:end-2]," "))
          end
        end
        return string(zipcode,":",join(street,","),"/",join(house,","))
    end
end

module Travel
    export travel

    function travel(r, zipcode)
      a = strip.(split(r,","))
      h = 1
      strST = Array{String,1}()
      strHN = Array{String,1}()
      for i=1:length(a)
          if zipcode == a[i][end-7:end]
              sn = match(r"\d+",a[i]).match
              push!(strST, strip(split(a[i], r"(^\d+|[A-Z]{2}\s\d{5})")[2]))
              push!(strHN, sn)
              h += 1
          end
      end
      return string(zipcode, ":", join(strST,","), "/", join(strHN,","))
    end
end

module Travel
    export travel

    using Base.Iterators

    function splitaddress(address)
      tokens = split(strip(address), ' ')
      zipcode = join(tokens[end-1:end], " ")
      street = join(tokens[2:end-2], " ")
      streetnum = tokens[1]
      return (zipcode, street, streetnum)
    end
    
    function travel(r, zipcode)
        addresses = splitaddress.(split(r, ','))       
        matching = [(street, streetnum) for (z, street, streetnum) in addresses if z == zipcode]
        if isempty(matching)
          return "$zipcode:/"
        else
          results = reduce(((acc, x) -> (acc[1]*","*x[1], acc[2]*","*x[2])), matching)
          return "$zipcode:$(results[1])/$(results[2])"
        end
    end
end

function is_narcissistic(n::Int)
    dig = digits(n)
    sum(dig .^ length(dig)) == n
end

function is_narcissistic(n::Int)
    dig = n |> digits |> reverse
    sum(dig .^ length(dig)) == n
end

function is_narcissistic(n::Integer)
  k = length(digits(n))
  sum(d ^ k for d in digits(n)) == n
end

function is_narcissistic(n::Integer)
  sum = 0
  temp = n
  len = 1
  while temp >= 10
    len += 1
    temp /= 10
  end
  temp = n
  i = len
  while i > 0
    current_pow = 10 ^ (i - 1)
    current = trunc(Int, temp / current_pow)
    temp %= current_pow
    sum += current ^ len
    i -= 1
  end
  if sum == n
    return true
  end
  return false
end

function is_narcissistic(n::Integer)
    original_value = n
    sum = 0
    l = length(string(n))
    while n > 0
        digit = n % 10
        n = n ÷ 10
        sum += digit ^ l
    end
    return sum == original_value
end

function is_narcissistic(n::Integer)::Bool
  ds = digits(n)
  sum(d -> d ^ length(ds), ds) == n
end

function is_narcissistic(n::Integer)
  l = length(string(n))
  o = 0
  m = n
  while n != 0
    o += (n %10) ^ l
    n = floor(n/10)
  end
  m == o
end

module RevRot
    export revrot

    function revrot(str, size)
        if size <= 0
            return ""
        end
        chunks = [str[size*i+1:size*(i+1)] for i in 0:length(str)÷size-1]
        for (i, chunk) in enumerate(chunks)
            if iseven(sum(map(Int, collect(chunk))))
                chunks[i] = reverse(chunk)
            else
                chunks[i] = join(circshift(collect(chunk), -1))
            end
        end
        return join(chunks)
    end
end

              res *= (count(s[i] in "13579" for i in from:to) % 2 == 0) ? s[to:-1:from] : s[from+1:to]*s[from:from]

            return ""
        end

            reverse(s[1:n]) * revrot(s[n+1:end], n, res)

        result = []
        while size(s_digits, 1) >= n
            part = s_digits[1:n]

function reverse_and_combine_text(str::String)::String
  words = split(str)
  while length(words) > 1
    words = map(wordpair -> join(reverse.(wordpair)), Base.Iterators.partition(words, 2))
  end
  join(words, ' ')
end

function reverse_and_combine_text(str::String)::String
    rev = reverse.(split(str))
    next = [join(rev[2i-1:2i]) for i in 1:length(rev)÷2]
    length(next) == 0 ? str : reverse_and_combine_text(join(next, " ") * (isodd(length(rev)) ? " " * rev[end] : "")) 
end

function reverse_and_combine_text(str::String)::String
    words = split(str)
    if length(words)==1
        return words[1]
    else
        newwords = ""
        for (i, v) in enumerate([reverse(w) for w in words])
            newwords *= v *" "^((i-1)%2)
        end
        return reverse_and_combine_text(newwords)
    end
    
end

function reverse_and_combine_text(str::String)::String
  # enjoy! :)
  
  while occursin(" ", str)
    words = [reverse(w) for w in split(str, " ")]
  
    if length(words) % 2 == 0
      words = [words[i]*words[i+1] for i in 1:2:length(words)-1]
    else
      words = vcat([words[i]*words[i+1] for i in 1:2:length(words)-1],[words[end]])
    end 
    
    str =  join(words, " ")   
  end
  
  return str
end

function reverse_and_combine_text(str::String)::String
  while occursin(" ", str)
    sp = split(str, ' ')
    isodd(length(sp)) && append!(sp, [""])
    str = join(((i) -> reverse(sp[i])*reverse(sp[i+1])).(1:2:length(sp)), " ")
  end
  str
end

function reverse_and_combine_text(str::String)::String
  words = split(str)
  length(words) == 1 ? str : reverse_and_combine_text(join((pair -> join(reverse.(pair))).(Iterators.partition(words, 2)), " "))
end

function reverse_and_combine_text(str::String)::String
  words = split(str)
  if length(words) == 1
    return str
  end
  reverse_and_combine_text(reduce((acc, (i, word)) -> acc * reverse(word) * (i < length(words) && i % 2 == 0 ? " " : ""), enumerate(words), init = ""))
end

function reverse_and_combine_text(str::String)::String
  a = split(str)
  while length(a) > 1
    t = []
    for i in 1:2:length(a)
      if i+1 <= length(a)
        push!(t, string(reverse(a[i]), reverse(a[i+1])))
      else
        push!(t, reverse(a[i]))
      end
    end
    a = split(join(t, " "))
  end
  a[1]
end

function reverse_and_combine_text(str::String)::String
    words = split(str,' ')
    # standard word sequence
    index = collect(1:lastindex(words))
    # calculate the reverseandcombine word sequence
    blocksize = 1
    while blocksize < lastindex(words)
        for bindex = 1:blocksize:lastindex(words)
            block = bindex:min(lastindex(words),bindex+blocksize-1)
            index[block] = -reverse(index[block])
        end
        blocksize *= 2
    end
    # combine the words
    buffer = IOBuffer(maxsize=length(str))
    for i in index
        write( buffer, i < 0 ? reverse(words[-i]) : words[i] )
    end
    String(take!(buffer))
end

function spoonerize(words::AbstractString)::String
    w = split(words, " ")
    w1 = w[1]
    w2 = w[2]
    v1 = w2[1] * SubString(w1, 2, length(w1))
    v2 = w1[1] * SubString(w2, 2, length(w2))
    return v1 * " " * v2
end
