module Phone
    export phone

function phone(strng, num)
    lines = split(strng, "
")
    lists = Vector{AbstractString}[]
    count = 0
    for i ∈ 1:length(lines)
        phoneReg = r".\d\-\d\d\d\-\d\d\d\-\d\d\d\d"
        phoneNum = SubString.(lines[i], findall(phoneReg, lines[i]))
        if length(phoneNum) == 0
            continue
        end
        phoneNum = replace(phoneNum[1], r"[\+]" => "")

        nameReg = r"\<.*\>"
        name = SubString.(lines[i], findall(nameReg, lines[i]))
        if length(name) == 0
            continue
        end
        name = replace(name[1], r"[\<,\>]" => "")

        address = replace(lines[i], r"[\/\,\+\;\*\<\>]" => "")
        address = replace(address, phoneNum=>" ")
        address = strip(replace(address, name => ""))
        address = replace(address, r"[\_\$\!\?\:]" => " ")
        address = strip(replace(address, r"\s+" => " "))

        retArray = [phoneNum, name, address]
        push!(lists, retArray)
    end
    index = 1
    for i ∈ 1:length(lists)
        if num == lists[i][1]
            count += 1
            index = i
        end
    end
    if count == 0
        return "Error => Not found: " * num
    elseif count > 1
        return "Error => Too many people: " * num
    else
        return "Phone => " * lists[index][1] * ", Name => " * lists[index][2] * ", Address => " * lists[index][3]
    end
end

end

module Phone
    export phone

    function phone(strng, num)
        people = [x for x in split(strng, '
') if occursin('+'*num, x)]

        if length(people) > 1
            "Error => Too many people: $(num)"
        elseif length(people) == 0
            "Error => Not found: $(num)"
        else
            name = match(r"<.*>", people[1]).match
            rest = replace(replace(people[1], num=>""), name=>"")
            "Phone => $(num), Name => $(name[2:end-1]), Address => $(replace(strip(replace(rest, r"[^A-Za-z0-9 .-]"=>" "),  [' ']), r" +"=>" "))"
        end
    end
end

module Phone
    export phone

    function phone(strng, num)
        err = length(collect(eachmatch(r"\+"*num, strng)))
        err == 0 && return "Error => Not found: $(num)"
        err > 1 && return "Error => Too many people: $(num)"
        line = [line for line in split(strng, '
') if occursin(r"\+"*num, line)][1]
        name = chop(line[findfirst(r"\w+\ ?\w*\'?\w*>", line)])
        line = replace(line, r"<.+>" => "")
        line = replace(line, "+$(num)" => "")
        line = replace(line, "_" => " ")
        "Phone => $(num), Name => $(name), Address => $(join([m.match for m in eachmatch(r"\w+\.*-*\d*", line)], " "))"
    end

end

module Phone
    export phone

    function phone(strng, num)
        data = split(strng, '
')
        findnum = findall(x -> contains(x, "+"*num), data)
        if length(findnum) > 1
            return "Error => Too many people: $num"
        elseif length(findnum) == 0
            return "Error => Not found: $num"
        else
            namematch = match(r"(?<=<).*(?=>)", data[findnum[1]])
            name = namematch.match
            address = replace(data[findnum[1]], "+"*num => "")
            address = replace(address, "<"*name*">" => "")
            address = replace(address, r"[^(a-zA-z0-9 .\-)]" => "")
            address = replace(address, r"\s{2,}|_" => " ")
            address = address |> lstrip |> rstrip
        end

        return "Phone => $num, Name => $name, Address => $address"
    end

end

module Phone
    export phone

    function phone(strng, num)
    phone_re = r"\+\d{1,2}(?:-\d{3}){2}-\d{4}"
    name_re = r"(?<=<).+(?=>)"

    # Find the line in `strng` that contains `num`. If more than one line is found, or
    # if no lines are found, return the appropriate error string.
    entry = filter(x -> occursin("+"*num, x), split(strng, "
"))
    length(entry) > 1 && return "Error => Too many people: $num"
    length(entry) == 0 && return "Error => Not found: $num"

    # Pull out the name by regular expression
    name = match(name_re, first(entry)).match

    # Strip out phone number, name, and special characters. What's left must be the
    # address
    strip_phone = replace(first(entry), phone_re => "")
    strip_name = replace(strip_phone, name_re => "")
    address = replace(strip(replace(strip_name, r"[^a-zA-Z0-9\.\s-]" => " ")), r"\s+" => " ")

    return "Phone => $num, Name => $name, Address => $address"
    end

end

module Phone
    export phone

    function phone(strng, num)
        entries = split(strng, "
", keepempty = false)
        
        phone_matches = filter(x -> occursin('+'*num, x), entries)
        n_matches = length(phone_matches)
  
        n_matches == 0 && return "Error => Not found: $num"
        n_matches > 1 && return "Error => Too many people: $num"
        
        entry = only(phone_matches)
  
        
        name = match(r"(?<=<).+(?=>)", entry).match
        entry_no_name = replace(entry, r" ?<.+> ?" => " ")
        address = replace(entry_no_name, Regex(" ?[^ ]*\\+$(num)[^ ]* ?") => " ") |>
          (x -> replace(x, "_" => " ")) |>
          (x -> replace(x, r"[^[:alnum:] \-\.]" => "")) |>
          (x -> replace(x, r" {2,}" => " ")) |>
          strip
        
  
        return "Phone => $num, Name => $name, Address => $address"
    end

end

module Phone
    export phone

    function phone(strng, num)
        nnum = "+" * num; cnt = 0; l = ""
        for line in split(strng, "
")
            if occursin(nnum, line)
                cnt += 1
                l = line
            end
        end
        if (cnt > 1) return "Error => Too many people: " * num end
        if (cnt == 0) return "Error => Not found: " * num end
        l = replace(l, Pair(r"[^-0-9a-z\\s+A-Z<>.']", " "))
        l = replace(l, Pair("$nnum", ""))
        name = match(r"<(.+)>", l)[1]
        adr = strip(replace(replace(l, Pair("<$name>", "")), Pair(r" +", " ")))
        "Phone => " * num * ", Name => " * name * ", Address => " * adr
    end
    

end

module Phone
export phone

function phone(strng, num)
  phoneDict = Dict()
  lines = split(strng, "
")
  for line in lines
    isempty(line) && continue
    phone = match(r"(\d{1,2}-\d{3}-\d{3}-\d{4})", line).captures[1]
    phone != num && continue
    haskey(phoneDict, phone) && return "Error => Too many people: " * num
    #(haskey(phoneDict, phone) || num == "8-421-674-8974") && return "Error => Too many people: " * num
    name = match(r"<([^>]+)>", line).captures[1]
    addr = replace(line, "+$phone" => "")
    addr = replace(addr, "<$name>" => "")
    addr = replace(addr, r"[^-.0-9A-Za-z]" => " ")
    addr = replace(addr, r"^\s+|\s+$" => "")
    addr = replace(addr, r"\s+" => " ")
    phoneDict[phone] = (name = name, addr = addr)
  end
  !haskey(phoneDict, num) && return "Error => Not found: " * num
  "Phone => $num, Name => $(phoneDict[num].name), Address => $(phoneDict[num].addr)"
end

end

module Phone
    export phone

    function phone(strng, num)
        book = split(strng, '
')
        filter!(x->occursin(num, x), book)
        length(book) > 1 && return "Error => Too many people: $num"
        length(book) == 0 && return "Error => Not found: $num"
        addr_chs = Vector{Char}(replace(replace(replace(book[1], num=>""), r"<.*>"=>""), "_"=>" "))
        addr = replace(strip(join(filter(x->(isletter(x) || isdigit(x) || x == ' ' || x == '-' || x == '.'), addr_chs))), r" +"=>" ")
        "Phone => $num, Name => $(match(r"<(.+)>", book[1]).captures[1]), Address => $addr"
    end

end

module Phone
  export phone
  function phone(strng, num)
    arr = [s for s in split(strng,"
") if contains(s, "+$num")]
    if length(arr) > 1 return "Error => Too many people: $num" end
    if isempty(arr) return "Error => Not found: $num" end
    m = match(r"\<(.+)\>", arr[1]); name = m.captures[1]
    rx = Regex("\\+$num")
    addr = replace(arr[1], rx, "")
    addr = replace(addr, r"\<.+\>", "")
    addr = replace(addr, r"[!,;:\/\$\*\?_]", " ")
    addr = strip(replace(addr, r" +", " "))
    "Phone => $num, Name => $name, Address => $addr"
  end
end

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
  o = n & -n
  (n + o) | (xor(n, n + o) ÷ 4o)
end

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
  r = n & -n
  p = n + r
  q = (n ⊻ p) ÷ (4 * r)
  p | q
end

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
  o = n & -n
  (n + o) | ((xor(n, n + o) ÷ o) >> 2)
end

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
  x = n + 1
  while count_ones(x) != count_ones(n)
    x += 1
  end
  x
end

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
    bits = bitstring(n)
    splt = findlast("01", bits)
    parse(Int, bits[1:splt[1]-1] * "10" * (bits[splt[2]+1:end] |> collect |> sort! |> join), base=2)
end

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
  x = n & -n
  return (n + x) | ((xor(n, n + x) ÷ x) >> 2)
end

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
    bits = '0' * bitstring(n)
    swaploc = findlast("01", bits)
    afterswap = bits[swaploc[2]+1:end]
    onesafter = count(==('1'), afterswap)
    zerosafter = length(afterswap) - onesafter
    newbits = bits[1:swaploc[1]-1] * "10" * '0'^zerosafter * '1'^onesafter
    return parse(Int, newbits; base = 2)
end

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
    nd = sum(digits(n, base=2))
    i = n+1
    while sum(digits(i, base=2)) != nd
        i += 1
    end
    i
end

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
  s = "0" * bitstring(n) # Add a leading zero just in case
  # Note: a bug in Julia 1.6 causes this next line to throw an error if "01" matches only at the beggining of the string.
  ul = rsplit(s, "01"; limit=2, keepempty=true)
  # Upper bits stay the same, lower bits must be right-packed
  n_ones = count(x->x == '1', ul[2])
  ul[2] = lpad("1"^n_ones, length(ul[2]), '0')
  s = join(ul, "10") # Flip "01"->"10" and join the upper and lower bits back together
  parse(Int, s; base=2) # Back to an integer
end

popcount(n::Int)::Int = count(==('1'), bitstring(n))

function next_higher(n::Int)::Int
    pc = popcount(n)
    if pc == 1 
        n << 1
    else
        for x in Iterators.countfrom(n + 1)
            if popcount(x) == pc
                return x
            end
        end
    end
end

module UpDown
    export arrange

    function arrange(strng)
        res = split(strng, " ")   
        for i in 1:length(res) - 1
            if ((i % 2 == 0) && (length(res[i]) < length(res[i + 1]))) || ((i % 2 == 1) && (length(res[i]) > length(res[i + 1])))
                res[i], res[i + 1] = res[i + 1], res[i]
            end
        end
        r = []
        for i in 1:length(res)
            if (i & 1 == 1)
                push!(r, lowercase(res[i]))
            else
                push!(r, uppercase(res[i]))
            end
        end
        join(r, " ")
    end
end

module UpDown
    export arrange

    function arrange(strng)
        x = split(strng)
        for i in 1:length(x)-1
            if (isodd(i) && length(x[i+1]) < length(x[i])) || (iseven(i) && length(x[i]) < length(x[i+1])) 
                x[i], x[i+1] = x[i+1], x[i]
            end
        end
        join([isodd(i) ? lowercase(v) : uppercase(v) for (i, v) in enumerate(x)], " ")
    end

end

module UpDown
    export arrange

    function arrange(strng)
        if strng == ""; return "" end
  
        words = split(strng)
        n = length(words)  
        for i in 1:n-1    
            if (-1)^i * length(words[i+1]) > (-1)^i * length(words[i])
                (words[i], words[i+1]) = (words[i+1], words[i])
            end
        end

        join([if idx%2==1; lowercase(word) else uppercase(word) end for (idx, word) in enumerate(words)], " ")
    end
end

module UpDown
  export arrange

  function arrange(strng)
    ar = split(strng)
    for i in 2:2:length(ar)
      if length(ar[i-1]) > length(ar[i])
        ar[i-1], ar[i] = ar[i], ar[i-1]
      end
      if i < length(ar) && length(ar[i+1]) > length(ar[i])
        ar[i+1], ar[i] = ar[i], ar[i+1]
      end
    end
    join([isodd(i) ? lowercase(s) : uppercase(s) for (i, s) in enumerate(ar)], ' ')
  end
end

module UpDown
    export arrange

    function arrange(strng)
      str = split(strng, " ")
    
      for ii in 1:(length(str) - 1 )
        if (ii % 2 == 1) && (length(str[ii]) > length(str[ii+1]))
          str[ii], str[ii+1] = str[ii+1], str[ii]
        elseif (ii % 2 == 0) && (length(str[ii]) < length(str[ii+1]))
          str[ii], str[ii+1] = str[ii+1], str[ii]
        end
      end
    
      for ii in eachindex(str)
        ii % 2 == 1 ?   str[ii] = lowercase(str[ii]) : str[ii] = uppercase(str[ii])        
      end
    
      return join(str," ")
  end


end

module UpDown
  export arrange

  function swap(lst, i, j)
    t = lst[i]; lst[i] = lst[j]; lst[j] = t
    lst
  end
  
  function arrange(strng)
    arr = split(strng, " ")
    for i in 1:length(arr)
      pos = i
      uord = iseven(pos) ? 1 : 0
      while pos < length(arr)
        if uord == 0 && length(arr[pos]) > length(arr[pos+1])
          arr = swap(arr, pos, pos+1)
          uord = 1
          pos += 1
        elseif uord == 1 && length(arr[pos]) < length(arr[pos+1])
          arr = swap(arr, pos, pos+1)
          uord = 0
          pos += 1 
        else
          break
        end
      end
    end
    join((iseven(i) ? uppercase(s) : lowercase(s) for (i,s) in enumerate(arr)), " ")
  end
end

  res = 0;
  while res < n
    res <<= 1

  end; res

function score(n)
  if n == 1
    return 1
  else
    tmp = 0
  end
  
  for q in 1:n-1
    tmp = tmp | q
  end
  tmp
end

function score(n)
  if n<=0 return 0 end
  reduce(function(a,x) a|x end, 1:n)
end

function score(n)
  s=n
  while n>0
    n>>=1
    s|=n
  end
  return s
end

56cca888a9d0f25985000036.body:
function candies_to_buy(kids::Integer)::BigInt
  reduce(lcm, big(1) : kids)
end

function gcd(a::BigInt, b::BigInt)::BigInt
  if b == 0
    return a
  else
    return gcd(b, a% b)
  end
end

function candies_to_buy(a::Integer)::BigInt
  res = BigInt(a)
  for n in BigInt(2):BigInt(a-1)
    if res % n != 0
      res *= BigInt(n / gcd(res, n))
    end
  end
  return res
end

function is_triangular(t::Integer)::Bool
    m = round(Int,√(1+8t))
    return (1+8t == m^2) & (isodd(m))
end

function is_triangular(t::Integer)::Bool
    d = sqrt(1+8*t) 
    d - floor(d) < 1e-10
end

')
  end

  function rot_90_clock(strng)
    [reverse(s) for s in diag_1_sym(strng)]
  end

  function diag_1_sym(strng)
    arr = conv(strng)
    rows, cols = length(arr), length(arr[1])
    [join([arr[i][j] for i in 1:rows]) for j in 1:cols]
  end

  function selfie_and_diag1(strng)
    arr = conv(strng)
    ["$a|$b" for (a, b) in zip(arr, diag_1_sym(strng))]
  end

')
  end

module Move4
    export rot_90_counter, diag_2_sym, selfie_diag2_counterclock, oper

    function diag_2_sym(strng)
        if length(strng)==1
            return strng
        end
  
        lines = split(strng, "
")
        dim = length(lines)
        
        join([join([lines[dim-i+1][dim-j+1] for i in 1:dim]) for j in 1:dim], "
")
    end
    function rot_90_counter(strng)
        if length(strng)==1
            return strng
        end
  
        lines = split(strng, "
")
        dim = length(lines)
        
        join([join([lines[i][dim-j+1] for i in 1:dim]) for j in 1:dim], "
")
    end
    function selfie_diag2_counterclock(strng)
        if length(strng)==1
            return strng * "|" * strng * "|" * strng
        end

        lines = split(strng, "
")
        dim = length(lines)
        
        join([join([lines[j][i] for i in 1:dim])  * "|" * join([lines[dim-i+1][dim-j+1] for i in 1:dim]) * "|" * join([lines[i][dim-j+1] for i in 1:dim])   for j in 1:dim], "
")

        if String(Symbol(fct)) == "diag_2_symSE"
            return diag_2_sym(s)
        elseif String(Symbol(fct)) == "rot_90_counterSE"
            return rot_90_counter(s)

")

module Valley
    export make_valley

    function make_valley(arr)
        evenarr = iseven(length(arr))
        newarr = []
        for (n, loc) in enumerate(sortperm(arr))
            iseven(n+evenarr) ? push!(newarr, arr[loc]) : pushfirst!(newarr, arr[loc])
        end
        return newarr
    end

end

module Valley
export make_valley
using Base.Iterators: partition, peel

function make_valley(arr)
    sorted = sort(arr)
    result = []
    if isodd(length(arr))
        head, sorted = peel(sorted)
        push!(result, head)
    end
    for ns in partition(sorted, 2)
        push!(result, ns[1])
        length(ns) == 2 && pushfirst!(result, ns[2])
    end
    result
end

end

module Valley
export make_valley

function make_valley(arr)
  result = []
  arr = sort(arr)
  if length(arr) % 2 == 1
    push!(result, arr[1])
    arr = arr[2:end]
  end
  for (i, x) in enumerate(arr)
    if isodd(i)
      push!(result, x)
    else
      prepend!(result, x)
    end
  end
  result
end

end

  triangle = [BigInt(1)]
  for _ = 1:n

module Step
  export oper_array
  export gcdi
  export lcmu
  export som
  export maxi
  export mini

  gcdi = gcd
  lcmu = lcm
  som = +
  maxi = max
  mini = min
  function oper_array(fct, arr, init)
    accumulate(fct, arr, init = init)
  end

end

module Step
    export oper_array
    export gcdi
    export lcmu
    export som
    export maxi
    export mini

    function gcdi(x, y)
        x = abs(x); y = abs(y)
        while (y != 0)
            x, y = y, x % y
        end
        x
    end
    function lcmu(a, b)
        div(abs(a * b), gcdi(a, b))
    end
    function som(a, b)
        (a + b)
    end
    function maxi(a, b)
        max(a, b)
    end
    function mini(a, b)
        min(a, b)
    end
    function oper_array(fct, arr, init)
        n = init
        [n = fct(n, r) for r in arr]
    end

end

module Step
    export oper_array
    export gcdi
    export lcmu
    export som
    export maxi
    export mini

    function gcdi(x, y)
        
        while max(abs(x),abs(y)) % min(abs(x),abs(y)) > 0
          tmp = max(abs(x),abs(y)) % min(abs(x),abs(y))
          x = y
          y = tmp
        end
        abs(y)
    end
    function lcmu(a, b)
         tmp = 0
         if a == 0 || b == 0
          return 0
         elseif max(abs(a),abs(b)) % min(abs(a),abs(b)) == 0
          return max(abs(a),abs(b))
         else
          tmp = max(abs(a),abs(b))
          while tmp % min(abs(a),abs(b)) != 0
            tmp += max(abs(a),abs(b))
          end
         end
         tmp
    end
    function som(a, b)
         a + b
    end
    function maxi(a, b)
         max(a,b)
    end
    function mini(a, b)
         min(a,b)
    end
    function oper_array(fct, arr, init)
        res = []
        tmp = fct(arr[begin], init)
        push!(res,tmp)
        for q in 2:length(arr)
          tmp = fct(arr[q], tmp)
          push!(res,tmp)
        end
        res
    end

end

module Step
    export oper_array
    export gcdi
    export lcmu
    export som
    export maxi
    export mini

function gcdi(x, y)
  y == 0 && return abs(x)
  r = x % y
  return gcdi(y, r)
end

function lcmu(a, b)
  Int(a * b / gcdi(a, b)) |> abs
end

function som(a, b)
  a + b
end

function maxi(a, b)
  max(a, b)
end

function mini(a, b)
  min(a, b)
end

function oper_array(fct, arr, init)
  vector = []
  a = init

  for x in arr
    push!(vector, fct(a, x))
    a = fct(a, x)
  end
  
  vector
end

end

module Step
    export oper_array
    export gcdi
    export lcmu
    export som
    export maxi
    export mini

    function gcdi(x, y)
        a = maxi(abs(x),abs(y))
        b = mini(abs(x),abs(y))
        if b == 0
          return a
        else
          gcdi(b, a%b)
        end
    end
    function lcmu(a, b)
         abs(a*b)/gcdi(a,b)
    end
    function som(a, b)
         a + b
    end
    function maxi(a, b)
         max(a, b)
    end
    function mini(a, b)
         min(a,b)
    end
    function oper_array(fct, arr, init)
        out = [fct(init,arr[1])]
        for i in 1:length(arr)-1
            push!(out, fct(out[i],arr[i+1]))
        end
        out
    end
end

module Step
    export oper_array
    export gcdi
    export lcmu
    export som
    export maxi
    export mini

    gcdi(a, b) = accumulate(gcd, a; init=b)
    lcmu(a, b) = accumulate(lcm, a; init=b)
    som(a, b) = accumulate(+, a; init=b)
    maxi(a, b) = accumulate(max, a; init=b)
    mini(a, b) = accumulate(min, a; init=b)

end

         b == 0 ? abs(a) : gcdi(b, a % b)

    end

56efc695740d30f963000557.body:
function to_alternating_case(str)
  map(swapcase, str)
end

function swapcase(c)
  if islowercase(c)
    uppercase(c)
  elseif isuppercase(c)
    lowercase(c)
  else
    c
  end
end

function to_alternating_case(string)
  
  result = ""
  
  for c in string
    if lowercase(c) in 'a':'z'
      result *= islowercase(c) ? uppercase(c) : lowercase(c)
    else
      result *= c
    end
  end
  
  result
  
end
to_alternating_case(string) = join(isuppercase(char) ? lowercase(char) : uppercase(char) for char in string)

function find_longest(string)
  spl = collect(split(string, " "))
  longest=0
  for i in spl
    if length(i) > longest
      longest = length(i)
    end
  end
  return longest
end

function find_longest(strng)
  spl = split(strng, " ")
  longest = 0
  for word in spl
    if length(word) > longest
      longest = length(word)
    end
  end
  return longest
end

function find_longest(str)
  spl = split(str, " ")
  longest = 0
  i=1

    function code(s)
        n = Int64(ceil(length(s)^0.5))
        s = rpad(s, n^2, Char(11))
        a = rotl90(reshape(split(s, ""), n, n))
        return join([join(a[j*n+1:j*n+n],"") for j in 0:n-1] , "\n")
    end
    function decode(s)
        s = filter(c->c!="\n", split(s, ""))
        n = floor(Int, length(s)^0.5)
        a = rotr90(reshape(s, n, n))
        ret = join([join(a[j*n+1:j*n+n],"") for j in 0:n-1] , "")
        return join([c for c in ret if c!=Char(11)], "")
    end

module Coding
    export code, decode

    function code(s)
      n = Int(ceil(sqrt(length(s))))
      A = fill('\v', n,n)
  
      for (i, character) in enumerate(s)
        A[i] = character
      end

      return [
        join(col) for col in eachcol(rotl90(A))
      ] |> x -> join(x, "\n")
    end

    function decode(s)
      n = Int(floor(sqrt(length(s))))
      A = fill('\v', n,n)
  
      for (i, character) in enumerate(replace(s, r"\n" => s""))
        A[i] = character
      end

    function code(s)

        m = rotl90(reshape(collect(s * Char(11)^(len^2 - length(s))), len, len))
        coded = ""
        for i in 1:len, j in 1:len
            coded *= m[j, i]
            j == len && (coded *= '\n')
        end
        chop(coded)
    end

    function decode(s)
        len = Int(sqrt(length(s) - count(i-> i == '\n', s)))
        m = rotr90(reshape(collect(replace(s, '\n'=> "")), len, len))
        decoded = ""
        for i in 1:len, j in 1:len
            decoded *= m[j, i]
        end
        replace(decoded, "\v"=> "")

module Coding
    export code, decode, SquareString

mutable struct SquareString
    inner::Array{Char, 2}
    dim::Integer
end

function SquareString(s::AbstractString)
    n = (Int ∘ ceil ∘ sqrt ∘ length)(s)
    padded = rpad(s, n * n, Char(11))
    inner = reshape(collect(padded), n, n)
    return SquareString(inner, n)
end

function rotateclockwise!(ss::SquareString)::SquareString
    ss.inner = (rot180 ∘ rotr90)(ss.inner)
    ss
end

function rotatecounterclockwise!(ss::SquareString)::SquareString
    ss.inner = (rotl90 ∘ rot180)(ss.inner)
    ss
end

function code(s::AbstractString)::String
    squarestring = SquareString(s)
    rotateclockwise!(squarestring)
    letters = vcat(squarestring.inner, fill('\n', 1, squarestring.dim)) |> vec
    return replace(String(letters), r"
$" => "")
end

function decode(s::AbstractString)::String
    squarestring = replace(s, "\n" => "") |> SquareString
    rotatecounterclockwise!(squarestring)
    letters = filter(s -> s != Char(11), vec(squarestring.inner))
    return String(letters)
end

end

    function code(s)

            return ""
        end
  
        l = length(s)
        n = ceil(Int, √l)
        padded = s * Char(11)^(n^2-l)
  
        join([join([padded[1 + (n-i)*n+j] for i in 1:n]) for j in 0:n-1], "\n")
    end
    function decode(s)
        if strip(s)==""
            return ""
        end
  
        lines = split(s, "\n")
        n = length(lines)
  
        join([lines[j][n-i+1] for i in 1:n for j in 1:n if Int(lines[j][n-i+1])!=11])
    end

end

module Coding
export code, decode

function code(s)
  length(s) == 0 && return ""
  dim = Int(ceil(sqrt(length(s))))
  next_square = Int(dim^2)
  s = rpad(s, next_square, Char(11))
  a = rotl90(reshape(split(s, ""), (dim, dim)))
  # Julia 1.1 has an eachrow iterator, but 1.0 has to be more verbose
  join(mapslices(join, a; dims=(1)), "\n")
end

function decode(s)
  length(s) == 0 && return ""
  b = mapreduce(x->split(x, ""), hcat, split(s, "\n"))
  a = rotr90(b)
  rstrip(join(a, ""), Char(11))
end

end

module Disguised
    export v1, u1, v_eff, u_eff

    function combination(n, k)
      return factorial(big(n))/(factorial(big(k))*factorial(big(n-k)))
    end

    function v1(n, p)
      total = 0
      for k in range(0,stop=n)
        total += (-1)^k*4^(n-k)*combination(2n-k,k)
      end
      return total*p
    end

    function u1(n, p)
      total = 0
      for k in range(0,stop=n)
        total += (-1)^k*4^(n-k)*combination(2n-k+1,k)
      end
      return total*p
    end

    u_eff(n, p) = (n+1)*p

function contain_all_rots(strng, arr)
    # your code
  matches = 0
  for i in 1:length(strng)
    strng = strng[2:end]*strng[1]
    if strng in arr
      matches += 1
    end 
  end 
  if matches == length(strng)
    return true
  else
    return false
  end
end

function contain_all_rots(strng, arr)
    all([rot in arr for rot in rotations(strng)])
end

function rotations(strng)
  strlen = length(strng)
  if strlen == 0
    return []
  else
    return [strng[id+1:strlen]*strng[1:id] for id in 1:strlen]
  end
end

function rot(s)
  s[2:length(s)] * s[1]
end

function rot_all(s)
  ls = []
  i = length(s)
  while i > 0
    s = rot(s)
    append!(ls, [s])
    i -= 1
  end
  ls
end

function contain_all_rots(s, arr)
    if length(s) == 0
      return true
    end
    all(x -> x in arr, rot_all(s))
end

function rotate(s)
  s[2:end] * s[1]
end

function contain_all_rots(strng, arr)
  if isempty(strng)
    return true
  end
  ret = []
  for _ in 1:length(strng)
    push!(ret, strng)
    strng = rotate(strng)
  end
  all(s -> s ∈ arr, ret)
end

  if n == 0
    return 0
  elseif n == 1
    return 1

function chuck_push_ups(str::String)
  str=="" && return "FAIL!!"
  a=map(s->replace(s,r"[^01]"=>""),split(replace(join(split(str,r"\"[^\"]*\"")),r" +"=>" ")))
  counts=map(s->parse(Int,s;base=2),filter(s->length(s)>0,a))
  length(counts)>0 ? maximum(counts) : "CHUCK SMASH!!"
end

function chuck_push_ups(str)
  "FAIL!!"
end

function chuck_push_ups(str)
    (!isa(str, String) || isempty(str)) && return "FAIL!!"
    counts = split(replace(str, r"[^10 ]"=> ""), r"[^10]", keepempty=false)
    isempty(counts) ? "CHUCK SMASH!!" : maximum(parse.(Int, counts, base=2))
end

function chuck_push_ups(str)
  if isa(str, String) && length(str) != 0
    a = -1
    for x in split(str, ' ')
      y = tryparse(Int, filter(c -> c == '0' || c == '1', x), base=2)
      y != nothing && a < y && (a = y)
    end
    a == -1 ? "CHUCK SMASH!!" : a
  else
    "FAIL!!"
  end
end

function chuck_push_ups(x)
    if length(x) == 0 || typeof(x) != String
        return "FAIL!!"
    end
    l = [parse(Int, i.match, base = 2) for i in eachmatch(r"[01]+", replace(x, r"[a-z2-9]"i => ""))]
    if length(l) > 0
        return maximum(l)
    end
    "CHUCK SMASH!!"
end

function chuck_push_ups(str)
  typeof(str)!=String || str=="" ? "FAIL!!" :
    !occursin(r"[01]", str) ? "CHUCK SMASH!!" : 
      maximum(parse.(Int, split(replace(str, r"[^ 01]"=>"")), base=2))
end

function chuck_push_ups(str)
  typeof(str)!=String || str=="" ? "FAIL!!" :
    !occursin(r"[01]", str) ? "CHUCK SMASH!!" : 
      maximum(s -> parse(Int, s, base=2), (split(replace(str, r"[^ 01]"=>""))))
end

function chuck_push_ups(str::AbstractString)::Union{String,Int}
    isempty(str) && return "FAIL!!"
    ns = filter(!isempty, filter.(in("01"), split(str, ' ')))
    isempty(ns) && return "CHUCK SMASH!!"
    maximum(parse.(Int, ns, base=2))
end

chuck_push_ups(notastring) = "FAIL!!"

head_smash(gym) = isempty(gym) ? "Gym is empty" : "This isn't the gym!!"

function head_smash(gym::AbstractArray{T}) where T <: AbstractString
  isempty(gym) || all(isempty, gym) ? "Gym is empty" : map(s -> replace(s, 'O' => ' '), gym)
end

function head_smash(a::AbstractArray)
  isempty(a) ? "Gym is empty" : "This isn't the gym!!"
end

function head_smash(s::AbstractString)
  isempty(s) ? "Gym is empty" : "This isn't the gym!!"
end

function head_smash(_)
  "This isn't the gym!!"
end

function head_smash(gym::AbstractVector{<:AbstractString})
    if isempty(gym) || all(isempty, gym)
        "Gym is empty"
    else
        map(str -> replace(str, 'O'=>' '), gym)
    end
end
head_smash(gym) = isempty(gym) ? "Gym is empty" : "This isn't the gym!!"

using Printf: @sprintf

function price(start::Real, soil::AbstractString, age::Integer)::String
    soillevels = Dict{String,Float64}(["Barely used"=>1.1, "Seen a few high kicks"=>1.25, "Blood stained"=>1.3, "Heavily soiled"=>1.5])
    if soil in keys(soillevels)
        @sprintf "\$%.2f" round(start * soillevels[soil] ^ age, digits=2)
    else
        "Chuck is bottomless!"
    end
end
price(anythingelse...) = "Chuck is bottomless!"

using Printf
soil_levels = Dict([("Barely used", 1.1),
      ("Seen a few high kicks", 1.25),
      ("Blood stained", 1.3),
      ("Heavily soiled", 1.5)])

function price(start::Number, soil::String, age::Number)
  if soil in keys(soil_levels)
    newprice = start * soil_levels[soil]^age
    newprice = parse(Float64, string(round(newprice, digits = 2)))
    @sprintf "\$%.2f" newprice
  else
    return "Chuck is bottomless!"
  end
end
  
function price(start, soil, age)
  return "Chuck is bottomless!"
end

using Printf
function price(start::Number, soil::String, age::Number)
  soil_levels = Dict([("Barely used", 1.1),
      ("Seen a few high kicks", 1.25),
      ("Blood stained", 1.3),
      ("Heavily soiled", 1.5)])
  if soil in keys(soil_levels)
    newprice = start * soil_levels[soil]^age
    newprice = parse(Float64, string(round(newprice, digits = 2)))
    out = @sprintf "\$%.2f" newprice
    isnothing(findfirst('.', out)) ? out = string(out, ".00") : nothing
    findfirst('.', out) == length(out)-1 ? out = string(out, "0") : nothing
    return out
  else
    return "Chuck is bottomless!"
  end
end
  
function price(start, soil, age)
  return "Chuck is bottomless!"
end

using Printf
soiling = Dict("Barely used"=> 1.1, "Seen a few high kicks"=> 1.25, "Blood stained"=> 1.3, "Heavily soiled"=> 1.5)
price(start, soil, age) = "Chuck is bottomless!"

function price(start::Number, soil::String, age::Int)
    age == 0 ? @sprintf("\$%.2f", round(start, digits=2)) : price(haskey(soiling, soil) ? start*soiling[soil] : [], soil, age-1)
end

using Printf
map = Dict([("Barely used", 10), ("Seen a few high kicks", 25), ("Blood stained", 30), ("Heavily soiled", 50)])
function price(start, soil, age)
    try  
        p = start*(1+map[soil]/100)^age
        @sprintf("\$%.02f", p)
    catch e
        "Chuck is bottomless!"
    end
end

function no_boring_zeros(n)

    0
  elseif n % 10 != 0
    n
  else
    no_boring_zeros(n//10)
  end
end

  if n == 0 return 0 end
  parse(Int, rstrip(string(n), '0'))
    
end

5720eb05e8d6c5b24a0014c5.body:
function score_matrix(matrix::Matrix{Int})::Int
  n, m = size(matrix)
  [(-1)^(i + j) * matrix[i, j] for j in 1:m for i in 1:n] |> sum
end

function score_matrix(matrix::Matrix{Int})::Int
  sign = ones(size(matrix))
  sign[1:2:size(matrix,1),:] *= -1
  sign[:,1:2:size(matrix,2)] *= -1
  sum(matrix .* sign)
end
score_matrix(matrix::Matrix{Int})::Int = sum((-1)^(i[1] + i[2]) * matrix[i] for i in CartesianIndices(matrix))

function score_matrix(matrix::Matrix{Int})::Int
    sum((-1)^(i + j) * matrix[i, j] for i in 1:size(matrix)[1], j in 1:size(matrix)[2])
end

function score_matrix(matrix::Matrix{Int})::Int
  m, n = size(matrix)
  res = 0
  for i in 1:m
    for j in 1:n
      res += (-1)^(i + j) * matrix[i, j]
    end
  end
  res
end

function score_matrix(matrix::Matrix{Int})::Int
  c = size(matrix,1)
  r = Int(length(matrix) / c)
  sum((i%2 == j%2) ? matrix[i,j] : -matrix[i,j] for i in 1:c for j in 1:r)
end

function score_matrix(a::Matrix{Int})::Int
  sum = 0
  for i in CartesianIndices(a)
    sum += (-1)^(i[1]+i[2]) * a[i]
  end
  return sum
end

function score_matrix(matrix::Matrix{Int})::Int
  sum((isodd(i[1] + i[2]) ? -1 : 1) * matrix[i] for i in CartesianIndices(matrix))
end

module KPrimes
    export count_kprimes
    export puzzle
    function count_kprimes(k, start, nd)
        fs = []
        n = start
        while n <= nd
            j = pfc(n)
            if j == k
                push!(fs, n)
            end
            n = n + 1
        end
        fs
    end
    function puzzle(s)
        ans = 0
        xs = count_kprimes(7, 128, s - 10)
        ys = count_kprimes(3, 8, s - 130)
        for a in xs
            for b in ys
                c = s - a - b
                if c > 0 && pfc(c) == 1
                    ans = ans + 1
                end
            end
        end
        ans
    end
    function pfc(n)
        ans = 0
        i = 2
        while i <= n ÷ i
            while n % i == 0
                n = n ÷ i
                ans = ans + 1
            end
            i += 1
        end
        if n > 1
            ans = ans + 1
        end
        ans
    end
end

module KPrimes
    export count_kprimes
    export puzzle
    function dv(n)
        cnt = 0; i = 2
        while (i * i <= n)
            while (n % i == 0)
                cnt += 1
                n /= i
            end
            i += 1
        end
        if (n > 1)
             cnt += 1
        end
        cnt
    end
    function count_kprimes(k, start, nd)
        kprimes = Int[]
        i = start
        while (i <= nd)
            if (dv(i) == k)
                push!(kprimes, i)
            end
            i += 1
        end
        kprimes
    end
    function isprimi(n)
        n > 1 || return false
        n != 2 || return true
        isodd(n) || return false
        for i in 3:isqrt(n)
            n%i != 0 || return false
        end
        true
    end
    function puzzle(s)
        cnt = 0;
        b = count_kprimes(7, 128, s - 6)
        c = count_kprimes(3, 4, s - 130)
        for j in b
            for k in c
                if isprimi(s - j - k)
    		cnt += 1
    	    end
            end
        end
        cnt
    end
end

module KPrimes
    export count_kprimes
    export puzzle

    function k_prime(n, i = 2, count = 0)
        n % i == 0 && return k_prime(n ÷ i, i, count + 1)
        for j in (i+1-i%2):2:isqrt(n)
            n % j == 0 && return k_prime(n ÷ j, j, count + 1)
        end
        count = n != 1 ? count += 1 : count
    end

    count_kprimes(k, start, nd) = [i for i in start:nd if k_prime(i) == k]

    function puzzle(s)
        k1, k3, k7, count = [], [], [], 0
        for n in 2:s
            k = k_prime(n)
            k == 1 ? push!(k1, n) : k == 3 ? push!(k3, n) : k == 7 ? push!(k7, n) : nothing end
        for i in k7, j in k3 
            s-i-j ∈ k1 && (count += 1) end
        count
    end
end

module KPrimes
    export count_kprimes
    export puzzle

    function k_prime(n, i = 2, count = 0)
        n % i == 0 && return k_prime(n ÷ i, i, count + 1)
        for j in (i+1-i%2):2:Int(floor(sqrt(n)))
            n % j == 0 && return k_prime(n ÷ j, j, count + 1)
        end
        count = n != 1 ? count += 1 : count
    end

    function count_kprimes(k, start, nd)
        [i for i in start:nd if k_prime(i) == k]
    end

    function puzzle(s)
        k1, k3, k7, count = [], [], [], 0
        for n in 2:s
            k = k_prime(n)
            if k == 1 push!(k1, n)
            elseif k == 3 push!(k3, n)
            elseif k == 7 push!(k7, n) end
        end
        for i in k7, j in k3
            s-i-j ∈ k1 && (count += 1)
        end
        count
    end
end

module KPrimes
    export count_kprimes
    export puzzle
    function count_kprimes(k, start, nd)
        kprimes = Int64[]
        primesarr = primes(nd)
        for n in start:nd
            testkprime = n
            counter = 0
            for i in 1:k
                for p in primesarr
                    if testkprime % p == 0
                        testkprime = testkprime ÷ p
                        counter += 1
                        break
                    end
                end
                if testkprime == 1 && counter < k
                    break
                end
            end
            if testkprime == 1 && counter == k
                push!(kprimes, n)
            end
        end
        return kprimes
    end

    function puzzle(s)
        counter = 0
        primesarr = primes(s)
        for c in count_kprimes(7, 128, s)
            for b in count_kprimes(3, 8, max(8,s-c-2))
                if s - c - b in primesarr
                    counter += 1
                end
            end
        end
        return counter
    end

    function primes(k)
        primesarr = ones(Bool, k)
        primesarr[1] = 0
        for p in 2:k
            for i in 2p:p:k
                primesarr[i] = 0
            end
        end
        findall(primesarr)
    end
end

module KPrimes
    export count_kprimes
    export puzzle
    function count_kprimes(k, start, nd)
        primes = generate_primes(nd÷(2^(k-1)))
        kprimes = []
        for cp in start:nd
            currentkprime = cp
            for i in 1:k
                for prime in primes
                    if currentkprime % prime == 0
                        currentkprime = currentkprime ÷ prime
                        break
                    end
                end
                if currentkprime == 1 && i ≠ k
                    currentkprime = 0
                end
            end
            if currentkprime == 1
                push!(kprimes, cp)
            end
        end
        return kprimes
    end

    function puzzle(s)
        counter = 0
        for c in count_kprimes(7, 128, s)
            for b in count_kprimes(3, 8,s-c)
                if s - b - c in generate_primes(s-b-c)
                    counter += 1
                end
            end
        end
        return counter
    end

    function generate_primes(until)
        if until == 0
            return []
        end
        primes = ones(Bool, until)
        primes[1] = 0
        for p in 2:until
            if primes[p] == 1
                for id in 2p:p:until
                    primes[id] = 0
                end
            end
        end
        return findall(primes)
    end
end

module KPrimes
    export count_kprimes
    export puzzle
    function count_kprimes(k, start, nd)
    list = Int[]
    for i in start:nd
        if primefnmul(i) == k
            push!(list, i)
        end
    end
    return list
end
function isp(x)
    i = 2
    while i <= sqrt(x)
        x % i == 0 && (return false)
        i += 1
    end
    return true
end
function primefnmul(x::Int)
    fac = 1
    i = 2
    while i < x 
        if x % i == 0 && isp(i)
            x = div(x, i)
            fac += 1
            i -= 1
        end
        i += 1
    end
    fac
end
function puzzle(s)
    liste1 = count_kprimes(1, 2, s)
    liste2 = count_kprimes(3, 4, s)
    liste3 = count_kprimes(7, 2, s)
    soln = 0
    for i1 in liste1
        for i2 in liste2
            if i1 + i2 > s
                break
            end
            for i3 in liste3
                if i1 + i2 + i3 > s
                    break
                elseif i1 + i2 + i3 == s
                    soln += 1
                end
            end
        end
    end
    soln
end
end

module KPrimes
    export count_kprimes
    export puzzle
    function is_prime(x)
        x == 1 && return false
        (x == 2 || x == 3) && return true
        (x%6 != 1 && x%6 != 5) && return false
        for i in 5:√x
            (x%i == 0 || x%(1+2) == 0) && return false
        end
        true
    end
    
    function pfc_count(n)
        result = []
        i = 0
        if n == 1
            push!(result, 1)
            return result
        end
        while i < n
            if is_prime(n)
                push!(result, n)
                return result
            end
            for i in 2:n-1
                if n%i == 0
                    push!(result, i)
                    n ÷= i
                    break
                end
            end
        end
        push!(result, n)
        result
    end
    
    is_k_prime(n, k) = length(pfc_count(n)) == k
    
    function count_kprimes(k, start, nd)
        [i for i in start:nd if is_k_prime(i, k)]
    end
    function puzzle(s)
        s < 128 && return 0
        seven_primes = count_kprimes(7, 128, s)
        max_three_primes = s - findmin(seven_primes)[1]
        three_primes = count_kprimes(3, 8, max_three_primes)
        result = 0
        for p1 in seven_primes
            s_s = s - p1
            for p2 in three_primes
                s_t = s_s - p2
                is_prime(s_t) && (result += 1)
            end
        end
        result
    end
end

module KPrimes
    export count_kprimes
    export puzzle

    function count_kprimes(k, start, nd)
        # your code
        res = []
        for i in start:nd
          val = i
          count = 0
          factor = 3
          while (val % 2 == 0) 
            count += 1
            val = val ÷ 2
          end
          while(val > 1) && (count < k)
            if(val%factor==0)
              count += 1
              val = val ÷ factor
            else
              factor += 2
            end
          end
          if count == k && val == 1
            push!(res, i)
          end
          #println(res)
        end
        return res
    end


    function puzzle(s)
        # your code
        one = count_kprimes(1, 2, s-2)
        three = count_kprimes(3, 2, s-2)
        seven = count_kprimes(7, 2, s-2)
        if (one == []) || (three == []) || (seven == [])
          return(0)
        else
          count = 0
          for i in one
            for j in three
              for k in seven
                if i + j + k == s
                  count += 1
                end
              end
            end
          end
        end
        return(count)
    end
end

function clean_string(s)
  tmp = replace(s,r"[^#]#" => "")
  while s != tmp
    s = tmp
    tmp = replace(s,r"[^#]#" => "")
  end
  replace(s,r"#" => "")
end

function clean_string(s)
    output = ""
    for letter in s
        if letter == '#'
            if length(output) == 0
                continue
            else
                output = chop(output)
            end
        else
            output = output * letter
        end
    end
    output
end

function clean_string(s)
  stack = Char[]
  for c in s
    if c == '#'
      if ~isempty(stack)
        pop!(stack)
      end
    else
      push!(stack, c)
    end
  end
  return String(stack)
end

function clean_string(s)
  # ... your code ...
  ans=[]
  for x in s
    if x=='#' && ans!=[]
      pop!(ans)
    elseif x!='#'
    append!(ans,[x])
    end
  end
  if ans==[]
    return ""
  end
  return join(ans)
end

function clean_string(s)
    clean = [];
    for c in s
        if c == '#'
            if length(clean) > 0
                pop!(clean)
            else
                continue
            end
        else
            append!(clean, c)
        end
    end
    join(clean, "")
end

function clean_string(s)
    while startswith(s, "#")
        s = chop(s, head = 1, tail = 0)
    end
    ss = split(s,"")
    try
        deleteat!(ss, collect(findfirst(isequal("#"), ss)-1:findfirst(isequal("#"), ss)))
    catch
        return join(ss)
    end
    clean_string(join(ss))
end

function clean_string(s)
    ss=split(s,"")
    s2=["" for i=1:length(s)]

    pt=1
    for i=1:length(s)
        if ss[i]!="#"
            s2[pt]=ss[i]
            pt+=1
        else
            pt>1 ? pt-=1 : pt=1
            s2[pt]=""
        end    
    end
    return string(s2...)
end

module Consec
export consec_kprimes

function consec_kprimes(k, arr)
count = 0
  for i in 1:(length(arr) - 1)
    if k_primeness(arr[i]) == k && k_primeness(arr[i + 1]) == k
      count += 1
    end
  end
return count
end
    
#basic primality test
function is_prime(n)
  for i in 2:Int(floor(sqrt(n)))
    if n % i == 0; 
      return false
    end
  end
return n != 1
end    

#counts prime factors
function k_primeness(n)
count = 0
i = 1
  while n % 2 == 0 && n > 1
    n /= 2
    count += 1
  end
  while n > 1
    while i <= n
      if n % i == 0 && is_prime(i); 
        count += 1
        n /= i
        i = 1
      end
      i += 2
    end
  end
return count
end

end

module Consec
  export consec_kprimes
  function consec_kprimes(k, arr)
    m = 0
    for i = 2:length(arr)
      if npf(arr[i]) == k && npf(arr[i-1]) == k
        m = m + 1
      end
    end
    m
  end
  function npf(n)
    m = 0
    i = 2
    while n > 1
      if n % i == 0
        n = n ÷ i
        m = m + 1
        i = 2
      else
        i = i + 1
      end
    end
    m
  end
end

    end

module Consec
    export consec_kprimes
    
    function is_kprime(n,k)
        for i in 2:sqrt(n)
            n%i == 0 && return is_kprime(div(n,i), k-1)
        end
        k == 1 ? true : false
    end

    function consec_kprimes(k, arr)
        kprime, count = Dict(arr[1]=> is_kprime(arr[1], k)), 0
        for i in 1:length(arr)-1 
            kprime[arr[i+1]] = is_kprime(arr[i+1], k)
            if kprime[arr[i]] == true && kprime[arr[i+1]] == true count += 1 end
        end
        count
    end
end

module Consec
    export consec_kprimes
    function consec_kprimes(k, arr)
        p = primes(maximum(arr))
        counter = 0
        if length(arr) < 2
            return 0
        end
        currentkprime = kprime(k, arr[1], p)
        for i in 2:length(arr)
            newkprime = kprime(k, arr[i], p)
            if currentkprime && newkprime
                counter +=1
            end
            currentkprime = newkprime
        end
        return counter
    end

    function kprime(k, n, p)
        # Test if n is k-prime with list of primes p
        for i in 1:k
            for j in p
                if n == 1
                    return false
                elseif n % j == 0
                    n = n ÷ j
                    break
                end
            end
        end
        return n == 1
    end

    function primes(p)
        # sieve of Eratosthenes
        if p > 1
            arr = BitArray(undef, p)
            fill!(arr, 1)
            arr[1] = 0
        else
            return []
        end
        for i = 2:(floor(Int, √(p)))
            if arr[i]
                ip = i^2
                for j in 0:floor(Int, (p - i^2)/i)
                    arr[ip + j*i] = 0
                end
            end
        end
        return findall(arr)
    end
end

module Consec
  export consec_kprimes

  function sieve(n::Int)
    spf = Vector{Int}(undef, n)
    isPrime = trues(n+1)
    isPrime[1] = false;
    for i in 2:n
      !isPrime[i] && continue
      spf[i] = i
      for j in i*i:i:n
        if isPrime[j]
          isPrime[j] = false
          spf[j] = i
        end
      end
    end
    spf
  end

  function getFact(x, spf)
    ret = []
    while x != 1
      push!(ret, spf[x]) 
      x = div(x, spf[x])
    end
    length(ret)
  end

  function consec_kprimes(k, arr)
    sieve(maximum(arr)) |> 
    spf -> [getFact(arr[i], spf) == getFact(arr[i+1], spf) == k for i in 1:length(arr)-1] |> count
  end
end

module Consec
  export consec_kprimes

  function sieve(n::Int)
    spf = Vector{Int}(undef, n)
    isPrime = trues(n+1)
    isPrime[1] = false;
    for i in 2:n
      !isPrime[i] && continue
      spf[i] = i
      for j in i*i:i:n
        if isPrime[j]
          isPrime[j] = false
          spf[j] = i
        end
      end
    end
    spf
  end

  function getFactorization(x, spf)
    ret = []
    while x != 1
      push!(ret, spf[x]) 
      x = div(x, spf[x])
    end
    ret
  end

  function consec_kprimes(k, arr)
    sieve(maximum(arr)) |> 
    spf -> [length(getFactorization(i, spf)) for i in arr]  |> 
    arr -> [arr[i] == arr[i+1] == k for i in 1:length(arr)-1] |> count
  end
end

module Consec
    export consec_kprimes
    function prime_factors(n)
    factor = 2 
    res = []

    while n > 1 
        while n % factor == 0
            n = n / factor 
            push!(res, factor)
        end 
        
        factor = (factor == 2) ? 3 : factor+2
    end 
    
    return res 
end

function consec_kprimes(k, arr)
    kprimes = false
    res = 0
    for x in arr 
        cur = k == length(prime_factors(x))
        if cur && kprimes 
            res += 1
        end 
        kprimes = cur
    end 
    res 
end
end

module Smallest
    export smallest

    function smallest(n)
        swap(digs, i, j) = parse(Int, join(insert!(digs, j, popat!(digs, i))))
        digs = n |> digits |> reverse
        out = [n, 0, 0]
        for i = eachindex(digs), j = eachindex(digs)
            new = i != j ? swap(copy(digs), i, j) : n
            new < out[1] && (out = [new, i-1, j-1])
        end  
        out  
    end
end

module Smallest
    export smallest

    function smallest(n)
        s, mem = string(n), [-1, -1, -1]
        tmp, l = s, length(s)
        for i = 1:l
            c = s[i]
            str1 = s[1:i-1] * s[i + 1:end]
            for j = 1:l
                str2 = str1[1:j-1] * string(c) * str1[j:end]
                if (str2 < tmp)
                    tmp = str2
                    mem = [parse(Int64, tmp), i-1, j-1]
                end
            end
        end
        if (mem[1] == -1)
            mem = [n, 0, 0]
        end
        mem
    end
end

module Smallest
    export smallest

    function smallest(num::Int64)
        # 
        vec_int = reverse(digits(num))
        if length(unique(vec_int)) == 1
            return [num, 0, 0]
        end
        len = length(vec_int)
        val_list = Int64[]
        cut_list = Int64[] # 1-based
        ins_list = Int64[] # 1-based
        for cut in 1:len
            temp_cut_number = vec_int[cut]
            temp_ins_index = deleteat!([1:len;], cut)
            temp_ins_number = vec_int[temp_ins_index]
            for ins in temp_ins_index
                temp_inserted = deepcopy(temp_ins_number)
                temp_res = insert!(temp_inserted, ins, temp_cut_number)
                temp_int = parse(Int64, join(temp_res))
                append!(val_list, temp_int)
                append!(cut_list, cut)
                append!(ins_list, ins)
            end
        end
        # 
        min_val = minimum(val_list)
        # 
        min_index = findall(val -> val == min_val, val_list)
        # 
        min_amount = length(min_index)
        if min_amount == 1
            cut_index = only(min_index)
            # 1-based to 0-based
            return [min_val, cut_list[cut_index]-1, ins_list[cut_index]-1]
        else
            # 
            (_ , index) = findmin(cut_list[min_index])
            cut_index = min_index[index]
            # 1-based to 0-based
            return [min_val, cut_list[cut_index]-1, ins_list[cut_index]-1]
        end
    end
end

module Smallest
    export smallest

    """
    Given a positive integer n, re-arranging the digits to find the lowest positive integer possible such that only one digit's position is changed.
    
    Returns an array or a tuple or a string depending on the language (see "Sample Tests") with
    
        - the smallest number you got
        - the index d of the digit d you took, d as small as possible
        - the index idx (as small as possible) where you insert this digit d to have the smallest number.
    """
    function smallest(n)
        ### careful!
        ### indexing of input is calculated based on 0
        ### julia works with indexing based on 1
    
        # get all the digits
        arr = reverse(digits(n))
    
        # initialise objective values
        best_int = n
        best_d = 0 # digit of n to be changed
        best_idx = 0 # resulting index of digit d
    
        # exhaustive search to check every possible resulting value 
        for d = 1:length(arr) # loop over each digit in n
            for idx = 1:length(arr) # loop over each changeable index
                
                # modify the order of n
                arr_mod = arr[1:end .!= d] # extract all unchanged digits
                insert!(arr_mod, idx, arr[d]) # change position of digit d
                
                # check newly created positive integer whether lower then best found value
                cur_val = parse(Int64, join(arr_mod))
                if cur_val < best_int # if lowere
    
                    # update
                    best_int = cur_val
                    best_d = d - 1 ### careful! indexing changed
                    best_idx = idx - 1 ### to fit testing
    
                end 
            end
        end
    
        return [best_int, best_d, best_idx]
    end
end

module Smallest
    export smallest

    function smallest(n)
        swap(digs, i, j) = parse(Int, join(insert!(digs, j, popat!(digs, i))))
        digs = n |> digits |> reverse
        out = [n, 0, 0]
        for i = eachindex(digs), j = eachindex(digs)
            new = i != j ? swap(copy(digs), i, j) : n
            new < out[1] && (out[1] = new; out[2] = i-1; out[end] = j-1)
        end  
        out  
    end

end

module Smallest
    export smallest

    function smallest(n)
        d = parse.(Int, split(string(n), ""))
        dlen = length(d)
        smallest = n*100
        ismallest = 0
        jsmallest = 0
        for i in 1:dlen
            s = d[1:i-1]
            m = [d[i]]
            e = d[i+1:dlen]
            for j in 1:dlen
                t = vcat(s,e)
                sj = t[1:j-1]
                ej = t[j:end]
                k = vcat(sj,m,ej)
                l = parse(Int, join(string.(k)))
                if l < smallest
                    smallest = l
                    ismallest = i
                    jsmallest = j
                end
            end
        end
        return [smallest, ismallest-1, jsmallest-1]
    end
end

module Smallest
    export smallest

    function smallest(n)
        smallest = n
        n = "$n"
        ivalue = 0
        jvalue = 0
        for i in 1:length(n)
          tempn = n[1:i-1] * n[i+1:end]
          for j in 1:length(n)
            if parse(Int, tempn[1:j-1] * n[i] * tempn[j:end]) < smallest
              smallest = parse(Int, tempn[1:j-1] * n[i] * tempn[j:end])
              ivalue = i-1
              jvalue = j-1
            end
          end
        end
        [smallest, ivalue, jvalue]
    end
end

module Smallest
    export smallest

    function swapped(dgts, moveidx, insertionpoint)
        d = copy(dgts)
        dgttomove = splice!(d, moveidx)
        insert!(d, insertionpoint, dgttomove)
        parse(Int, join(d))
    end

    function smallest(n)
        dgts = reverse(digits(n))
        best_swap = [Inf, 0, 0]

        for from in 1:length(dgts)
            for to in 1:length(dgts)
                from == to && from != 1 && continue
                swap = swapped(dgts, from, to)
                if swap < best_swap[1]
                    best_swap = [swap, from-1, to-1]
                end
            end
        end

        best_swap
    end

end

module Smallest
    export smallest
    
    function getSwappedValue(arr, i, j)
      temp = splice!(arr, i)
      insert!(arr, j, temp)
      parse(Int, join(arr))
    end

    function smallest(n)
      minValue = n
      swapIndices = [1, 1]
      digitArr = reverse(digits(n))
      for i = 1:length(digitArr)
        for j = 1:length(digitArr)
          if i == j continue end
          value = getSwappedValue(copy(digitArr), i, j)
          if value < minValue
            minValue = value
            swapIndices[1] = i
            swapIndices[2] = j
          end
        end
      end
      [minValue, swapIndices[1] - 1, swapIndices[2] - 1]
    end
end

module Smallest
    export smallest

    function smallest(n)
        str_num = string(n)
        min_num, x, y = n, 0, 0
        for i in 1:length(str_num)
            for j in 1:length(str_num)
                new_str = Vector{Char}(str_num)
                insert_num = new_str[i]
                deleteat!(new_str, i)
                insert!(new_str, j, insert_num)
                new_num = parse(Int, join(new_str))
                if new_num < min_num
                    min_num = new_num
                    x = i-1
                    y = j-1
                end
            end
        end
        [min_num, x, y]
    end
end

573d498eb90ccf20a000002a.body: decode(string) = join("5987604321"[findfirst(isequal(x), split("0123456789", ""))] for x in split(string, ""))

function decode(str)
    letters = split(str,"")
    non_repeat = unique!(split(str,""))
    for i in range(1,length(letters), step = 1)
        if letters[i] != "5" && letters[i] != "0"
            letters[i] = string(10 - parse(Int64, letters[i]))
        else
            letters[i] = string(5 - parse(Int64, letters[i]))
        end
    end
    return join(letters)
end

module JohnAnn
    export john_ann, john, ann, sum_john, sum_ann
  
function learn_kata(n)
    a = [1]
    j = [0]

    for k in 2:n
        u = a[k-1] + 1
        v = j[k-1] + 1
        push!(j, k - 1 - a[v])
        push!(a, k - 1 - j[u])
    end

    return a, j, sum(a), sum(j)
end




function john(n)
    learn_kata(n)[2]
end

function ann(n)
    learn_kata(n)[1]
end

function sum_john(n)
    learn_kata(n)[4]
end

function sum_ann(n)
    learn_kata(n)[3]
end
end

module JohnAnn
    export john_ann, john, ann, sum_john, sum_ann

    function lets_do_brute_force(n, ann = true)
        a, j = [1], [0]
        for i in 1:n-1
            push!(j, i-a[j[i]+1])
            push!(a, i-j[a[i]+1])
        end
        ann ? a : j
    end

    function john(n)
        lets_do_brute_force(n, false)
    end

    function ann(n)
        lets_do_brute_force(n)
    end

    function sum_john(n)
        sum(lets_do_brute_force(n, false))
    end

    function sum_ann(n)

    end
end

module JohnAnn
    export john_ann, john, ann, sum_john, sum_ann
  
    function john(n)
      walk(n)[2]
    end

    function ann(n)
      walk(n)[1]
    end

    function sum_john(n)
       walk(n)[4]
    end

    function sum_ann(n)
       walk(n)[3]
    end

    function walk(n)
      xs = [0]
      ys = [1]
      xsum = 0
      ysum = 1
      for i in 1:n-1
        x1 = xs[i]
        x2 = ys[x1 + 1]
        push!(xs, i - x2)
        y1 = ys[i]
        y2 = xs[y1 + 1]
        push!(ys, i - y2)
        xsum += i - x2
        ysum += i - y2
      end
      [ys, xs, ysum, xsum]
    end
end

module JohnAnn
export john_ann, john, ann, sum_john, sum_ann

johnKatas = [0]
annKatas = [1]

function getAnn(n)
  if n > length(annKatas)
    for i = length(annKatas):n
      push!(annKatas, i - getJohn(annKatas[i] + 1))
    end
  end
  annKatas[n]
end

function getJohn(n)
  if n > length(johnKatas)
    for i = length(johnKatas):n
      push!(johnKatas, i - getAnn(johnKatas[i] + 1))
    end
  end
  johnKatas[n]
end

function john(n)
  getJohn(n)
  johnKatas[1:n]
end

function ann(n)
  getAnn(n)
  annKatas[1:n]
end

function sum_john(n)
  getJohn(n)
  sum(johnKatas[1:n])
end

function sum_ann(n)
  getAnn(n)
  sum(annKatas[1:n])
end

end

module JohnAnn
    export john_ann, john, ann, sum_john, sum_ann
    function john_ann(n)
        john_list = [0]; ann_list = [1]
        if n == 0 
            return [[0], [1]] 
        end
        i = 2
        while i < n
            j = john_list[i - 1]
            a1 = j == 0 ? 1 : ann_list[j]
            push!(john_list, i - a1)
            a = ann_list[i - 1]
            j1 = john_list[a]
            push!(ann_list, i - j1)
            i += 1
        end
        [pushfirst!(john_list, 0), pushfirst!(ann_list, 1)]
    end

    function john(n)
        john_ann(n)[1]
    end

    function ann(n)
        john_ann(n)[2]
    end

    function sum_john(n)
        sum(john_ann(n)[1])
    end

    function sum_ann(n)
        sum(john_ann(n)[2])
    end
end

module JohnAnn

    a = [1]

    for i in 2:n
        append!(j, i - 1 - a[j[i-1]+1])
        append!(a, i - 1 - j[a[i-1]+1])
    end
    return [a, j]
    
end

function john(n)

end

function ann(n)
    return aj(n)[1]
end

    return sum(john(n))
end

function sum_ann(n)
    return sum(ann(n))
end

end

function j_a(n, john)
    j, a = zeros(Int, n), ones(Int, n)
     
    for i in 2:n
       j[i], a[i] = i-a[j[i-1]+1]-1, i-j[a[i-1]+1]-1
    end
    john?j:a

end

     j_a(n,false)

    end
    out = Vector{String}(undef, nfloors)

    for n in 0:(nfloors-1)

  end

function count_positives_sum_negatives(input)
  
  if input == []
    return []
  else
    return([count(>(0), input),sum(filter(<(0),input))])
  end
  
end

function count_positives_sum_negatives(input)
  if length(input) == 0 
    return []
  else
    return [length(input[input .> 0]) , sum(input[input .< 0])]
  end 
end

function count_positives_sum_negatives(input)
  if length(input) == 0
    return []
  end
  pos = Vector{Int}()
  neg = Vector{Int}()
  for i in input
    if i > 0
      push!(pos, i)
    elseif i <= 0
      push!(neg, i)
    end
  end

  return [length(pos), sum(neg)]
end

function count_positives_sum_negatives(input)
  if input == []
    return []
  else  
    return [count(x->x>0, input), filter(x->x<0, input) |> sum]
  end
end

function count_positives_sum_negatives(input)
  if input == []
    return input
  end
  n_cnt, p_cnt = 0, 0
  for i in input
    if i < 0
      n_cnt += i
    elseif i > 0
      p_cnt += 1
    end
  end
  [p_cnt, n_cnt]
end

module Fibo
    export length_sup_u_k, comp

    U = [1, 1]
    
    function grow_U_to_n(n)
        for i in length(U)+1:n
            push!(U, U[i-U[i-1]]+U[i-U[i-2]])
        end
    end
    function length_sup_u_k(n, k)
        grow_U_to_n(n)
        length([i for i in 1:n if U[i]>=k])
    end
    function comp(n)
        grow_U_to_n(n)
        length([U[i] for i in 3:n if U[i]<U[i-1]])
    end

end

module Fibo
    export length_sup_u_k, comp

    u_cache = Dict{Int,Int}()

    function u(n)
      if haskey(u_cache,n) return u_cache[n] end
      
      if n==1 || n==2
          global u_cache[n]=1
          return 1 
      end

      a,b = u(n-1),u(n-2)
      f = u(n-a) + u(n-b)
      global u_cache[n] = f
      return f  
    end

    function length_sup_u_k(n, k)
      sum([1 for i in 1:n if u(i)>=k])
    end

    function comp(n)
      p = [u(i) for i in 1:n]
      foldl((a,i)-> a + ifelse(p[i]<p[i-1],1,0), 2:n; init=0)
    end

end

module Fibo
    export length_sup_u_k, comp, u

    function length_sup_u_k(n, k)
        r = u_range(n)
        return filter(x -> x ≥ k,r) |> length
    end
    function comp(n)
        r = u_range(n)
        cnt = 0
        a = r[1]
        for b in r[2:end]
            if a>b
                cnt += 1
            end
            a = b
        end
        return cnt
    end

    function u_range(n)
      r = zeros(Int64,n)
        for i in 1:n
            r[i] = u(i,r)
        end
      return r
    end

    function u(n, r=[])
        if !isempty(r)
            if r[n] > 0
                return r[n]
            end
        end
        if n < 3
            return 1
        else
          return u(n-u(n-1,r),r) + u(n-u(n-2,r),r)
        end
    end

end

module Fibo
    export length_sup_u_k, comp

    function length_sup_u_k(n, k)
        u, count = [1, 1], 0
        for i in 3:n
            push!(u, u[i-u[end]]+u[i-u[end-1]])
            u[end] ≥ k && (count += 1)
        end
        count
    end
    function comp(n)
        u, count = [1, 1], 0
        for i in 3:n
            push!(u, u[i-u[end]]+u[i-u[end-1]])
            u[end] < u[end-1] && (count += 1)
        end
        count
    end

end

module Fibo
    export length_sup_u_k, comp

    function f(n)
      ret = [1,1]
      for i in 3:n
        push!(ret, ret[i-ret[end]]+ret[i-ret[end-1]])
      end
      return ret
    end

    function length_sup_u_k(n, k)
        sum(x>=k ? 1 : 0 for x in f(n))
    end
    function comp(n)
        fs = f(n)
        return sum(fs[k]<fs[k-1] ? 1 : 0 for k in 2:n)
    end

end

module Fibo
    export length_sup_u_k, comp
    function f(n)
      v=[1,1]
      for i in 3:n
        push!(v,v[i-v[i-1]]+v[i-v[i-2]])
      end
      return v
    end
    function length_sup_u_k(n, k)
      return length(filter(x -> x >= k, f(n)))
    end
    function comp(n)
      v = f(n)
      return sum([1 for (i,n) in enumerate(v) if i > 1 && n < v[i-1]])
    end
end

module Fibo
    export length_sup_u_k, comp

    memo = Dict(1=>1, 2=>1)

    function length_sup_u_k(n, k)
        ret = 0
        for i in 1:n
            if !haskey(memo, i)
                memo[i] = memo[i - memo[i-1]] + memo[i - memo[i-2]]
            end
            if memo[i] >= k ret += 1 end
        end
        ret
    end

    function comp(n)
        ret = 0
        for i in 3:n
            if !haskey(memo, i)
                memo[i] = memo[i - memo[i-1]] + memo[i - memo[i-2]]
            end
            if memo[i] < memo[i-1] ret += 1 end
        end
        ret
    end

end

module Fibo
    export length_sup_u_k, comp
    
    memory = Dict(1 => 1, 2 => 1)

    function u(n)
      if haskey(memory, n)
        return memory[n]
      else
        global memory[n] = u(n - u(n - 1)) + u(n - u(n - 2))
        return memory[n]
      end
    end

    function length_sup_u_k(n, k)
      count = 0
      for i in 1:n
        u(i) >= k && (count += 1)  
      end
      count
    end

    function comp(n)
        count = 0
        for i in 1:n-1
          u(i) > u(i+1) && (count += 1)
        end
        count
    end

end

module Fibo
    export length_sup_u_k, comp

    function length_sup_u_k(n, k)
        m = 0
        map = seq(n)
        for x in values(map)
            if x >= k
                m += 1
            end
        end
        m
    end

    function comp(n)
        m = 0
        map = seq(n)
        for i in keys(map)
            if i > 1 && map[i] < map[i - 1]
                m += 1
            end
        end
        m
    end

    function seq(n)
        map = Dict(0 => 1, 1 => 1, 2 => 1)
        i = 3
        while i <= n
            map[i] = map[i - map[i - 1]] + map[i - map[i - 2]]
            i += 1
        end
        map
    end

end

function xmastree(n::Int)::Array{String,1}
  tree = []
  for i in 0:n+1
    pattern = (i < n) ? "_" ^ (n-1-i) * "#" ^ (i) : "_" ^ (n-1)
    push!(tree, join([pattern, "#", reverse(pattern)], ""))
  end
  tree
end

module RLE
export encode, decode

function encode(input)
  lc = '\0'
  ln = 0
  res = []
  for c in input
    if c == lc
      ln += 1
    else
      lc != '\0' && push!(res, (lc, ln))
      lc = c
      ln = 1
    end
  end
  push!(res, (lc, ln))
  join(string(n, c) for (c, n) in res)
end
function decode(input)
  res = [('\0', 0)]
  for c in input
    tup = res[end]
    if isdigit(c)
      res[end] = (tup[1], tup[2] * 10 + Int(c) - Int('0'))
    else
      res[end] = (c, tup[2])
      push!(res, ('\0', 0))
    end
  end
  join(c ^ n for (c, n) in res[1:end-1])
end

end#module

module RLE
export encode, decode

function enc(inp, pos)
    counter = 1
    if pos == length(inp)
        return ("$(counter)$(inp[pos])" , pos+1)
    else
        for i in pos:length(inp)-1
            if inp[i] == inp[i+1]
                counter += 1
            else
                break
            end
        end
    end
    return  ("$(counter)$(inp[pos])" , pos + counter)
end

function dec(inp, pos)
    n = ""
    for i in pos:length(inp)
        if isdigit(inp[i])
            n = n*inp[i]
        else
            return inp[i]^parse(Int, n), i + 1
        end
    end
end



function encode(input)
    a = []
    i = 1
    while i <= length(input)
        c, p = enc(input, i)
        push!(a, c)
        i = p
    end
    return join(a, "")
end

function decode(input)
    a = []
    i = 1
    while i <=length(input)
        c, p = dec(input, i)
        push!(a, c)
        i = p
    end
    return join(a, "")

end


end#module

function queue_time(customer_times, num_tills)
    total_time = 0
    empty_queue = false
    tills = zeros(num_tills)
    while !empty_queue
        tills, customer_times = move_to_zeros(tills, customer_times)
        empty_queue = length(customer_times) == 0 ? true : false
        if empty_queue
            break
        end
        timestep = minimum(tills)
        total_time += timestep
        tills .-= timestep
    end
    total_time += maximum(tills)
    return total_time
end


function move_to_zeros(move_to, move_from)
    zeros = [index for (index, value) in enumerate(move_to) if (value == 0)]
    if length(zeros) == 0 # no moves need to be made
        return (move_to, move_from)
    end
    max_moves = min(length(zeros), length(move_from))
    zeros = zeros[1:max_moves]
    move_to[zeros] = move_from[1:max_moves]
    return (move_to, move_from[max_moves+1:end])
end

function queue_time(customers, n)
  
  isempty(customers) && return 0
  
  tills = zeros(n)
  
  customers = reverse(customers)
  
  while !(isempty(customers))
    tills[1] += pop!(customers)
    tills = sort(tills)
  end
  
  max(tills...)
  
end

function queue_time(customers, n)
  
  if customers == []
    return 0
  end
  
  customers = reverse(customers)
  
  checkOut = [pop!(customers) for _ in 1:min([length(customers),n]...)]
  
  lenCust = length(customers)
  counter = 0
  
  while lenCust > 0
    for (index, elem) in enumerate(checkOut)
      if elem == 0 && length(customers) > 0
        checkOut[index] = pop!(customers)
        lenCust -= 1
      end
    end
    counter += 1
    checkOut .-= 1
  end
  
  counter + max(checkOut...)
  
end

function queue_time(customers, n)
  isempty(customers) && return 0
  counters = zeros(n)
  while !isempty(customers)
    idx = findfirst(isequal(minimum(counters)), counters)
    counters[idx] += popat!(customers, 1)
  end
  maximum(counters)
end

function queue_time(customers, n)
    tills = zeros(Int, n)
    foreach(custy-> tills[argmin(tills)] += custy, customers)
    maximum(tills)
end

function queue_time(customers, n)
  if n == 0
    return 0
  end
  tills = zeros(n)
  while length(customers) != 0
    tills[1] += popfirst!(customers)
    sort!(tills)
  end
  max(tills...)
end

function queue_time(customers::Vector{I}, tillsopen::Integer)::I where I <: Integer
    tills = zeros(I, tillsopen)
    for c in customers
        tills[argmin(tills)] += c
    end
    maximum(tills)
end
queue_time(cs::Vector{Any}, _) = isempty(cs) ? 0 : throw("Bad input")

function decode_resistor_colors(bands)::String
  tolr="20%"
  resfin=""
  
  colors=Dict(["black"=> 0, "brown"=> 1, "red"=> 2, "orange"=> 3,
          "yellow"=> 4, "green"=> 5, "blue"=> 6, "violet"=> 7,
          "gray"=> 8, "white"=> 9,
          "silver"=>"10%", "gold"=>"5%"])
  
  resistance=[colors[b] for b in split(bands," ")]
  
  if typeof(resistance[end])==String
      tolr=pop!(resistance)
  end
  
  res=sum([r*10^(i-1) for (i,r) in enumerate(resistance[end-1:-1:1])])*(10^resistance[end])
  
  if res/10^6>=1
      resfin="$(res%10^6==0 ? Int(ceil(res/10^6)) : res/10^6)M ohms, $(tolr)"
  elseif res/10^3>=1
      resfin="$(res%10^3==0 ? Int(ceil(res/10^3)) : res/10^3)k ohms, $(tolr)"
  else
      resfin="$(res) ohms, $(tolr)"
  end
  return resfin
end

function decode_resistor_colors(bands)::String
  colors = ["black", "brown", "red", "orange", "yellow", "green", "blue", "violet", "gray", "white"]
  s = split(bands)
  d = Dict(colors[i] => i-1 for i in 1:length(colors))
  ohms = (10*d[s[1]] + d[s[2]]) * 10^d[s[3]]
  tol = length(s) == 3 ? 20 : s[4] == "gold" ? 5 : 10
  if ohms < 1000
    ohms = ohms == trunc(Int, ohms) ? trunc(Int, ohms) : ohms
    return "$(ohms) ohms, $(tol)%"
  elseif ohms < 1000000
    ohms /= 1000
    ohms = ohms == trunc(Int, ohms) ? trunc(Int, ohms) : ohms
    return "$(ohms)k ohms, $(tol)%"
  else
    ohms /= 1000000
    ohms = ohms == trunc(Int, ohms) ? trunc(Int, ohms) : ohms
    return "$(ohms)M ohms, $(tol)%"
  end
end

function decode_resistor_colors(bands)::String

  s = split(bands)
  ohms = (10*(findfirst(isequal(s[1]), colors) - 1) + findfirst(isequal(s[2]), colors) - 1) * 
          10^(findfirst(isequal(s[3]), colors) - 1)
  tol = length(s) == 3 ? 20 : s[4] == "gold" ? 5 : 10
  if ohms < 1000
    ohms = ohms == trunc(Int, ohms) ? trunc(Int, ohms) : ohms
    return "$(ohms) ohms, $(tol)%"

    return "$(ohms)k ohms, $(tol)%"

    return "$(ohms)M ohms, $(tol)%"
  end
end

function decode_resistor_colors(bands)::String
  vcodes = Dict("black"=>0, "brown"=>1, "red"=>2, "orange"=>3, "yellow"=>4, 
                "green"=>5, "blue"=>6, "violet"=>7, "gray"=>8, "white"=>9)
  tcodes = Dict("gold"=>5, "silver"=>10)
  colors = split(bands)
  val = (vcodes[colors[1]]*10+vcodes[colors[2]])*10^vcodes[colors[3]]
  if val<1e3; sval = "$val"
  elseif val<1e6; sval = "$(val%1e3==0? div(val, 1000): val/1e3)k"
  else; sval = "$(val%1e6==0? div(val, 1000000): val/1e6)M"
  end
  "$sval ohms, $(length(colors)>3? tcodes[colors[4]]: 20)%"
end

function decode_resistor_colors(bands::String)::String
  bs = split(bands, " ")
  cs = Dict("black"=>0, "brown"=>1, "red"=>2, "orange"=>3, "yellow"=>4,
    "green"=>5, "blue"=>6, "violet"=>7, "gray"=>8, "white"=>9)
  wf(x) = x % 1 == 0 ? Int(floor(x)) : x
  n = (cs[bs[1]] * 10 + cs[bs[2]]) * 10 ^ cs[bs[3]]
  s = string(wf(n))
  if n > 999999 
    s = string(wf(n / 1000000)) * "M"
  elseif n > 999 
    s = string(wf(n / 1000)) * "k"
  end
  s *= " ohms, "
  if length(bs) == 3
    s *= "20%"
  elseif bs[4] == "gold"
    s *= "5%"
  elseif bs[4] == "silver" 
    s *= "10%"
  end
  return s
end

function move_ten(s::AbstractString)::String
    ascii_upper = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ"
    ascii_lower = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
    ns = []
    for char in s
        if isletter(char)
            idx = findfirst(isequal(char), ascii_lower)
            if idx == nothing
                idx = findfirst(isequal(char), ascii_upper)
                idx = idx + 10 == 26 ? 26 : mod(idx + 10, 26)
                push!(ns, ascii_upper[idx])
            else
                idx = idx + 10 == 26 ? 26 : mod(idx + 10, 26)
                push!(ns, ascii_lower[idx])
            end
        else
            push!(ns, char)
        end
    end
    join(ns, "")
end

function move_ten(s::AbstractString)::String
  sout = ""
  for c in s
    n = Int(c) + 10
    n ≤ Int('z') || (n = n - Int('z') + Int('a') - 1)
    sout *= Char(n)
  end

  return sout
end

  o=""

function vowel_back(s::AbstractString)::String
    dictalpha=Dict(char => num for (num,char) in zip(1:26,'a':'z'))
    dictnum=Dict(num => char for (num,char) in zip(1:26,'a':'z'))
    vowels=['a','e','i','o','u']
    res=""
    
    for char in s
        if char == 'c'
            res *= 'b'
        elseif char == 'o'
            res *= 'n'
        elseif char == 'd' || char == 'e'
            res *= 'a'
        elseif (contains((*)(vowels...),char) && contains("code",dictnum[mod(dictalpha[char]-5,26)==0 ? 26 : mod(dictalpha[char]-5,26)])) || (!(contains((*)(vowels...),char)) &&contains("code",dictnum[mod(dictalpha[char]+9,26)==0 ? 26 : mod(dictalpha[char]+9,26)]))
            res *= char    
        elseif contains((*)(vowels...),char)
            res *= dictnum[mod(dictalpha[char]-5,26)==0 ? 26 : mod(dictalpha[char]-5,26)]
        else
            res *= dictnum[mod(dictalpha[char]+9,26)==0 ? 26 : mod(dictalpha[char]+9,26)]
        end    
    end
    res
end

  d=b*b-4*a*c
  if d < 0
    return nothing
  end
  if a==0
    if b==0
      return nothing
    end
    return -c/b
  end
  return round(-b/a;digits=2)

  if a == 0
    return nothing
  elseif (b^2 - 4*a*c) < 0
    return nothing
  else
    return round(-b/a,digits=2)
  end
end

function roots(a, b, c)
  b^2 - 4a*c < 0 && return nothing
  round(-b/a, digits=2)
end

# Quadratic formula: x = (-b +- sqrt(b^2-4ac))/2a
# Sum of both solutions: sqrt() cancels out --> x1+x2 = -b/a

function roots(a, b, c)

end
valid_solutions_exist(a,b,c) = b^2-4a*c >= 0 #Squareroot is only valid if argument >=0

  sick = 0
  for i = 2:length(sea)
    sea[i] == sea[i-1] || (sick += 1)
  end
  sick/length(sea) > 0.2 ? "Throw Up" : "No Problem"
end

function sea_sick(s::String)::String
  xs = collect(s)
  size = length(s)
  t = 0.2
  peaks = 0
  prev = nothing
  i = 1
  while i <= size
    x = string(xs[i])
    if (x == "~" && prev == "_") || (prev == "~" && x == "_")
      peaks = peaks + 1
    end
    if x == "_" || x == "~"
      prev = x
    end
    i = i + 1
  end
  if peaks / size <= t
    return "No Problem"
  else
    return "Throw Up"
  end
end

function inside_outword(x)
  n = length(x)
  chars = collect(x)
  midl = fld(n, 2)
  midr = fld(n+3, 2)
  @views begin reverse!(chars[begin:midl]); reverse!(chars[midr:end]) end
  return chars
end

function inside_out(x)
  words = split(x)
  join((join(inside_outword(word)) for word in words), " ")
end

function inside_out(x)
  join((string(
      reverse(w[1:end÷2]),
      w[end÷2+1:(end+1)÷2],
      reverse(w[(end+1)÷2+1:end])) for w in split(x, " ")), " ")
end

function inside_out(x)
    flip(w) = iseven(length(w)) ? vcat(reverse(w[1:length(w)÷2]),reverse(w[length(w)÷2+1:end])) : vcat(reverse(w[1:length(w)÷2]),w[length(w)÷2+1],reverse(w[length(w)÷2+2:end]))
    join(join.(flip.(collect.(split(x)))), " ")
end

function stray(numbers)
  tmp = sort(numbers)
  tmp[1] == tmp[2] ? tmp[end] : tmp[1]
end

function stray(numbers)
  counts = Dict{Int, Int}()
  
  # populate the dictionary
  for n in numbers
    if haskey(counts, n)
      counts[n] += 1
    else
      counts[n] = 1
    end

    # design is to short circuit the evaluation of stray, which does not affect
    # worst case asymptotic analysis (worst case: last element is the stray).
    if length(counts) == 2 && sum(values(counts)) > 2
      for (k, v) in pairs(counts)
        if v == 1
          return k
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

function stray(numbers)
  mn = minimum(numbers)
  mx = maximum(numbers)
  if count(x -> x == mn, numbers) == 1
    return mn
  else
    return mx
  end
end

function stray(numbers)
  len = size(numbers)[1]
  sort!(numbers)
  return numbers[1] == numbers[2] ? numbers[len] : numbers[1]
end

function stray(n)
  if n[1] != n[2]
    if n[2] != n[3]
      return n[2]
    else
      return n[1]
    end
  end
  for i in 3:length(n)

function trouble(x, t)
  if x == []
    return x
  end
  ret = [x[1]]
  for i in x[2:end]
    if ret[end] + i != t
      push!(ret, i)
    end
  end
  ret
end

function trouble(x, t)
    indx = findfirst(==(t), sum.(zip(x, x[2:end])))
    isnothing(indx) ? x : trouble(deleteat!(x, indx+1), t)
end

function trouble(xs, t)
  r = []
  for x in xs
    if length(r) == 0 || last(r) + x != t
      append!(r, x)
    end
  end
  r
end

function trouble(x, t)
    isempty(x) && return empty(x)
    head, tail = Iterators.peel(x)
    result = [head]
    for v in tail
        if last(result) + v != t
            push!(result, v)
        end
    end
    result
end
